loans.name: Kamila

texts.ru: Камила, 48 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Камилы - средне-специальное образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 1999 году с покупки скота на 7,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Камилы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 9 коров, 20 овец, 2 лошади. На ежедневной основе продает молоко, также на 2,26 Га земли она выращивает люцерну. Ежемесячный доход составляет 41,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Камила обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота и объемов реализации экологически чистого молока. Доходы от кредита Камила планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и ремонт хозяйственных построек.
texts.en:
Kamila is 48 years old and married.  She and her husband are raising three children.  She has a specialized secondary education and is involved in animal husbandry and agriculture, two activities which constitute her family's main source of income.  She started her own business in 1999 when she bought her first livestock for 7,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently has nine cows, 20 sheep and two horses on her farm.  She sells milk on a daily basis and also grows alfalfa on 2.26 hectares of land.  Her monthly income comes up to 41,000 som (KGS).

In order to further grow her farming business, Kamila has turned to Bai Tushum Bank and requested a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy a few cows.  This loan will allow her to increase her cattle headcount and to sell larger volumes of organic milk.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further increase the size of her herd and to repair her farm buildings.

loans.use: to buy a few dairy cows in order to sell larger volumes of organic milk.

loans.name: Jeannette Del Carmen

texts.es:
JENNETTE  DE 55 AÑOS DE EDAD, SOLTERA CON DOS HIJOS MENORES DE EDAD, LOS CUALES ESTAN ESTUDIANDO, SE CARACACTERIZAN POR SER TRABAJADORES, RESPONSABLES, CON GANAS DE SUPERACION PERSONAL, EN SUS RATOS LIBRE LES GUSTA DISFRUTAR DE LA COMPANIA DE SUS HIJOS EN LA ACTUALIDAD LUCHA DIA A DIA PARA BRINDARLES A SUS HIJOS LAS OPORTUNIDADES QUE NECESITAN.
GRACIAS  A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONOMICA LA VENTA DE COMIDA RAPIDA COMO  HOT DOT, HAMBURGUESA, PAPAS FRITAS, JUGOS, REFRESCOS NATURALES, GASEOSAS ETC . ELLA DEDICA A SU NEGOCIO UNAS DOCE HORAS DIARIAS OFRECIENDO SUS PRODUCTOS PARA QUE EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO PUEDA OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS. JEANNETTE AGRADECE LA AYUADA QUE  LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAISES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
Jeannette is 55 years old. She is single with two minor children, who are in school. She is known for being hard-working and responsible, with the will for personal achievement. In her free time, she likes to enjoy the company of her children. Now she works day after day to offer her children the opportunities that they need.

Thanks to her will to get ahead, she has a business of selling fast food such as hot dogs, hamburgers, french fries, juices, natural soft drinks, carbonated beverages, etc. She works in her business some twelve hours a day, offering her products so that in the not-too-distant future she can obtain better income. Jeannette is grateful for the help that the Kiva investors offer to people of scarce resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua so that they can have a means of dignified work.

loans.use: to buy fast food such as hot dogs, hamburgers, natural soft drinks, juices, carbonated beverages, etc.

loans.name: Jose Roberto

texts.es:
José, de 48 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está acompañado, tienen seis hijos porque son mayores de edad y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

José, desde hace ocho años trabaja con su carro, porque hace viajes a varias partes del municipio y a la ciudad, el decidió comprar su vehículo porque tenía pequeños a sus hijos y ahora su hijo le ayuda a manejar cuando le salen varios viajes.

José, necesita el préstamo para comprar una corona para su vehículo, porque si no lo repara no podrá trabajar y perderá dinero que le servirá a sus hijos. 

José, sueña con tener en buen estado su vehículo, el cual es la fuente de ingreso para él y su familia.
texts.en:
José, 48, studied up to sixth grade. He's in a common-law marriage. He has six adult children and his wife is a homemaker.

José has worked with his car for eight years. He makes trips to various parts of town and the city. He decided to buy his vehicle when his children were young, and now his son helps him drive when he has several trips to make.

José needs the loan to buy a transmission ring for his vehicle because if he doesn't repair it he won't be able to work and he'll lose money that would help his children.

José dreams of having his vehicle in good condition. It's his source of income for his family.

loans.use: to buy a transmission ring for his vehicle

loans.name: Yakubu

texts.en:
Yakubu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Yakubu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land (5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer).

Before joining Babban Gona, Yakubu would have had to sell his maize at harvest - a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market - to meet his immediate cash needs for food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Yakubu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Yakubu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Yakubu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Anabella

texts.en:
Anabella is a housewife and the mother of two children, ages 8 and 10. She is 42 years old and married to a man who is a fisherman. Anabella puts her time to good use by running a sari-sari store business. She sells basic grocery items like toothpaste, shampoo, coffee, sugar, bath soap, detergent and seasoning. She also helps her husband with things that he needs for their fishing business.

Anabella is asking for a loan to buy more items to sell such as toothpaste, shampoo, insect repellent, canned sardines, seasoning, detergent powder, soy sauce, vinegar, bath soap, feed, rice, fishing nets and fishing weights. This will lead to an increase in her sales and allow her husband to enhance his catch. All their work will be for the children's future through schooling and nutritious food for the family.

loans.use: to buy toothpaste, shampoo, insect repellent, canned sardines, seasoning, detergent powder, soy sauce, vinegar,  bath soap, feed, rice, fishing nets and fishing weights

loans.name: Sandra Mabel

texts.es:
Sandra, de 22 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, es madre soltera y tiene  2 hijos que depende económicamente de ella. 

Sandra, se dedica a la venta de tamales una vez por semana, este negocio lo tiene desde hace 8 años y los tamales los vende sábados y domingo.

Sandra, necesita el préstamo para comprar maíz, frijoles, hojas de huerta, entre otros insumos para la elaboración de tamales.

Sandra, sueña con construir su propia casa y tener un trabajo fijo para suplir las necesidades de sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Sandra, 22, studied through high school. She's a single mother with two dependent children.

Sandra earns a living selling tamales once a week. She has had this business for eight years, and she sells tamales on Saturday and Sunday.

Sandra needs the loan to buy corn, beans, banana leaves, and other ingredients to make tamales.

Sandra dreams of building her own house and having a steady job to meet the needs of her two children.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, banana leaves, and other ingredients to make tamales

loans.name: Cinthia Maricela

texts.es:
Cinthia es una madre soltera con un niño de 8 años en Campeche México. 
Solicita el crédito a SGS para la compra de materiales para poder construir un techo de concreto en su vivienda actual y evitar que se meta el agua.

Ella vende artesanías locales en su comunidad para los turistas.
texts.en:
Cinthia's a single mother with an eight-year-old son in Campeche, Mexico.

She's asking SGS for a loan to buy materials so she can build a concrete roof on her current house to keep it from leaking.

She sells local crafts to tourists in her community.

loans.use: to build a concrete roof on her house.

loans.name: Pacpachayoc-Echarati Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al   banco comunal de” Pacpachacoy- Echarati” , perteneciente a la distrito de Echarate , provincia de la convención dentro de la región del Cusco.

La socia Julia tiene 54 años de edad , ella se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales, con estas dos actividades  saca adelante su hogar, su sueño es mejorar sus cultivos y tener mejor producción por eso ella pidió el préstamo para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

Los demás socios se dedican a la ganadería, agricultura, crianza de animales, a la venta de alimentos, entre otros.

Los socios están contentos y agradecen los inversionistas de KIVA  por el crédito otorgado, se comprometen a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
These members belong to the communal bank "Pacpachacoy-Echarati" in the district of Echarate, which is part of the Convención province in the Cusco region.

[Bank] member Julia is 54 years old. She works in agriculture and in raising animals. With these two activities she is moving her household ahead. Her dream is to improve her crops and have better production. For this, she is asking for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers.

The other members work in livestock-raising, agriculture, raising animals, selling food, and other businesses.

The members are happy and grateful to the Kiva investors for the loan granted. They promise to make their payments punctually on the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Zhypargul

texts.ru: Жыпаргул, 34 года, замужем, мать 4 детей. На сегодняшний день Жыпаргул, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 10 лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду Жыпаргул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 лошади, 2 коровы, 50 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 9,000 сом (KGS). Жыпаргул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку сена в качестве корма для скота. Доходы от кредита Жыпаргул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и приобретение грузового авто.
texts.en:
Zhypargul is 34 and married with four children. She currently works in animal husbandry and agriculture as the primary source of income for her family, a business she started 10 years ago. Thanks to her hard work she currently has three horses, two cows and 50 sheep with a monthly income of 9,000 KGS.

Zhypargul has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 40,000 KGS to buy hay for livestock feed. She plans to put profits from the loan into further augmenting her quantity of livestock and toward buying a vehicle.

loans.use: to purchase hay for livestock feed in order to invest in her business

loans.name: Muong Phang 39 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Huong, 25, is a Thai ethnic lady who has been married and become the mother of a 3-year-old boy and a 10-year-old girl. She lives with her husband and her children in a Thai ethnic traditional house in a small remote village. Mrs. Huong and her husband work very hard at agricultural production to earn a living, with several activities such as growing rice, raising pigs, buffaloes, chicken, ducks and fish.

Mrs. Huong lacks education. She wants her children to benefit from the best education so that they can escape from poverty. For that reason, she has tried hard to increase production and improve income for her family. This is the first time that she has taken out a loan from the Anh Chi Em program. She will use this loan to buy baby fish and develop fish farming. She hopes that her investment will go well, especially when she knows that the program can support her by providing technical counselling.

Mrs. Huong dreams of a more sufficient life for her family and a brighter future for her children. In the picture, she stands first from the right.

loans.use: to buy baby fish and develop fish farming

loans.name: Fabian Alexander

texts.es: Fabián es un emprendedor de 32 años que reside en compañía de su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en un barrio de Bogotá, él laboró por años en la parte comercial y publicitaria de empresas, sin embargo su pasión por el diseño de stands publicitarios lo incitaron a tomar un curso de ingeniería de web master y convertirse en un experto del diseño y marketing online.  Al poco tiempo reunió un capital con el que logró sacar a delante su proyecto de negocio y con el apoyo de su esposa desarrollo su idea, hoy en día presta sus servicios a pymes y grandes empresas quienes solicitan servicios de diseños de show room, stand, escenografías y muebles de exhibición. En la actualidad tras la acogida que ha tenido es necesario comprar más materias primas e insumos; tintas, maderas, telas, impresiones entre otros, para ello realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y financiar sus compras. Con esta inversión continuara con sus contratos sin contratiempos y seguirá ofreciendo bienestar a su familia.
texts.en:
Fabián, 32, is an entrepreneur who lives with his wife and his two children in a neighborhood in Bogotá.

He worked for two years in business sales and marketing, but his passion for designing exhibit booths motivated him to take a course in web engineering and become an expert in online design and marketing. Soon after that he raised some capital and managed to advance his business project and with, his wife's help, develop his plan. Now he offers his services to small and medium businesses and large businesses that request design services for show rooms, exhibit booths, displays, and exhibit furniture.

Currently, with the reception he has received, he needs to buy more raw materials and supplies, including ink, wood, fabric, and printing. He applied for a Kiva loan, an opportunity to connect to a financial life through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and pay for his purchases.

With this investment Fabián will continue with his contracts without any obstacles and keep providing for his family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials and supplies, including ink, wood, fabric, and printing

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a maize farmer from Gayya village. As a Babban Gona member, David is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land (5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer).

Before joining Babban Gona, David would have had to sell his maize at harvest - when the price of maize is at its lowest - to meet his immediate cash needs for food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, David can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, David no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, David hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Maria Vilma

texts.es:
Maria Vive en la comunidad de Tenabo Campeche cerca de la capital.
Tiene dos hijos; una niña de 18 años y un niño de 16 años. Está pidiendo un crédito para la ampliación de su vivienda. Actualmente viven los tres en un cuarto. Ella trabaja vendiendo dulces de la región.
texts.en:
Maria lives in the community of Tenabo Campeche, near the capital

She has two children, a daughter, age 18, and a son, age 16. She is requesting a loan to enlarge her home. Now all three live in one room.

She works selling regional sweets.

loans.use: to purchase [supplies to enlarge her home].

loans.name: Mohinisso

texts.en:
Mohiniso was born in 1952. She is married and has two children. Her children are adults. Mohiniso is widowed. Since her husband died, she is the only upbringer and feed-keeper of the children.

Mohiniso is a very hardworking woman; she works as a sewer. She has been sewing different fashionable women's clothes for 13 years, and she has a great experience in this field. Mohiniso has a workshop where she sews clothes and teaches some women to sew clothes. Mohiniso is going to widen the range of her services; therefore, she plans to buy an embroidery machine. She is asking for a loan of 6,000 somoni with this aim. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine to provide a wide range of services

loans.name: Umar

texts.en:
Umar is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Umar is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land (5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer).

Traditionally, Umar would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs for food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Umar will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Umar now has the opportunity to actualize his dream of growing his agriculture business for himself and family members. He would like to use additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Salisu

texts.en:
Salisu is a maize farmer from Sarki Gimba village. As a member of Babban Gona, Salisu is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support, he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land (5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria).

Before joining Babban Gona, Salisu would have had to sell his maize at harvest - a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market - to meet his immediate cash needs for food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Salisu can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Salisu is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family. In the end, he hopes to use his increased earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Markus

texts.en:
Markus is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Markus is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land (5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer).

Traditionally, Markus would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs for food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Markus will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Markus now has the opportunity to actualize his dream of growing his agriculture business for himself and family members. He would like to use the additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Ingrid

texts.es: Ingrid de 42 años es una microempresaria dedicada a la marroquinería,  se encuentra residenciada en un sector de la capital del país y cuenta con 18 años de trayectoria, ella encontró en el marketing online una oportunidad de comercializar sus productos a través de su propia página, en la que exhibe una serie de productos de diferentes calidades y tendencias. Diariamente labora a partir de las 7 a.m. hasta las 7 p.m. horario en el que realiza su producción y promoción.  Ingrid desea participar en una feria para darse a mostrar a nivel nacional, para ello realizará una producción de bolsos cuyos materiales financiará con un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y poder llevar a cabo su proyecto, de este modo comprará cueros, cremalleras, herrajes, accesorios y tinturas.  Su meta a futuro es mostrar sus productos a todo el mundo y lograr tener la capacidad de despachar sus productos a nivel internacional.
texts.en:
Ingrid, who is 42 years old, is a micro-entrepreneur who works in leather. She lives in a sector of the capital of the country, and she has 18 years of experience in her career. She found in online marketing an opportunity to sell her products through her own web page, where she exhibits a series of products of different qualities and styles. She works every day from 7 a.m. to 7 p.m., a schedule in which she does her production and promotion.

Ingrid wants to participate in a fair in order to exhibit at a national level. To do this, she will complete a production of bags whose materials she will finance with a Kiva loan. This is an opportunity for her to establish a financial life through Mario Santo Domingo Foundation and to be able to complete her project. Thus she will buy leathers, zippers, fittings, accessories, and dyes. Her goal for the future is to show her products to the whole world and achieve the capacity to ship her products at an international level.

loans.use: to buy leathers, zippers, fittings, accessories, and dyes.

loans.name: Emprendedoras De Santa Librada Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado “Emprendedoras de Santa Librada” está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres integrado por 18 mujeres todas ellas vecinas y amigas del lugar, quienes hacen todo lo posible para salir adelante con sus familias.  
La Sra. Nelida integrante del Comité pide el préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas de vestir (remeras, blusas, short, ropas interiores) para comercializarlo, ya que ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo. 
Ella comenta que a través de su trabajo tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia y darles una vida digna y sin privaciones como las que ella tuvieron que pasar.
texts.en:
The group named "Emprendedoras de Santa Librada" (Entrepreneurs of Santa Librada) is in its second cycle of its womens' committee program. It is composed of 18 women, all of them neighbors and friends of the area, who do everything they can to get ahead with their families.

One member of the committee is Señora Nelida who is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of clothing (T-shirts, blouses, shorts, and underwear) in order to market it, since she sells all kinds of garments.

She says that through her work she has the means to be able to help her family and give them a decent life without hardships, like those that she had to go through.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell, such as: T-shirts, blouses, shorts, and underwear.

loans.name: Bitrus

texts.en:
Bitrus is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member in Kaduna, Nigeria.  Anticipating a good harvest this season, Bitrus has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Bitrus would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs for food and clothing.  Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Bitrus can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

As a Babban Gona member, Bitrus will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to 2,000 USD per hectare of land.  Bitrus is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family, and he looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children obtain a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a simple housewife, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of seven children. Her husband has been running a barber shop for the past 25 years. Her husband is the guardian of the family and responsible for fulfilling the needs of all the family members.

Shamim's husband needs to buy different types of cosmetics i.e. creams, a hair brush, and other accessories for his barber shop but due to financial constraints, her husband is not able to buy these items for his business purpose.

Therefore, Shamim has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner from BRAC Pakistan. This loan will help her husband to buy the relevant items for his business purpose so that he can provide better services to his customers, it will also be helpful for him to earn the maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of his business and family.

For this financial assistance, Shamim is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's barber business.

loans.name: Carmen Yabubi

texts.es: Carmen es una entusiasta mujer que se caracteriza por su capacidad de emprendimiento y adaptación, ella fue docente por años y decidió retirarse de este medio para continuar con el negocio tradicional de su familia, una frutera muy acondicionada que funciona de lunes a sábado en el centro de la capital del país. Carmen cuenta con dos años en su administración y con excelentes resultados que le han permitido solventar los gastos de su hogar puesto que está separada y es madre cabeza de hogar, su hijo de 18 años está próximo a ingresar a la universidad  y su meta es que contar con los recursos pertinentes para costearle su educación superior.  Los productos que ofrece en su frutera son ensaladas, postres, cremas, helados, jugos naturales y pastelería, en la actualidad realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y adquirir un exprimidor de naranjas industrial que respalde a su demanda. A futuro desea continuar haciendo mejoras a la infraestructura del negocio y fortaleciendo sus activos.
texts.en:
Carmen is an enthusiastic woman, characterized by her entrepreneurial abilities and adaptability. She was a teacher for years and decided to retire from this profession in order to continue the traditional business of her family: a well-located fruit store that is open Monday through Saturday in the middle of the country's capital. The products sold at her fruit store are salads, desserts, custards, ice creams, natural juices, and pastries. Carmen has been working for two years managing it, with excellent results that have allowed her to meet her home expenses.

She is separated and head of her household. Her 18-year-old son is close to going to college. Her goal is to have the necessary resources to pay for his higher education.

Currently, she is applying for a CrediKiva loan, an opportunity to be linked to the financial community through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and purchase an industrial orange juicer that meets demands. In the future, she hopes to continue to make improvements on the infrastructure of the business and continue strengthening her assets.

loans.use: to purchase an industrial orange juicer.

loans.name: Dauda

texts.en:
Dauda is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member in Kaduna, Nigeria.  Anticipating a good harvest this season, Dauda has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Dauda would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs for food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Dauda can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

As a Babban Gona member, Dauda will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to 2,000 UUSD per hectare of land.  Dauda is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family, and looks forward to using his additional earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Viineem Group

texts.fr: Léa, est une femme âgée de 36 ans, mariée mère de 2 enfants. Elle exerce son activité depuis 10 ans. Ce qui fait marcher son activité le choix de sa marchandise (type de balaie qu'elle vend vient de la Cote d'Ivoire et du Ghana), ses clients préfèrent ses sortes de balaie. Elle veut le prêt pour acheter des balaies (pour nettoyage) à 25 000 F. L'utilité du prêt c'est de s'approvisionner en quantité suffisante afin de renforcer son activité. Elle a déjà reçu le prêt 2 fois et à rembourser aux dates prévues à ACFIME
texts.en:
Lea is 36 years old, married and has two children. She has been in business for 10 years. She sells a  kind of sweeping broom made in Cote d'Ivore and Ghana. She offers the type of merchandise preferred by her customers. 

She would like to obtain this loan to buy brooms for 25,000 West African francs. The loan will allow her to restock enough merchandise to bolster her business. She already received two loans in the past and repaid them on time as agreed with ACFIME.

loans.use: to buy sweeping brooms.

loans.name: Kikay Group

texts.en:
Susan is the featured borrower of Kikay Group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua. They have been best friends since they arrived in Lebanon to work as housekeepers, leaving their families back home in their Philippine hometown.

Susan is a 43-year-old, widowed mother of three children, for whom she works hard as a housekeeper to provide them with the best living and education since her husband passed away. Susan has a limited monthly income; thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her children's school tuition fees. She is the first lady on the right of the photo.

With respect to the other group members, Carmelita is a 43-year-old single lady who wants to support her family's living in the Philippines, while Maria Amy is a 48-year-old married mother of three children who wants to support her agricultural business in the Philippines. Carmelita is the lady in the middle, and Maria Amy is the first lady on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to pay her children's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is a 30-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a vegetable seller by profession. He sells vegetables such as onions, potatoes, tomatoes, etc. Her husband is solely responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household.

Robina's husband needs to purchase different types of vegetables for reselling purposes so that he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to an unfavorable financial position, her husband is not in condition to purchase vegetables for his business purpose.

Therefore, Robina has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for his business purpose.

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's vegetable business.

loans.name: Orosta

texts.en:
Orosta is an industrious woman. She was born in 1978 in Tajikistan. Orosta is married and has three children. Her husband is an entrepreneur. Orosta always wanted to have own business deal, and so she began her business two years ago. She has been busy with sewing. She offers her service to local people with high quality.

Orosta sews clothes with an old sewing machine, and so she wants to buy a new sewing machine for making better the quality of service. She is asking for a loan of 6,000 somoni to buy a new sewing machine. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for increasing her working capital.

loans.name: Ghalia

texts.en:
Ghalia is 37, married, and has two sons. She has a small clothing project that she started in her house.

She previously requested a 5,000 EGP loan and successfully repaid it on the due dates. She is requesting another 5,000 EGP loan to buy winter clothes for the season.

loans.use: to buy winter clothes for the season.

loans.name: Quirino

texts.en: In his town of Trinidad, Quirino has a thriving business selling dried fish. Since this town is closest to other towns located on nearby islands, Quirino's business flourishes and his customer base grows. His dried fish business has been existing for more than 10 years. He is asking for a loan to buy more of the same so he can cater to more customers and orders. His previous loans have been repaid in full. Out of his profit, Quirino plans to educate his children who are aged 5-17.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es:
Arturo con 28 años de edad,de estado civil casado,vive en casa propia,junto a su esposa, en el distrito de Colasay,provincia de Jaén,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú.El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura,especificamente al cultivo de café, ubicado en el Caserío de El Lirio,con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace 10 años.El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas,aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios,fertilizantes y mano de obra para su cosecha. De esta manera le ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica,morfológica y productiva de su cultivo. Así como tener una cosecha oportuna, por ende tendrá mayor producción,una mejora en su calidad de producto, por lo cuál no tendrá problemas en vender su producto.

Arturo es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa. Ha manejado un crédito el cuál lo a cancelado de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Arturo, 28 and married, lives in his own house with his wife, in Colasay district, Jaen province, Cajamarca department, Peru. He has very good personal and work references from the residents of the area. The inhabitants of this town work mostly in agriculture, business, and cattle farming.

He works in agriculture, specifically in the cultivation of coffee. He is located in the  El Lireo Settlement, and has 10 years of coffee growing experience. He will use the loan granted to him for farm work, applications, and the incorporation of pesticides, fertilizer, and human labor for his crops. In this manner, it will help him improve the physiological, morphological and productiveness of his crop. As well as having a timely harvest, he will have better production, a better quality product, and for these reasons won't have problems selling his product. 

Arturo is a repeating member of Edpyme Alternativa. He has had a loan which he repaid in a timely manner.

loans.use: He will use the loan granted to him for farm work, applications, and the incorporation of pesticides, fertilizer, and human labor for his crops.

loans.name: Allan

texts.en:
As a previous Kiva borrower, Allan is looking to expand his business by taking out another loan. He has successfully repaid all three of his previous loans. Allan would like to take this opportunity to thank his Kiva lenders for their support.

Since his first loan, Allan has managed to expand to 15 outlets and he is looking to keep this momentum going as this will improve his standard of living as well as that of his wife, son and immediate extended family. His main objective is to make easy, quick and safe money transfer facilities accessible to everyone in the southern province of Zambia.

Currently, Allan uses the revenue generated from his Zoona outlets to generate capital in order to expand his business and be a source of employment in his community. He also uses it to take care of his his family. He would like to let his Kiva lenders know that he has managed to move to a better house.

Allan has requested a new Kiva loan in order to increase his working capital base across his 15 mobile money transfer network. He thanks his Kiva lenders for the continued support and for helping him become the man that he is today.

In this photo, Allan poses at one of his outlets. In the back are two of his employees: Emelia in front and Arnold at the back.

loans.use: to generate more capital to assist clients to send and receive money when they need to most.

loans.name: Alcibiades

texts.es:
Alcibiades con 41 años de edad, de estado civil casado, vive con su cónyuge y sus tres hijos, en el distrito de Pomahuaca,provincia de Jaén,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte público, cuenta con una mototaxi propia con la cuál brinda servicio de transporte, con 05 años de experiencia en el rubro, por lo que cuenta con clientela de la zona. Adicionalmente se dedica a la cría de animales de corral como son gallinas, patos, pavos, etc. El préstamo lo va invertir en arreglos y en el mantenimiento de su unidad móvil y gastos familiares.

Alcibiades es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Alcibiades 41 years old and married lives with his wife and three kids, in Pomahuaca district, Jaen province, Cajamarca department, Peru.He has many good personal and work references from the residents of the area. The inhabitants of this town work mostly in agriculture, business, and cattle farming.\

He works in transportation service, he has his own motorized rickshaw with which he offers transportation service. With 5 years of experience in the profession, he has customers in the area. Additionally, he breeds farm animals like hens, ducks, turkeys, etc. He will invest the loan in arrangements and the maintenance of a his rickshaw, and on household costs.  

Alcibiades is a recurring member of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: He will invest the loan in arrangements and the maintenance of a his rickshaw, and on household costs.

loans.name: Alh. Magaji

texts.en:
Alhaji Magaji is a maize farmer from Masaka village. As a Babban Gona member, Alhaji Magaji is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of kand, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Alhaji Magaji would have had to sell his maize at harvest when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Alhaji Magaji can store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Alhaji Magaji no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Alhaji Magaji hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Mallam Shuaibu

texts.en:
Mallam Shuaibu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Mallam Shuaibu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Mallam Shuaibu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Mallam Shuaibu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Mallam Shuaibu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Mallam Shuaibu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 52-year-old married mother of three. She has been working in the baking business since 2013 to support her husband in covering their family's living needs, especially their children's education expenses. She used to work as a tailor but she decided to shift to a daily income business, which will help to cover her family's daily expenses.

This is Mariam's third loan as an Al Majmoua borrower. She invested her previous loans in establishing and developing her current business, especially buying a specialized Saj bread oven, and other bakery raw materials and necessary business needs.

Today, Mariam is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to develop her current business through buying specialized bakery requested machines and business tools.

Mariam succeeded in educating her children, and still she is working hard to see them graduating in the future.

loans.use: to develop her current business through buying specialized bakery requested machines and business tools.

loans.name: Korany

texts.en:
Korany, 33, is married to a housewife and has one son and one daughter. He has a small butchery project and a meat grinding machine for kofta (ground meat and spices made on a skewer). He previously requested a 5,000 EGP loan and successfully repaid it on the due dates.

He is requesting another loan of 10,000 EGP to buy frozen fish and chicken to expand his project and generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy frozen fish and chicken.

loans.name: Tijjani

texts.en:
Tijjani is a maize farmer from Tashar Kanawa village. As a Babban Gona member, Tijjani is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of and, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Tijjani would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Tijjani can store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Tijjani no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Tijjani hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Mastona

texts.en: Mastona is a very ambitions woman. She was born in 1973. Mastona is married and has a child. She lives with her child in the southern part of Tajikistan. Mastona always wanted to run her own business deal. With the aim of starting a business, she took part in a course called “To Get Ahead” from a women's organization and she got a certificate. Mastona is going to start a business with a café. She will rent a place and offer the national foods. Mastona will cook the dishes by herself. She will hire some waitresses. Mastona has money for starting the business but it is not enough. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy food items for organizing the café business. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy food items for starting a café business.

loans.name: Jem's Group

texts.en:
MarjorieGrace is the featured borrower of Jem's group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua because they have always been friends since they left their hometown in the Philippines to come and work in Lebanon for a better income to support their beloved ones back in the Philippines.

MarjorieGrace is a 47-year-old divorced mother of three children who is working hard as a housekeeper to cover the expenses and needs of her beloved kids and improve their living conditions. Thus, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay for her children's school tuition fees. She is the first lady on the left.

With respect to the other group members, Jane is the lady standing in the middle, and Edith is the first lady on the right in the photo.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school tuition fees

loans.name: Mussarat

texts.en:
Mussarat is 26 years old, married and a mother of two children. She has been doing a business of tailoring for many years to support her husband. She accepted the fact that if her husband worked alone for their family, they would not be able to meet the expenses of the household plus the educational needs of their children. That is why she started tailoring at home to support her family well. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Now she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more reels of threads and packs of buttons, ribbons and laces for filling her orders on time. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Mussarat hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of threads and packs of buttons, ribbons and laces for filling her orders on time.

loans.name: Maryjory

texts.en:
Maryjory is a married woman from Duero, a fifth income class municipality in the province of Bohol. She is a mother to three children aged one, three and five. It is a struggle for her to provide for them since she does not have other options for a livelihood.

Two years ago, Maryjory decided to engage in buying and selling rice from farmers, and cooking snacks like maja blanca and pancakes. In addition to this, she also tries to help her husband who drives their motorcycle and farms rice for an income. She tries to ensure that his tools and motorcycle needs are bought.

She is asking for a loan to buy 20 sacks of rice, corn starch, milk, sugar, flour, eggs, cooking oil and coconut. She will also use the loan to pay for some repairs like vulcanizing and fuel for their motorcycle.

Maryjory is determined to improve the life of her family through hard work and perseverance. Her income will be for her children's school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy 20 sacks of rice, corn starch, milk, sugar, flour, eggs, cooking oil and coconut.

loans.name: Elenito

texts.en:
Elenito lives in Duero, Bohol. He is married and a father to 3 children aged 3, 11 and 13.

Here Elenito is showing his seedling bed for eggplants, which he will soon grow in another planting area. He has been growing vegetables for 13 years to provide for his family.

He also dreams of venturing into another business, which is raising hogs. For this purpose, he is asking for a loan to buy feed, piglets, more vegetable seeds and a sprayer for insecticides.

Elenito dreams of making his business successful so that his children can go to school.

loans.use: to buy feed, piglets, more vegetable seeds and a sprayer for insecticides.

loans.name: Stellah

texts.en:
Stellah is 34 years old and supports 8 people in her family. She has a computer services center, and this is a business that she has been doing for the last 15 years with a monthly income of KES 30,000.

She has applied for her first loan with Visionfund Kenya which she will use to increase her working capital.

She will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

loans.use: to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Laura Maria

texts.es: Laura Maria vive en la comunidad de Puerto Rico Campeche vendiendo jugos. Quiere hacer una ampliación en su vivienda ya que el puesto de jugos se ha adueñado de su casa. Con la ampliación podrá recuperar su vivienda y seguir ofreciendo jugos en la comunidad.
texts.en: Laura Maria lives in the community of Puerto Rico Campeche selling juices. She wants to make an extension to her home because the juice stand has taken over her home. With the extension, she will be able to recover her home and continue to offer juices to the community.

loans.use: to make an extension to her home.

loans.name: Branny Altagracia

texts.es:
Branny es estudiante de Medicina, ella solicita un préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos educativo. Esta es su historia: Mi nombre es Branny, tengo 20 años de edad, actualmente vivo en La Vega con mi familia compuesta por mis padres, dos hermanos y la mayor bendición mía, mi hijo Bryand Dariel, por quien trato de ser alguien mejor en la vida con una profesión para poder asegurarle una mejor calidad de vida y ayudar a mi familia.
Para alcanzar este sueño tengo que cursar la carrera de Medicina que me ha gustado desde siempre, he pensado en otras carreras ya que esta dura muchos a los pero es imposible desprenderse de lo que te gusta y a mi esta profesión me encanta, siempre me he visto como una futura Dra. Para ayudar a las personas con mis servicios y darles un buen trato, quiero destacarme como una de las mejores doctoras y dar a demostrar que aunque teniendo un hijo a temprana edad, la formación académica no se debe parar, sino que con mas fuerzas seguir luchando por esa criatura que tienes y darle lo mejor de ti y que mejor que darle seguridad, hogar, comida y felicidad a tu hijo y sobre todo que se sienta orgulloso por la madre que tiene. Este es mi sueño. Un sueño que se ha visto imposibilitado puesto que mi familia no tiene recursos suficiente para poder ayudarme a cumplirlos, pero sé que con la fe de Dios este sueño se verá cumplido obteniendo así una buen profesional fruta de la buena acción de una mano amiga para hacer de todo esto una realidad.
texts.en:
Branny is studying medicine and is asking for a loan to cover her education fees. This is her story:

My name is Branny, I'm 20, and I currently live in La Vega with my family. We are my parents, my two brothers and my son Bryand Dariel, who has been a blessing for me. For him, I am trying to forge myself a career so I can look after him in the best way possible, as well as helping my family.

In order to achieve this dream, I am studying medicine; something I have always liked. I did consider other subjects, as studying this course takes a long time. However, I have always wanted to be a doctor in the future and help people, so I decided to go with what I like.

I would like to stand out as one of the best doctors and show people that even if you have a child at a young age, there is no need to give up on your education. In fact, you should use that little person as inspiration to work harder than ever so you can provide them with a home, stability, food and happiness. I hope my son will feel proud of his mother.

This is my dream. However, right now it is an impossible dream as my family do not have enough money to help me. Despite this, with my faith in God, I hope somebody will do a good deed and help me to become a good professional.

loans.use: to pay higher education costs.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadalupe vive en la comunidad de Puerto Rico con su único hijo de 14 años.
Los dos viven con los papas de Guadalupe en donde atienden la tienda de abarrotes de la familia desde hace ya muchos años.
Están solicitando un crédito con SGS para poder ampliar la casa en donde viven y puedan construir un cuarto alado de la casa de sus papas.
texts.en:
Guadalupe lives in the community of Puerto Rico with her only child who is 14. They live with her parents in the home where she has been looking after the family grocery store for many years.

She is asking for a loan through the group SGS so she can extend the home where they live by building a room attached to her parents' house.

loans.use: to extend her home.

loans.name: Nancy Angelica

texts.es:
Nancy tiene 23 años y es una madre soltera en la comunidad de Puerto Rico en Campeche.

Tuvo su hija con un novio que la dejó.
Es estilista, es muy responsable y honesta. quiere solicitar un crédito en SGS para terminar un cuarto adicional y ofrecerle a su hija, un mejor patrimonio y un dulce hogar...
texts.en:
Nancy, 23, is a single mother living in the community of Puerto Rico in Campeche.

She has a daughter, but her partner left her.

She works as a stylist. She is very responsible and honest.

She would like a loan through the group SGS to finish an extra room for her daughter making it a better, sweeter home for her.

loans.use: to build an extra room in her parents' home.

loans.name: Jairo Iván

texts.es: Jairo de 52 años es un emprendedor hombre que hace 20 años llegó a Fusagasugá buscando alternativas de trabajo, allí inició su vida de comerciante de productos misceláneos, posteriormente encontró un local en el que instaló una cafetería y restaurante en el año 2013.  Hoy en día ofrece servicio de comidas y ha tenido excelentes resultados con los que ha logrado sostener a su familia. Él está comprometido y próximamente recibirá a su primogénito, un bebe que está por nacer al que esperan con muchos anhelos. Diariamente a tiende su negocio a partir de las 7 a.m. hasta las 8 p.m. En la actualidad realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para surtir con víveres; arroz, aceite, plátano, frutas y carnes, para el incremento de la producción de fin de año. Jairo desea incrementar sus ventas y sus ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jairo, 52, is an entrepreneur who arrived in Fusagasuga 20 years ago looking for work. He started out as a sales person, selling assorted goods. Later, in 2013, he found a property where he set up a cafeteria and a restaurant. Every day, he runs his business from 7 am until 8 pm.

Nowadays, he serves food, which earns him a tidy profit which he uses to look after his family. He is engaged and with his partner, they are expecting their first child with plenty of excitement.

He is asking for a loan from Kiva, through the Mario Santo Domingo foundation, so that he can buy food supplies such as rice, oil, bananas, fruit and meat. This will help him have enough for the New Year period.

His goal is to increase sales and income so he can give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: surtir con víveres; arroz, aceite, plátano, frutas y carnes

loans.name: Kuapeguai Group

texts.es:
Adela continúa con su negocio de  confección de ropa femenina (la primera de la derecha, viste blusa celeste y pantalón azul). El crédito que obtuvo lo utilizó para comprar una máquina de coser industrial, el pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque las prendas que confeccionó tuvieron buena aceptación por sus clientes. La banca de emprendimiento sigue unida y trabajando en conjunto, sus negocios prosperaron y pudieron trabajar de forma continua. Actualmente su negocio mejoró, las prendas que confecciona tienen un mejor acabado y ella se siente más cómoda trabajando, “con mi nueva máquina trabajo cómoda y las prendas quedan bien cosidas sin errores…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes que le hacen pedidos, la desventaja es la falta de tela para confeccionar. Su sueño es estabilizar su negocio, Ella desea comprar rollos de tela por mayor. Esta es la 4 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que desarrolla esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Adela solicita un préstamo para comprar rollos de tela por mayor para confeccionar ropa femenina.
texts.en:
Adela is still running her clothes making business. She is the first on the right in the photo. She is wearing a light blue top and blue pants. This communal bank is still working together so that their businesses prosper and they always have work.

She used her last loan to buy an industrial sewing machine. She was able to pay the loan off on time because the clothes she made were very popular with her customers.

Currently, her business has improved, her clothes are of better quality and finish, and she is more comfortable working: "thanks to my new machine, I can work more efficiently and my clothes are of better quality, with no imperfections".

One of the advantages of her business is that her customers make orders. However, the problem she often finds is that she does not have enough material to meet them.

She dreams of strengthening the business. One step towards this is to use the next loan to buy more material.

This is her fourth loan with this institution in the ten years that she has been in business. For this reason she is asking for the loan, which will help her make more women's clothes.

loans.use: to buy rolls of material to make women's clothes.

loans.name: Ruth Damaris

texts.es:
Damaris, de 36 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, empezó estudiando en la universidad pero por falta de recursos económicos no termino, actualmente está acompañada, tiene 2 hijos que están estudiando, su esposo se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos y al cuidado de ganado.

Damaris, se dedica a los trabajos de la casa, así como también a la crianza de ganado y a cuidar aves de corral, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 16  años, esto lo aprendió de su madre.

Damaris, necesita el préstamo para comprar harinilla para alimentar el ganado y también para comprar concentrado para las aves de corral. 

Damaris, sueña con tener más aves de corral y ganado y espera aumente la producción de leche.
texts.en:
Damaris, 36, studied until the end of high school. She then went to university but had to give it up as she did not have enough money to carry on.

She is married with two children who are studying. Her husband grows basic grains and looks after livestock.

Damaris takes care of the home and also raises cattle and poultry. She has been doing this for 16 years now, after learning from her mother.

She needs a loan to buy chicken feed and food for her cattle.

She would like to have more animals in the future, and be able to increase her milk production.

loans.use: to buy animal food for her cattle and chickens.

loans.name: Mirna Esperanza

texts.es:
Esperanza, de 28 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos niños menores de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado.

Esperanza, se dedica a los cultivos de hortalizas desde hace seis años, su tío y sus hermanos le apoyaron y la motivaron para que trabajara con hortalizas y ahora tiene cultivadas 1,257 metros cuadrados de cultivo de pepino y frijoles, ella trabaja todos los días con el apoyo de su madre y sus hermanos. 

Esperanza, necesita el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes y abono para el cultivo de pepino y de ejotes; de esa manera asegurará que sus cultivos produzcan buenas cosechas que le permitan generar buenos ingresos económicos para darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y a su madre.

Esperanza, sueña con seguir trabajando con los cultivos de hortalizas y poco a poco ir tecnificándose más para obtener mejores cosechas.
texts.en:
Esperanza, 28, is the single mother of two young children. She studied until fourth grade.

She earns a living growing vegetables, an activity she has been doing for six years now. She has the support of her uncle and brothers, who encouraged her to go into this line of work. She now has 1,257 square meters of cucumber and green beans.

She works every day with the help of her mother and brothers.

She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers and compost for her crops. This will ensure that she has a good harvest which will generate a good income. She will use the profits to improve the quality of life for her children and her mother.

She hopes to continue growing vegetables and gradually start to get better at it so she can have bigger harvests.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her crops.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Victor, de 29 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, no pudo continuar debido a problemas económicos de sus padres, es padre de un niño de dos años de edad, está acompañado y su pareja trabaja en una tienda en la ciudad. 

Victor, se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos como maíz, frijoles y maicillo que son de los alimentos básicos para la familia, pero también trabaja como jornalero, ayudante de albañil y diferentes trabajos en la comunidad, todo para generar ingresos para su familia.

Victor, necesita el préstamo para pagar el alquiler del terreno en donde sembrará y para pagar mozos para cortar las cosechas de maíz y de frijoles, él espera vender una parte de la cosecha para generar buenos ingresos y así cubrir otras necesidades de la familia.

Victor, sueña con seguir trabajando fuertemente en los cultivos de maíz, frijoles y maicillo para obtener muy buenas cosechas y vender una parte.
texts.en:
Victor, 29, studied until ninth grade. He was unable to finish his education due to his parent's financial situation. He is the father of a two-year-old boy. He is married and his wife works in a store in the city.

Victor grows basic crops such as corn, beans and sorghum; the basic food for the family. He also works as a laborer, a builder's assistant and other different jobs in the community. He does all this to generate an income for his family.

He is asking for a loan to pay the rent on the land where he has his corn and bean crops, as well as labor costs for collecting the harvest. He hopes to be able to sell a good part of the harvest to earn some money, which will go towards household expenses.

He hopes to continue growing good crops which yield better harvests so he can always sell part of them.

loans.use: to pay land rent and labor costs for his crops.

loans.name: Habila Dinora

texts.es:
Habila, de 51 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto grado, es madre de cuatro hijos, pero hace varios años una de sus hijas murió cuando tenía 10 años de edad, a causa de una enfermedad en el cerebro, ella está casada y su esposo trabaja todos los días cultivando pepino, frijoles, tomates y chiles, así como también en la siembra de granos básicos como maíz y frijoles; en su casa vive una de sus hijas y una nieta.

Habila, trabaja todos los días desde las cinco de la mañana en el cuidado de las aves de corral, su esposo le apoya en las tardees cuando regresa de sembrar.

Habila, necesita el préstamo para comprar doscientas gallinas ponedoras más, para incrementar la producción de huevos y para comprar concentrado para la alimentación de las pollas ponedoras y asi garantizar un buen desarrollo que le permita dar una buena producción.

Habila, sueña con tecnificar su pequeña granja, construir el techo y ampliar más para incrementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Habila, 51, studied until fifth grade. She is the mother of four children, but several years ago one of her daughters died aged 10 of a brain disease.

She is married and her husband works every day growing cucumbers, beans, tomatoes and chilies, as well as sewing other basic grains such as corn.

She has one daughter and a granddaughter living with her in her home at the moment.

She works every day from five in the morning looking after her hens. Her husband helps her in the afternoons when he comes home from work.

She is asking for a loan to buy 200 more laying hens so that he can increase the production of eggs. She will also use part of the money to buy food for the animals, so that they can grow healthily and give her good quality eggs.

She would like to improve her small farm by building a roof and extending it so her business can grow in the future.

loans.use: to buy 200 more laying hens and food for them.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel de 61 años de edad se dedica desde hace 10 años a la venta de colchas, sabanas, hamacas y frazadas, vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias y mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante con los gastos que se le presentan en el hogar, el cliente vive solo en casa propia ya que sus hijos viven en casas separadas con sus familias, el esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para poder comprar mas productos por mayor y poder seguir con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos.
texts.en: Miguel is 61-years old and for 10 years he has worked selling quilts, blankets, hammocks and blankets on the street in the different colonies and markets that are found close to his home. With what he gets from his sales, he manages to get ahead with the household expenses. He lives alone in his own home because his children live in their own homes with their families. He is asking for a loan to be able to buy more products wholesale and be able to keep working since that is his only source of income.

loans.use: to buy quilts, blankets, hammocks and blankets wholesale.

loans.name: Yesenia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yessenia, de 37 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno, se caso hace varios años, su hija mayor murió y solamente tiene una niña de 15 años de edad que está estudiando, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura (siembra de maíz, frijoles y maicillo). 

Yessenia, se dedica a la elaboración de hamacas desde hace 10 años, ella aprendió este oficio porque un familiar le enseño como elaborar hamacas de seda y de poli-seda; pero aparte también tiene 150 pollos de engorde, los cuales vende cuando crecen y para cuidar los pollos le ayuda su hija cuando regresa de la escuela.

Yessenia, necesita el préstamo para comprar hilo de seda y de poli-seda para la elaboración de las hamacas, para poder seguir llevando ingresos económicos a su hogar.

El sueño de Yessenia, es poder mejorar su casa de bahareque y tener una mejor calidad de vida junto a su familia y poder ayudar a su hija a terminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Yessenia, 37, studied until ninth grade. She got married several years ago. Unfortunately, her eldest daughter passed away so she has only one daughter now; aged 15 and still at school.

Her husband works in agriculture, growing corn, beans and sorghum. Yessenia has been making hammocks for ten years, She learnt this trade from a relative, who taught her how to make them using silk and polyester thread.

In addition, she also has 150 chickens, which she fattens and then sells on. Her daughter helps her look after her chickens when she comes home from school.

Yessenia is asking for a loan to buy more silk and polyester thread so she can make the hammocks. This will maintain the income she can put towards household expenses.

She dreams of improving her adobe home so that she can have a better quality of life with her family and allow her daughter to finish her studies.

loans.use: to buy silk and polyester thread to make hammocks.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan, de 32 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, se caso hace siete años y junto a su esposa tienen un niño de 4 años de edad, su esposa trabaja todos los días de la semana vendiendo tortillas en la comunidad. 

Juan, trabaja en construcción con albañil, pero además de eso también labora de jornalero en los días que no trabaja en construcción; con mucho esfuerzo también trabaja con la crianza de especies menores en la comunidad. 

Juan, necesita el préstamo para pagar mozos que le ayuden a cortar la cosecha de maíz y de frijoles, porque ha cultivado 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y 3,500 metros cuadrados de frijol.

El sueño de Juan, es construir su propia casa, porque actualmente están alquilando.
texts.en:
Juan is 32-years old. He went to school until high school. He got married 7 years ago and with his wife they have one 4-year old son. His wife works every day selling tortillas in the community. Juan works in masonry construction. With a lot of effort, he also works raising small animals in the community.

Juan needs the loan to pay the workers that help him to cut down the corn and bean harvests because he has cultivated 7,000 square meters of corn and 3,500 square meters of beans. Juan's dream is to build his own home because he is currently renting.

loans.use: to pay the workers that help him to cut down the corn and bean harvests because he has cultivated 7,000 square meters of corn and 3,500 square meters of beans.

loans.name: Quebrada Seca Group

texts.es:
Iraida es una mujer de 47 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 3 hijos de 5, 11 y 21 años, y su negocio es la venta de frutas.
Ella es fuerte, constante y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad ‘el torno’ área rural que acopia la producción agrícola del lugar, los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería, el clima es cálido tropical muy húmedo con una temperatura que varía entre 21-31 grados centígrados.
Iraida es de tez trigueña, cabello castaño largo y físico delgado (sentada al centro, viste polera sin mangas azul y pantalón beige), su lengua materna es el guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza, su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica a la agricultura y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela  y el mayor estudia y trabaja. Viven en una casa propia construida de madera que cuenta con energía eléctrica, no cuenta con agua potable ni alcantarillado porque los servicios no han llegado al lugar. Las ganas de mejorar su negocio la llevaron a formar y liderar la banca de emprendimiento, los negocios de los socios son; venta de comida, servicio de taxi moto, venta de ropa de segunda mano, tejido de sombreros de sao, comercio de semillas e insecticidas, elaboración de queso y carnicería. Su negocio es la venta de fruta, ella compra fruta por mayor para venderla al menudeo a mercados y vendedoras minoristas como, jugueras, almacenes, tiendas y otros comercios, “se debe conocer las propiedades y beneficios de la fruta para la salud, y así lograr una alimentación sana para nuestro organismo…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con ventas por mayor y al menudeo, la desventaja es la falta de fruta para el negocio. Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales, ella desea comprar fruta de temporada por mayor. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Iraida solicita un préstamo para comprar fruta de temporada para vender por mayor y al menudeo.
texts.en:
Iraida is a 47-year old woman. She lives with her partner and has three children, ages 5, 11 and 21. Her business is selling fruit. She is strong, reliable and very hard-working. She carries out her business in "El Torno," a rural place that holds the agricultural production of the area. The people who live here work mainly in agriculture and livestock. The climate is warm, humid and tropical with a temperature that varies between 21-31 degrees Celsius.

Iraida is dark-skinned, with long brown hair and has a thin physique (she is seated in the middle, dressed in a blue sleeveless sweater and beige pants). Her native language is Guaraní that she speaks at home and she speaks Spanish in public and in her business. She shares her life with her husband who works in agriculture, and with her children who are in school and the eldest studies and works. They live in their own home made of wood and has electricity. It does not have running water or sewerage because these services have not arrived to the area.

The wish to improve her business led her to form and lead the banking enterprise. The businesses of the members are: selling food, motorcycle taxi service, selling secondhand clothing, making straw hats, selling seeds and insecticides, making cheese and butchery. Her business is selling fruit. She buys fruit wholesale to sell retail in the markets and small retailers like juicers, warehouses, shops and other businesses.

"We need to know the properties and benefits of fruit for our health and thus have a healthy diet for our body..." she says. The advantage of her business is that she has wholesale and retail sales. The disadvantage is the lack of fruit for the business. Her dream is that her children are professionals. She wants to buy seasonal fruit wholesale. This is the 1st loan sequence with the institution in the 5 years that she has been doing this work. For those reasons Iraida is asking for a loan to buy seasonal fruit to sell wholesale and retail.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruit to sell wholesale and retail.

loans.name: Waleed

texts.en:
Waleed is a 23-year-old, single man from Yata, Hebron city. He lives with his family in a small, old house. He is the only breadwinner for his family, and they depend on him for support. Waleed has a DJ system in the city. It is a good business and provides him with a good income, but the economic situation in general in the city is bad. 

Waleed took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him buy a new amplifier for his business. He hopes that this new inventory will enable him to increase his customer base and eventually save enough income to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy a new amplifier for his business

loans.name: Misakwani Small Farmers Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand is Veronica. She is 38 years old, married, and has four children. She is a member of Misakani Small Farmers which joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013 to benefit from courses on enterprise development and financial management.

She practices mixed farming, dairy and crop farming. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to expand her farming activities by starting fruit farming so as to increase her income. She says that she will use the income to buy a donkey that will help her transport manure to her farm enabling her to cultivate more produce. This will lead to more income to cater for her family's needs such as food and clothing.

Veronica is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support.

loans.use: to expand her farming activity by starting up fruit farming

loans.name: Saidbahrom

texts.ru: Саидбахром житель города Душанбе. Он женат и имеет 7 летную дочку. Саидбахром старший и единственный сын. Он любить свою семью, и он старается ради них, чтобы кормить и одевать семью. Саидбахром работает один. Его родители не имеет работу. Саидбахром имеет место торговля на возле рынка. Он занимается продажей диски. Саидбахром продает кино, клипы, концерты и музыка. У него имеется сборник фильмов и музыка. Саидбахром имеет много и постоянные клиенты. Он хочет расширить деятельность. Саидбахром хочет купить витрину для дисков и заказать больше фильмы и клипы. С такимим планами он обратился за кредитом.
texts.en:
Saidbahrom is a resident of Dushanbe city. He is married and has a seven-year-old daughter. Saidbahrom is the oldest child and only son. He loves his family, and he gives his all for their sake, in order to feed and clothe his family. 

Only Saidbahrom works. His parents do not have jobs. Saidbahrom has a shop by the market. He sells discs. Saidbahrom sells movies, clips, concert videos and music. He has a collection of films and music. 

Saidbahrom has a lot of customers and regulars. He wants to expand his business. Saidbahrom wants to buy disc cases and order more films and clips. He has applied for a loan with this plan in mind.

loans.use: to buy disc cases and discs.

loans.name: Odiljon

texts.ru: Его зовут Одилчон. Одилчон молодой и остроумный мужчина. Ему 23 года. Он также заботливый отец и примерный сын. Одилчон сам обеспечивает свою семью. Он работает кредитным офицером в МДО "Хумо". Одилчон каждый день работает с людьми и предлагает им кредиты, но в этот раз он сам нуждается в кредите. Его мама болеет мама и на нее лечение нужна большая сумма. Одилчон не видит другого выхода и обращается за заемными средствами.
texts.en:
This is Odiljon. Odiljon is a young and clever man. He is 23 years old. He is also a caring father and model son. Odiljon provides for his family himself. He works as a loan officer in MDO Humo. 

Every day Odiljon works with people and offers them loans, but this time he himself needs a loan. His mother is ill and he needs a considerable amount of money for her treatment. This is Odiljon's only option and he is requesting for borrowed funds.

loans.use: to pay for his mother's treatment

loans.name: Paula

texts.es: Doña Paula de 68 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de mariscos y pollos desde hace 10 años y con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda cambiando las puertas y ventanas pero como no posee de suficiente capital esta solicitando un credito para la compra de puertas, balcones y pago de mano de obra para poder tener una vivienda mas segura.
texts.en: Paula is 68-years old and lives in her own home with her family. She has worked selling seafood and chickens for 10 years and with what she gets from her sales, she manages to resolve some household expenses. She wants to improve her home, changing the doors and windows, but since she does not have enough money, she is asking for a loan to buy doors, balconies and to pay labor to be able to have a more secure home.

loans.use: to buy doors, balconies and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
"When smallholder farmers come together, they are powerful,” says Elizabeth, a 40-year-old farmer who has three children and lives in the village of Kwanza in the Kitale area of Kenya. For the past three years she has been actively involved in mixed farming.
