She has been practicing crop farming, but she has not been making good profits because of poor farming implements. This is why she is kindly seeking a loan to buy farm implements. Through the loan, she will be able to buy high-quality seeds, good fertilizer, and pesticides that she will use to greatly improve her crop production. Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques and therefore using high-quality seeds will assure her of a bumper harvest and hence, increased profit levels. 

Elizabeth is very visionary, and her goal for the season is to boost her crop production and be able to get more crop output than the previous year. All this can be achieved through lenders’ help and goodwill.

Elizabeth is a responsible mum and a hard worker who is willing to make every effort to meet her goals which includes leaving her farming business to her children one day to continue the work. Help Elizabeth with the loan she needs and allow him to realize her dreams.

loans.use: to buy farm implements

loans.name: Christo Nti Group

texts.en:
Francisca is a seamstress who owns a kiosk at a very busy area of Teshie. She is single with a child who is in the JHS level of education.
Being a single parent, with household responsibilities, this hardworking woman is determined to improve the standard of her business by purchasing more cloths and material for selling and sewing.

In order to do so, she is joining forces with Joyce in the group called Christo Nti (which means For Christ's Sake) to seek for a loan to boost their capital for the attainment of their goals.

This is their fourth loan cycle; with a loyal attitude in the repayment of loans, they will be very grateful if the needs are met.

loans.use: to purchase more cloths and material for selling and sewing

loans.name: Alh. Bala

texts.en:
Alhaji Bala is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Alhaji Bala is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer. 

Traditionally, Alhaji Bala would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Alhaji Bala will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price. 

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per Hectare of land, Alhaji Bala now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en:
Fridah is a 29-year-old lady, married and blessed with 2 children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa so as to acquire training, especially on enterprise development and financial management.

She operates a salon and she is borrowing a Kiva loan to expand her salon by buying hair products such as braids and weaves to meet her customers' demands. This will enable her to increase her income to support her basic family needs, like better food and education for her children.
Fridah is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy hair products such as braids and weaves to increase her income to support her family's needs, such as food and the children's education.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan, de 38 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, creció con sus padres trabajando en la agricultura sembrando maíz, frijoles y maicillo; se acompaño cuando tenía 20 años de edad, su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a cuidar los dos cerdos y aves de corral que poseen, es padre de tres hijos que estudian en el centro escolar más cercano.

Juan, se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos como maíz, frijoles y maicillo, estos son los alimentos básicos de su familia, pero aparte de la agricultura, también trabaja como albañil desde hace seis años, pues un amigo le enseño.

Juan, necesita el préstamo para cortar la cosecha de maíz y de frijol que tiene sembrado en la comunidad; con ello espera generar ingresos económicos para el desarrollo de la familia.

Juan, sueña con mejorar su vivienda porque es de bahareque y además espera seguir trabajando fuerte cada día para mejor su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juan is 38-years old. He went to school until the 9th grade. He grew up with his parents working in agriculture, planting corn, beans and sorghum. He got married when he was 20-years old and his wife works in domestic chores and taking care of the two pigs and poultry that they own. He is the father of three children who go to school at the closest school.

Juan works planting basic grains such as corn, beans and sorghum. These are the basic foods of his family but apart from agriculture, he has also worked as a mason for 6 years, because a friend taught him.

Juan needs the loan to cut the corn and bean harvests that he has planted in the community. With this, he hopes to get an income for his family's improvement. Juan dreams of improving his home because it is made of adobe, and he also hopes to keep working hard each day to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to cut the corn and bean harvests that he has planted in the community.

loans.name: Baballiyo

texts.en:
Baballiyo is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Baballiyo has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.
Before joining Babban Gona, Baballiyo would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as for food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Baballiyo can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.
As a Babban Gona member, Baballiyo will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Baballiyo is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Aminahan

texts.ru: Аминахан, 60 лет, замужем, мать 2 детей. Аминахан в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи на протяжении 15 лет занимается торговлей парфюмерными изделиями, детской одеждой, калош, напитков и прочего. В обороте есть товар на сумму 75,000 сом (KGS), ежемесячная прибыль до 7,000 сом (KGS). Бизнес рентабелен, поэтому Аминахан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку товаров для расширения ассортимента. Доходы от кредита Аминахан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение ее бизнеса.
texts.en:
Aminahan is 60 years old, married, and has two children. For 15 years Aminahan has been selling perfumes, children's clothes, galoshes, drinks, and other things as the main source of income for her family. 75,000 som (KGS) worth of goods is in circulation, and her monthly profit comes up to 7,000 som (KGS). 

The business is profitable, thus Aminahan has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) in order to buy goods to expand the variety. Aminahan plans to invest the funds from the loan in the further augmentation of her business.

loans.use: to buy commodities for retail sale in her shop

loans.name: Kamubo Women Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand is Rosemary.  She is 36 years old, married and a mother of two. She is a member of the Kamubo Women Group which joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa and has benefited from all the training.

She does maize, beans and dairy farming. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer and pesticides. This will greatly boost her farming activity hence increase her income. This will enable her cater for her children’s clothing, food and education expenses. 

Rosemary is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and pesticides to increase her income to provide for her children's education, food and clothing.

loans.name: Woni Youth Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand is Josephine. She is 32 years old, married and blessed with four children. She is a member of Woni Youth Group, which joined Hand in Hand, and has benefited from all the trainings especially enterprise development.
She operates a shop where she sells commodities like sugar, salt, tea leaves, soap, cooking fat and other household items. She has applied for a Kiva loan to add stock to her shop so that she can sell more and meet her customers’ demands. She says that this will help her increase her income which she will use to pay education fees for her children and provide better food and clothing.
All members in this group are happy and grateful to Kiva and its lenders for their help and support and promise to repay their loan promptly

loans.use: to add stock to her shop to meet customers' demands and hence to earn more income to pay education fees and buy better food and clothing for her children.

loans.name: Kivutini Women Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand is Janet, a member of Kivutini Women Group. She is forty-five years old, married and a mother of five. She joined hand in hand and has benefited from enterprise development trainings.
She farms maize, beans and vegetables. She is borrowing from Kiva to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer and pesticides. This will greatly boost her business and increase her income which will enable her to buy her children clothing and food.
Janet is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and pesticides to earn more income to buy clothing and food for her children.

loans.name: Paspanga Group

texts.fr: Maïmouna, est une femme mariée âgée de 48 ans. Elle exerce son activité depuis 6 ans. ce qui fait marcher c'est son dynamisme, elle vent sa marchandise en grande quantité, en détail à des clients qu'elle respecte bien. Elle veut acheter les des cartons de savon à 75 000 F. L'utilité du prêt c'est de pouvoir s'approvisionner en quantité suffisant afin de renforcer son activité. Elle a reçu le prêt 2 fois et à rembourser aux prévues ACFIME
texts.en:
Maïmouna is a 48 year old married woman. She has had her business for six years, her dynamic nature makes it work. She sells her merchandise in large quantities, retail, to customers she respects highly.
She wishes to buy boxes of soap for 75,000F. She will use the loan to be able to buy a sufficient quantity to strengthen her business.
She has received two previous loans and has repaid them according to the ACFIME plan.

loans.use: to buy boxes for soap for 75,000F.

loans.name: Oyshahon

texts.ru: Веселая и замечательная женщина Ойшахон. Она из города под названием Курган-Тюбе. Ойшахону 51 лет. У нее два сына в возрасте 24 и 21 лет. Ойшахон занимается пошивом «Курпа» и «курпача». «Курпа» -это квадратные матрасы, а «курпача»- это длинные матрасы. Этой деятельностью Ойшахон занимается 11 лет. Это ремесло не только помогает ей отвлечься от жизненных проблем, но является также главным источником дохода семье Ойшахон.  В округе её знают все,  талантливую рукодельницу Ойшахон. Недостатка в клиентов  её изделий нет. Ойшахон из-за нехватки денег решила взять кредит и приобрести больше ткани и хлопок для расширения своей работы.
texts.en:
This cheerful and wonderful woman is Oyshahon. She is from Qurgan-Tube city. Oyshahon is 51 years old. She has two sons who are 24 and 21 years old. Oyshahon is a tailor of kurpa and kurpacha. Kurpa are square mattresses, and kurpacha are long mattresses. 

Oyshahon has been in this line of work for 11 years. This business not only helps to distract her from life problems, but also is the main source of income for Oyshahon's family. Everyone knows Oyshahon and what a talented seamstress she is. She has no lack of clients for her wares. 

Due to insufficient funds, Oyshahon has decided to take a loan and purchase more fabrics and cotton for expanding her work.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and cotton

loans.name: Twende Kazi S.h.g Group

texts.en:
The man on the photo is Michael. He is 57 years old and a father of 4 children, of whom two are in school. He is a member of Twende kazi S.H.G., which joined Hand in Hand, and has benefited from all the trainings especially enterprise development and financial management.
He is a poultry farmer who keeps indigenous chickens and sells his chicks and eggs in a nearby town. He is applying for his third Kiva loan to renovate his poultry house, buy poultry feed and add more chicks. This will help him increase his income to assist in paying school fees.
Michael is grateful to Kiva lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to renovate his poultry house, buy poultry feed and add poultry stock to earn more income to pay education fees for his children.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Rose. She is twenty-nine years old, married and has two children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 and has benefited from enterprise development and financial management training.
She operates a grocery shop, and she is borrowing from Kiva to expand the business by adding potatoes, which she will be selling wholesale to other traders. This will enable her to increase her income to support basic family needs like food, shelter, clothing and education for her children.
Rose is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for this help and support, and she promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to add potato stock to her grocery to earn more income to cover basic family needs such as food, shelter, clothing and education.

loans.name: Tranquilité Group

texts.fr: Munyere-nkana est une femme d’affaires, vice-présidente du groupe de crédits «Tranquilité», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, âgée de 50 ans, mariée, mère de 5 enfants dont 3 scolarisés et 2 sont mariés. Elle est vendeuse des souliers usagés au marché du centre-ville depuis 25 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner  en 2 ballons de souliers. Elle commença son business avec le capital reçu de son mari qui est mécanicien. Elle souhaite augmenter son capital, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Munyere-nkana is a businesswoman, and vice president of the "Tranquility" loan group which is a client of Hekima MFI. She is 50 years old, married and the mother of five children - three are in education and two are married.
She has sold secondhand shoes in the town centre market for 25 years. She plans to buy two bales of shoes. She began her business with capital from her husband - who is a mechanic.
She plans to increase her capital, to educate and feed her children. Finally, she thanks Hekima for the support given to entrepreneurs without banking facilities.

loans.use: to buy two bales of shoes.

loans.name: Aigen Mae

texts.en:
Aigen Mae is 25 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur.

Aigen Mae has a food vending business in the Philippines. Aigen Mae requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, fish, spices, sugar, flour, etc. for her food production business.

Aigen Mae has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Aigen Mae would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, fish, spices, sugar, flour, etc. for her food production business.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 49 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur.

Editha has a fishing business in the Philippines. Editha requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her fishing business.

Editha has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Editha would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her fishing business.

loans.name: Elisé Group

texts.fr: Mubulanyi est un entrepreneuse, vendeuse des matériaux de construction, conseillère du groupe solidaire «Elisé», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 48 ans et mère de dix enfants parmi eux, 5 étudient, 4 ont fini leurs études et 1 est marié. Elle va acheter des planches pour renforcer ses activités. Elle commença ses activités par le capital reçu de ses parents depuis son jeune âge. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancable.
texts.en:
Mubulanyi is an entrepreneur, a seller of construction materials and councillor of the "Elisé" solidarity group, which is a client of Hekima MFI. She is 48 years old, married and the mother of ten children - five are in education, four have finished their studies, and one is married.
She is going to buy planks to strengthen her business. She began her business with capital received from her parents when she was young.
Finally, she thanks Hekima for the support given to entrepreneurs without banking facilities.

loans.use: to purchase planks.

loans.name: Manuchar

texts.en: Manuchar is 35 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and his pensioner mother in Zugdidi district. Manuchar works physically and gets a daily income. He decided to start a taxi business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 3,700 GEL. With the received credit he will purchase a car and will serve locals as a taxi driver. This will give him a chance to increase the family income and with the increased income Manuchar will be able to provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a car and start taxi business.

loans.name: José Ricardo

texts.es: José aprendió el arte de la marroquinería empíricamente, él es un hombre de 37 años trabajador y entusiasta, está soltero y su mayor anhelo es progresar en su negocio para que éste le permita comprar su casa propia.  Cuando inició su negocio lo hizo en compañía de su hermano, sin embargo su hermano desistió pero él siguió a pesar de lo difícil que fue comenzar con muy pocos recursos y sin capacitación. Con el pasar del tiempo logró mejorar su técnica y aprendió mucho más de sus errores, en la actualidad lleva cinco años en esta actividad con muy buenos resultados y con la finalidad de mejorar el acabado de sus productos, realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para adquirir una máquina troqueladora.  Esta inversión le permitirá realizar diseños a la vanguardia y manejará exclusividad.
texts.en:
José learned the art of leather work empirically. He is a 37-year-old man, hardworking, and enthusiastic. He is single and his greatest desire is to make progress on his business so that he is able to purchase his own home.

When he started his business he did it with his brother, however his brother withdrew, but he continued despite the difficulty of starting with very few resources and without training. With the passing of time he began to improve his technique and learned much more from his errors.

Now he has spent five years in this trade with very good results. With the goal of improving the final product, he made a request for a loan, a Kiva loan, an opportunity to engage with the financial life at the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, in order to acquire a stamping machine. This investment will enable him to make designs ahead of time and manage them exclusivity.

loans.use: to acquire a stamping machine.

loans.name: Maimunatu

texts.en:
Maimunatu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Maimunatu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Maimunatu would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs such as for food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Maimunatu can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% more than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Maimunatu will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Maimunatu is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Tsinampoizina Feno Hanitra

texts.fr:
Tsinampoizina a 34 ans. Il est marié à une vendeuse de produits de beauté. Le couple a 2 enfants dont le premier est scolarisé. Il travaille dur  pour faire face aux besoins de sa famille pour l’amélioration de leurs conditions de vie. 
Il se spécialise dans la vente de téléphonie et accessoires. Il a exercé cette activité depuis 2006. Avant, il travaillait comme chauffeur, en raison du départ de l’employeur à l’étranger, il se trouvait en chômage. Devant cette situation, il a repris l’activité de vente de téléphonie et accessoires pour laquelle, il a déjà une expérience.
Il  a pour objectif d’acquérir un terrain et d’y bâtir une maison pour quitter la maison de sa sœur où il habite en ce moment. Il veut être autonome.
texts.en:
Tsinampoizina is 34. He is married to a seller of beauty products. The couple has two children, the elder of which is in school. He works hard to make ends meet for the family, in order to improve their living standards.
He specialises in the sale of telephones and accessories, and has done so since 2006. Previously, he worked as a driver but when his employer left to move abroad, he found himself unemployed. Faced with this situation, he restarted the phone and accessory business, in which he already had some experience.
His goal is to get a building plot and to build a home, in order to move out of his sister's house, where he currently lives. He wants independence.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones, memory cards, radios and tablets.

loans.name: Celerina

texts.en: Celerina is a married woman; with her is her husband Rosalio. They live in Jagna, Bohol, a town which is an hour away from Bohol's capital Tagbilaran City. To reach other villages near their place is a challenge for most people due to limited options for transportation. Because of this, Celerina and her husband invested in a motorcycle to transport them to different places. She is asking for a loan to buy fuel, motor parts such as spare tires, and motor oil. With this, she can be assured that her husband can operate and serve more customers without any delay. Her income will be used for the education of her two children, food for her family and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy fuel, motor parts such as spare tires, and motor oil.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en: Marivic lives in a community where it is still convenient to raise hogs. She hails from the town of Duero, in Bohol. Aside from hog raising, Marivic also cooks bibingka (rice cake). Rice cake is a snack that is always a favorite in the Philippines. She usually earns PHP 2000 per month from her business. Marivic would like to buy feed in sacks because this will allow her to save. She is asking for a loan for this purpose. With additional funds for feed, she will not resort to buying in a per kilo basis, which is more costly to her. The income from her business will allow her to help her husband who works as an electrician, in raising their four children aged one to eighteen.

loans.use: to buy feed.

loans.name: Ikhlas

texts.en:
Ikhlas is 26 years old. She lives in the Southern Ghour. Ikhlas has always wanted to run her own business, but the ‎financial situation prevent her from achieving her dream.
She completed her high school education in 2009, and she is married with one child. She says her life will change once ‎she starts running her own business because she will be able to provide for her basic needs and help out her husband with household expenses.‎
Ikhlas needs a Kiva loan in order to start running her business, which is selling kitchen supplies. The loan will be used to ‎purchase more products such as cookers, pans, platters, trays and more. These items are necessary for her to increase her ‎profits. Ikhlas has big dreams for the future. Her dream is to run a successful independent business and help to support ‎her husband and her child and improve their living conditions.‎

loans.use: to ‎purchase more products to sell, such as cookers, pans, platters, trays and more.

loans.name: Socorro

texts.en:
Socorro is 53 years old, married with six children.

Socorro works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like detergent soap, soft-drinks, cereals, milk, juice, noodles, etc. to sell.

Socorro has borrowed and paid 27 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 30 years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Socorro aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like detergent soap, soft-drinks, cereals, milk, juice, noodles, etc. to sell.

loans.name: New York Group

texts.en:
Arlene is the featured borrower of New York group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua because they have always been friends since they left their hometown in the Philippines to come and work in Lebanon to earn a better income to support their beloved ones back in the Philippines.

Arlene is a 37-year-old widowed mother of three children who works hard as a housekeeper to cover the expenses and needs of her beloved kids and improve their living conditions. Today she is acquiring a loan to pay her children's school tuition fees. Arlene is the second lady on the right.

With respect to the other group members, Dara is the first on the right, Olivia is the second from the left, and Clarissa is the first on the left.

loans.use: To pay her children's school tuition fees

loans.name: Sawsan

texts.en:
Sawsan is 47 years old. She is a widowed woman without children and now she lives with her parents. She works very hard to ‎provide for them. 
Sawsan runs her business which is selling blankets and requested a loan buy additional items to sell, and blankets to ‎increase her income.‎ Sawsan has been in this business for many years and sells a variety of items such as bedding and blankets. 

In the future, Sawsan would like to save enough money so that she could afford to open her business and go to college.‎

loans.use: to sell a variety of items such as bedding and blankets.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 27 years old and single.  

Rowena is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Rowena requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rowena has been in pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rowena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Maysaa

texts.en:
Maysaa is 41 years old and married with four children. With four children in school, Maysaa works very hard to provide for ‎them and helps her husband with the household expenses. 
‎ 
Maysaa started a business which sells sweets. She makes sweets in her home by order then she sells them. She ‎requested a loan to expand her business and to buy dry fruit, flour, eggs, oil, plain chocolate, and what she needs to make ‎sweets. That will help her to develop her work to increase her income and improve her standard of living.‎

In the future, Maysaa would like to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to college.‎

loans.use: to expand her business and to buy dry fruit, flour, eggs, oil, plain chocolate, and what she needs to make ‎sweets.

loans.name: Shahid

texts.en:
Shahid is maize farmer from Kaduna. As a member of Babban Gona, Shahid is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Shahid would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Shahid can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Shahid is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Union Sicre Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “UNION SICRE”; Este banco se ubicada en la  provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Estela es una mujer trabajadora, ella se dedica a la agricultura, produce diversos productos, como frutas y tubérculos, ella saco adelante a su familia con esta actividad, ella tiene 65 años de edad y continua trabajando.
La socia solicito el préstamo para comprar semillas y abono. Ella desea producir más y estos recursos que le brindara el crédito le servirán de mucho.
en la fotografía grupal se protegió los rostros de los menores hijos de los socios.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, a la agricultura, venta de productos alimenticios por mayor, a brindar servicios de seguridad, entre otros.

Los socios agradecen el crédito otorgado por los inversionistas de KIVA  y se comprometen a cumplir sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
The borrowers belong to the Union Sicre communal bank. This bank is located in La Convención province and Cusco department.

The borrower, Estela, is a hard-working woman. She works in agriculture and produces a variety of products such as fruits and tubers. She got her family ahead with this work, she is 65 years old and continues working.

The borrower asked for the loan to purchase seeds and manure. She wants to produce more and these resources that the loan will offer her will help her a lot.

In the group photo, the faces of the borrowers' young children have been hidden.

The other borrowers work at a business selling animals, in agriculture, selling food products in bulk, offering security services, and more.

The borrowers are grateful for the loan granted by the Kiva investors and promise to make their payments punctually.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and manure.

loans.name: Medi Mafo Tease Group

texts.en:
Christiana is 42 years of age. She is from Assin Fosu in the Assin Central District of the Central Region of Ghana. Christiana is the leader of Medi Mafo Tease group. She is married and lives with her husband. Christiana has 2 children. The ages of her children are 3 and 6 years. She has 5 dependents. 

Christiana is a business woman and has her own container. She deals in general in the local market. Christiana is requesting a loan of GHS 6,000 from the field partner to improve her business. She started her business with her own capital of GHS 1,000. Christiana will use the current loan to buy additional supplies such as detergents, mosquito coils, insecticide sprays, sugar, cooking oils, beans, male and female sandals, sardines, eggs, coffee, noodles and other things to sell. She is happy with the loan that is offered from the Field Partner for her to have more working capital to buy more goods and she hopes with this loan she can increase her income. She aspires to see her business continue to grow so that she can save enough money to build a house and educate her children well. Christiana and her other group member thank all their Kiva micro lenders for their generosity.

loans.use: to buy detergents, mosquito coils, insecticide sprays, sugar, cooking oils, eggs,beans, male and female sandals, sardines, coffee, noodles etc for resale.

loans.name: Las Flores De Tambocorral Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LAS FLORES DE TAMBOCORRAL”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Santa Teresa, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Modesta es una mujer trabajadora ella se dedica a su negocio de venta al por mayor de materias primas agropecuarios tanto como tubérculos y frutas. La socia tiene 53 años  de edad , y su deseos es salir adelante aportando su esfuerzo en su hogar.
La socia solicito el préstamo para comprar plátanos y mangos.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.

Los socios agradecen el crédito otorgado por los inversionistas de KIVA  y se comprometen a cumplir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
The members belong to Las Flores de Tambocorral Communal Bank, located in the district of Santa Teresa in the province of La Convención and department of Cusco.

Modesta, 53 is a hardworking woman who earns a living in her business selling produce such as tubers and fruit. She wants to get ahead making this effort for her household.

She requested the loan to buy bananas and mangos.

The other members earn a living in animal sales, clothing sales, grocery sales, and food sales. They're grateful for the loan granted by Kiva lenders and they promise to make their payments.

loans.use: to buy bananas and mangos

loans.name: Blanca Mirian

texts.es:
Blanca, de 51 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está casada, su pareja se dedica a la agricultura y tienen cuatro hijos, pero ella solo cuida dos nietos que le ha dejado uno de sus hijos. 

Blanca, tiene una tienda en su casa y un puesto de venta de pollos deshuesado en un puesto en el municipio donde vive, tiene 23 años de dedicarse a este tipo de negocio, esto lo aprendió de su padre quien le enseño desde muy joven a trabajar de esa manera.

Blanca, necesita el préstamo para comprar azúcar, lejía, jabón, arroz, una vitrina y una refrigerada para mostrar su producto. 

Blanca, sueña con seguir trabajando con el comercio de venta de pollos.
texts.en:
Blanca, 51 years old, went to school up to the sixth grade, is married, her spouse works in agriculture and they have four children but she only cares for two grandchildren that one of her children has left her.

Blanca has a store in her house and a stand selling boned chicken at a stand in the municipality where she lives. She has been working at this type of business for 23 years, she learned it from her father who showed her to work in this way when she was very young.

Blanca needs to loan to purchase sugar, bleach, soap, rice, a display case and a refrigerator to show her products.

Blanca dreams of continuing to work in business with the sale of chickens.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, bleach, soap, rice, a display case and a refrigerator to display her products.

loans.name: Samuel Antonio

texts.es:
Samuel, de 22 años de edad, es padre de un niño de 1 año de edad, pero vive solo en una casa que se encuentra ubicada dentro del terreno de sus padres.

Samuel, trabaja todos los días de la semana en una empresa que vende productos lácteos, sus funciones son la preparación de los productos lácteos, trabaja en este lugar desde hace dos años y su horario de labores es desde las 6:00 a.m. hasta las 4:00 p.m.

Samuel, necesita el préstamo para comprar cuatro cerdos y para comprar concetrado para ellos, ya que quiere iniciar la crianza de estos animales, para generar ingresos extras. 

Samiel, sueña con crecer económicamente a través de la comercialización de cerdos.
texts.en:
Samuel, 22 years old, is the father of a 1-year-old child but he lives alone in a house that is located on his parents' land.

Samuel works every day of the week at a business that sells dairy products, his job is the preparation of the dairy products. He has worked at this place for the past two years and his work schedule is from 6:00 am to 4:00 pm.

Samuel needs the loan to purchase four pigs and to purchase concentrated feed for them, since he wants to begin raising these animals to generate extra income.

Samuel dreams of growing economically through selling pigs.

loans.use: to purchase four pigs and to purchase concentrated feed for them.

loans.name: María Xenia

texts.es:
Xenia, de 51 años de edad, trabaja y vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos, su hijo trabaja como empleado en un taller de mecánica y su hija está terminando el bachillerato, mientras su esposo trabaja y le ayuda a ella con los gastos del hogar. 

Xenia, se dedica a trabajar como empleada de limpieza en una empresa privada, tiene varios años de trabajar en ese lugar, pero tiene mucho interes en colocar una tienda de productos de primera necesidad en su tienda. 

Xenia, necesita el préstamo para colocar una tienda en su casa con productos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, café, aceite, entre otros productos, para tener un ingreso extra y poder pagar la universidad de su hija menor. 

Los sueños de Xenia, son poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y tambien tener una mejor estabilidad economica para ellos.
texts.en:
Xenia, 51 years old, works and lives with her husband and their two children. Her son works as an employee in a mechanic shop and her daughter is finishing her secondary school, while her husband works and helps her with the household expenses.

Xenia works as an employee cleaning at a private business. She has been working in this place for some years but she is very interested in establishing a store of basic products in her store.

Xenia needs the loan to establish a store in her house with products such as rice, beans, sugar, coffee, oil and other products, to have extra income and be able to pay for her younger daughter's university education.

Xenia's dreams are to be able to improve her family's quality of life and also to have better economic stability for them.

loans.use: to establish a store in her house with products such as rice, beans, sugar, coffee, oil and other products.

loans.name: Luis Marcelo

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre de 26 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo recién nacido, y su negocio es la confección de ropa para bebé.
Él es independiente, emprendedora y muy trabajador. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona Sur de la ciudad, caracterizada por acoger a la mayor parte de la población y por la producción manufacturera en todas las áreas, de clima cálido tropical muy húmedo.
Luis es de tez morena, cabello negro corto y físico delgado, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza, su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al mismo negocio, viven en un cuarto propiedad de la familia construido de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la confección de ropa de temporada para bebé como, en verano; poleras de algodón y pantalones cortos, y en invierno; bolsas de dormir y edredones, “la ropa infantil es muy comercial porque los papás compran todo para sus niños…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que la ropa se vende continuamente, la desventaja es la falta de una máquina de coser industrial. Su sueño es abrir una tienda de ropa en su casa, él desea comprar una máquina de coser industrial para mejorar sus diseños. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Luis solicita un préstamo para comprar una máquina de coser industrial para mejorar sus diseños y la calidad del terminado.
texts.en:
Luis is 26 years old. He lives with his spouse and he has a son who was recently born. He has a business making clothing for babies.

Luis is independent, entrepreneurial and a hard worker. He runs his business in the southern zone of the city which is characterized by its housing of the majority of the population and by the presence of manufacturing production in all of the neighborhoods, and its hot and very humid climate.

Luis has a dark complexion, short dark hair and a skinny physique. His native language is Guaraní which is spoken by his family and he speaks Spanish because of the surrounding culture and the business that he runs. He shares his life with his wife who works on the same business. They live in a room that is owned by their family which is made of bricks and has potable water, electricity and a sewage system.

Luis has a business making seasonal clothing for babies, such as, in the summer; cotton t-shirts and shorts, and in the winter; sleeping bags and quilts. "Clothing for infants is very commercial because the parents buy everything for their children" he told us. The advantage of his business is that he sells the clothing continually. The disadvantage is the lack of an industrial sewing machine. His dream is to open a clothing store in his house and he wants to buy an industrial sewing machine to improve his designs. This is the first sequence of loans he has sought from the institution in the four years he has done this activity. It is because of these motivations that Luis is seeking a loan to purchase an industrial sewing machine to improve his designs and the quality of the finished product.

loans.use: to purchase an industrial sewing machine to improve his designs and the quality of the finished product.

loans.name: Concepcion Guadalupe

texts.es: Concepcion de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta repuestos para bicicletas desde hace mas de 5 años su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas repuestos por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Concepcion, 42 years old, lives in her own house with her family. She has worked selling bicycle parts for over 5 years. Her business is located in her home and she has many customers. With the earnings that she gets, she manages to cover some of the household expenses. She is asking for a loan to purchase more parts in bulk to be able to continue with her sales and, so, to have more economic income.

loans.use: to purchase more bicycle parts in bulk.

loans.name: Mahasen

texts.en:
Mahasen is 36 years old, single, and lives with her brother who depends on her. Mahasen makes a living running a shop ‎where she sells clothes and household supplies.

Mahasen is applying for a loan in order to buy more products such as kids' clothes, women`s clothes, pajamas, kitchen ‎supplies, and other products, to stock up her shop. By doing so, Mahasen can have more satisfied customers. This will ‎allow her to increase her income and give her brother a better quality of life.

Mahasen`s dream is to expand her business and to be able to improve her living conditions.‎

loans.use: to buy more products such as kids' clothes, women`s clothes, pajamas, kitchen ‎supplies, and other products to stock up her shop.

loans.name: Yehowa Akwe Group

texts.en:
In the province of Teshie in the Greater Accra region of Ghana is the Yehowa Akwe group, which is composed of three members--one male and two females.

Susuana is single with the desire to sell her clothes with zeal on a wholesale basis. Due to the festive Christmas season approaching, she is seeking a loan from Kiva through ID Ghana to purchase more clothes for customers. This is her 11th loan cycle and she hopes her loan will be granted.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell on a wholesale basis.

loans.name: Maria Celsa

texts.es:
María, de 55 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, está casada, su esposo es pensionado y tienen 4 hijos pero ya que tiene sus hogares aparte y ella solo vive con su esposo y sus dos nietos.

María, se dedica a la elaboración y comercio de mantelina, esta es una prenda que usan personas de determinada religión, la mayoría de las personas que asisten a este tipo de religión son sus clientes, ella tiene 5 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, pero aparte de eso también se dedica a hacer tablillas de cacao para hacer chocolate.

María, necesita el préstamo para comprar tela y cacao para poder tener suficiente materia prima para no estar viajado a comprar muy seguido, ya que esto le incurre en gastos.

Sus sueños son, tener siempre ingresos para que sus nietos puedan estudiar y siempre tener lo necesario para su familia.
texts.en:
María is 55 years old. She studied until is the fourth grade, is married to her husband who is retired and they have four children who currently have their own separate homes. She only lives with her husband and her two grandchildren.

María, works making and selling capes which are an item that is used by certain religious people. The majority of the people who follow this type of religion are her customers. She has 5 years of experience working on this activity, but aside for this she also works making tablets of cocoa to make chocolate.

María needs the loan to purchase fabric and cocoa in order to have sufficient primary materials so that she does not have to travel to purchase more very often because this incurs expenses. Her dreams are to always have an income so that her grandchildren can attend school and to always have what is necessary for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and cocoa in order to have sufficient primary materials.

loans.name: Sugey María

texts.es: Su buena sazón y el gusto por la cocina, permitieron que Sugey emprendiera su idea de negocio de la mano de su cónyuge, un restaurante ubicado en un barrio del municipio de Soledad en donde ofrecen una gran variedad de comida típica: desayunos, almuerzos y cenas. Esta emprendedora mujer cuenta con siete años de experiencia en el ámbito, actividad que le ha permitido estar cerca de su familia y proveyendo de bienestar con los frutos de su trabajo.  Ella es madre de tres hijos menores de edad que se encuentran cursando sus estudios académicos y su mayor anhelo es verlos graduados en las carreras profesionales que deseen para que tengan un futuro promisorio. Sus principales clientes son vecinos, amigos y transeúntes, sin embargo con el pasar del tiempo su capital no está abasteciendo la demanda y para mitigar la situación aplicó a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar víveres: arroz, aceite, verduras, carnes, frutas y demás. Con esta inversión podrá atender a nuevos comensales y trabajar sin contratiempos.  Su meta a futuro es tener sucursales y apoyar en los gastos de estudios de sus hijos.
texts.en: Her good flavors and her love of cooking allowed Sugey to undertake her idea of a business at the hand of her spouse, a restaurant located in a neighborhood in the municipality of Soledad where they offer a great variety of traditional meals: breakfasts, lunches and dinners. This enterprising woman has seven years of experience in the area, work that has allowed her to be near her family and provide for the well-being with the fruits of her labor. She is the mother of three young children who are working on their academic studies and her greatest desire is to see them graduated with professional careers which they want so that they have a promising future. Her primary customers are neighbors, friends and passers-by, however with the passing of time her capital is not meeting the demand and to mitigate the situation, she applied for a Kiva loan, her first financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to purchase groceries: rice, oil, vegetables, meats, fruits, and more. With this investment, she will be able to serve new customers and work without problems. Her goal for the future is to have branches and support her children's education expenses.

loans.use: to purchase groceries: rice, oil, vegetables, mean, fruit, and more.

loans.name: Luis Oswaldo

texts.es: Luis es un humilde trabajador que reside en un barrio del municipio de Barranquilla en compañía de su cónyuge y sus seis hijo de 12, 9, 8, 7, 5 y 2 años de edad, que solventa a su familia con su negocio de ventas de comidas en el que trabaja de viernes a domingos y festivos a partir de las      5 p.m. hasta las 12 p.m.  Su negocio inició después de haber prestado el servicio militar y al no encontrar una oportunidad laborar en una empresa privada, emprendió su propio negocio contando con buenos resultados.  Él ofrece una variada carta de comidas rápidas entre ellas perros calientes, salchipapas, fritos de maíz; arepas y empanadas y pinchos de carne y pollo.  Sus clientes son transeúntes del sector donde reside quienes degustan de sus comidas e inmediamente las cancelan.  Luis realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar un horno y víveres para sus comidas: arroz, aceite, pollo, aderezos y demás.  Con esta inversión podrá ofertar nuevos productos que dinamizaran las ventas. Su meta es tener casa propia y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en: Luis is a humble hard-worker who lives in a neighborhood in the municipality of Barranquilla in the company of his spouse and his six children, ages 12, 9, 8, 7, 5, and 2. He supports his family with his business selling food, in which he works Friday to Sunday and holidays from 5 pm to 12 pm. He began his business after having served in the military and, when he didn't find work opportunities in private businesses, he established his own business with good results. He sells a varied menu of fast food, among them hot dogs, sausages with French fries, fried corn, arepas and empenadas and bite-sized meat and chicken. His customers are passers-by in the area where he lives who enjoy his food and immediately pay for them. Luis completed a loan application, a Kiva loan, an opportunity to become involved in the financial life through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to purchase an oven and groceries for his food: rice, oil, chicken, seasonings, and more. With this investment he will be able to offer new products which will boost his sales. His goal is to have his own house and offer his children a good education.

loans.use: to purchase an oven and groceries for his food: rice, oil, chicken, seasonings, and more.

loans.name: In God Traders Group

texts.en:
Grace is 38 years old. She comes from Assin Fosu in the Assin North District of the Central Region of Ghana. Grace (first on the right in the group picture) is the group representative of In God Traders. She is married with four children between the ages of 5 to 19 years old. Grace's husband is a teacher and has been very supportive.

She has sold sewing items, baby diapers, clothes, and sanitary pads for five years. Grace started the business after realizing that her husband’s meager wages could hardly support them as a family. She has very good customer care and her customers are very fond of her. Grace has been with the field partner since 2010 to grow her business to the current level through microloan support. Grace’s main challenge is additional funds to buy her goods in larger quantities. She will use the current loan to buy more sewing threads, baby diapers, children's clothes, sanitary pads, toiletries, tape measure, zippers, etc., for resale. Grace will use part of her profits to pay her children’s educational expenses. Grace and her group member thank all of their Kiva microlenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase sewing threads, baby diapers, children's clothes, toiletries, tape measures, zippers, and sanitary pads for resale.

loans.name: Los Rosales De Urusayhua Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LOS ROSALES DE URUSAYHUA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Echarate, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.
El socio Mario es una persona trabajadora, el es casado y tiene 47 años de edad.

el  socio se dedica a su trabajo de transportista, hace diferentes servicios particulares , donde obtiene sus ingresos que ayudan a salir a adelante a su hogar.
El socio necesita repuestos para su vehículo, ya que es su herramienta de trabajo y tiene que estar bien mantenido, para poder brindar sus servicios de forma segura.el comprara con el crédito llantas y aceite de carro .

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, a la agricultura, venta de productos alimenticios, negocio de tienda de abarrotes entre otros.

Los socios agradecen el crédito otorgado por los inversionistas de KIVA  y se comprometen a cumplir sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
These members belong to the communal bank "The Roses of Urusayhua." This bank is located in the district of Echarate which is part of the province of La Convención in the county of Cusco.

The member, Mario, is a very hard worker. He is married and is 47 years old. Mario works at his job in transportation. He provides different types of services wherefrom he obtains his earnings that help his home to get ahead. He needs parts for his vehicle which is a tool for work and he needs it to be well maintained in order to provide his services in a safe way. With the loan he will buy tires and motor oil.

The other members work in businesses selling animals, agriculture, selling food products, and a grocery store, among others. The members are thankful for the loan provided by the Kiva investors and they promise to complete their payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase tires and motor oil.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 23 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica desde hace mas de un año a la sastrería, elabora una variedad de ropa y tiene muchos clientes por su buen trabajo, con las ganancias que obtiene de su trabajo es como logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de variedad de telas por mayor, hilos, agujas, botones, elásticos, etc. y así poder continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en: The young man, whose face has been pixelated because he is 23 years old and lives in a high-risk zone, has worked for over a year at tailoring. He makes a variety of clothing and has many customers due to his good work. With the earnings that he gets from his work, is how he manages to cover some of the costs of his household. The young man lives in his own house with his family. He is asking for a loan to purchase a variety of fabric in bulk, thread, needles, buttons, elastics, etc. and so to be able to continue with his work which generates good earnings for him.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fabric in bulk, thread, needles, buttons, elastics, etc.

loans.name: Neyda Elena

texts.es: La señorita Nehyda tiene 30 años de edad, es soltera no tiene hijos viven con sus padres, proviene de una familia humilde pero trabajadora con buenos principios morales, desde muy joven se dedicó a trabajar para poder costear sus estudios con mucho esfuerzo de ella y de sus padres culmino sus estudios profesionales graduándose de Ingeniera en alimentos con méritos de estudio ella trabaja en un estudio de laboratorio por la experiencia que adquirió en esa rama, la señortia Neyda necesita el préstamo para comprar equipos como ser desecadoras al vacío, paneles solares, incubadoras, evaporadores y demás equipos para implementar una planta piloto para procesar alimentos y de esa manera poder obtener sus derivados para estudiar los cambios externos e internos que tienen algunos productos como ser; ajo negro, papaya fermentada, harina de zapallo, etc  solo le faltan estos equipos, para de esta manera emprender en su propio negocio y poder realizarse como profesional.
texts.en:
Neyhda is 30 years old, single and has no children She lives with her parents and they are a humble family with good moral values. From a very young age she has worked hard, as her parents have, to cover the costs of her education to get a degree in food engineering which she earned with high honors. She works for a research laboratory based on the experience she has acquired in the field.

Neyda is in need of a loan to buy equipment such as a dehydrator, solar panels, incubators and evaporators, as well as equipment to start a pilot plant to process food and study the external and internal changes in the byproducts of some of the foods such as black garlic, fermented papaya, squash, etc. She needs this equipment to start her own business and realize herself as a professional.

loans.use: to buy equipment such as a dehydrator, solar panels, incubators, and evaporators for her food processing plant to generate income for her family.

loans.name: Silvia Eugenia

texts.es: La señora Silvia tiene 35 años trabaja juntamente  en la elaboración de pan tiene 2 hijos es de estado civil divorciada vive juntamente con sus hijos en la casa de su madre  no termino su estudios en la universidad  por falta de tiempo se casó muy joven y por problemas económicos, solo pudo estudiar una carrera técnica se recibió como panadera artesanal cuenta con un certificado  hoy requiere el crédito para emprender su propio negocio ya que con el dinero invertirá en una maquina Sobadora para la elaboración de panes de mayor tamaño y precio quiere poner una panadería con variedad  de  productos como ser masas galletas tortas  y diferentes panes su objetivo es tener una panadería surtida donde cuente con todos los productos que el consumidor requiera y así también pueda sacar a sus hijos adelante ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo donde pueda generar ingresos para solventar a su familia.
texts.en: Silvia is 35 years old, and works together in making bread. She has 2 children and is divorced, she lives with her children in her mother's house. She didn't complete her education at the university because of the lack of time. She got married very young and due to economic problems she was only able to study for a technical degree, she got a certificate as a artisan baker. Today she needs the loan to establish her own business since with the money she will invest in a kneading machine to make larger breads and at a better price. She wants to establish a bakery with a variety of products such as dough, cookies, pastries and different bread. Her goal is to have a stocked bakery where she has all the products that the consumer needs and also she can get her children ahead since this is her only source of work where she can generate income to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase a kneading machine to make bread of a larger size and in this way generate more income for her family.

loans.name: Roy

texts.en:
Roy is a driver of a tricycle (a motorcycle with a covered sidecar that seats anywhere from one passenger to as many as the driver will allow). He is a 36-year-old man from the city of Baybay, Leyte. He is married and has two children, 16 and 8 years old. For three years, Roy has supported and provided for his family by driving his tricycle. Aside from this, he is also engaged in raising pigs and his wife runs a sari-sari (variety) store. He wishes in the future to have enough income to raise his family well, provide them food to eat, and have enough money to pay school fees.

Roy is asking for a loan to buy spare parts for his tricycle in order to maintain its good condition. Aside from this, he will also buy varieties of goods such as toiletries, spices, snack foods, canned goods and drinks for their store and feed for their pigs. In this way, he will be able to increase their income and that will help them augment their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to maintain his motorcycle, as well as toiletries, spices, snack foods, canned goods and drinks for his wife's sari-sari shop and feed for their pigs.

loans.name: Oscar Heraclio

texts.es: Oscar es un hombre trabajador de 64 años que vive en la localidad rural de Pampacolca, que está ubicado en Arequipa. Él se dedica a la agricultura y a la cría de vacas y cerdos orgánicos, poniendo siempre mucha atención en el cuidado y en la alimentación que les brinda. Solicita el micro crédito para poder comprar cerdos orgánicos y para la alimentación orgánica de estos. En el futuro espera poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y seguir contando con buena salud, razón por la cual apuesta por lo orgánico.
texts.en: Oscar is a hard-working man, 64 years old, who lives in a rural locality of Pampacolca which is located in Arequipa. He works in agriculture and raising organic cows and pigs, always putting a lot of attention into the care and food that he offers them. He asks for this micro-loan to be able to purchase organic pigs and for their organic food. In the future, he hopes to be able to improve his living conditions and be able to continue having good health, the reason for which he invests in the organic.

loans.use: to purchase organic pigs and organic feed for this livestock to sell its meat at a better price, and so, increase his income.

loans.name: Joelline

texts.fr:
Joelline a 25 ans, elle s’est  mariée après 3 années d’activité. Elle a 5 enfants ( 8-5-2 ans) , dont les 2 premiers sont scolarisés. Son mari fournit de la main d’œuvre dans la construction de maison. 
Elle est dans la vente de sacs en jute depuis 2004. Dès qu’elle a abandonné ses études, elle a aidé ses parents dans la vente de sacs en jute. Elle  est à son 4eme prêt. Étant petite, elle était déjà indépendante. Et maintenant elle a son propre local de vente. Due à l’évolution de son activité, elle a pu faire de l’élevage porcin. Le prêt servira à acheter des sacs en jute pour les revendre. Elle souhaite  devenir grossiste dans la vente de sac en jute.
texts.en:
Joelline is 25 years old. She married after three years of business activity. She has five children (8, 5, and 2 years old), of whom the first two are in school. Her husband works in house construction.

She has been selling jute bags since 2004. As soon as she left school she helped her parents in selling jute bags. This is her 4th loan.

She was independent-minded from an early age, and now has her own sales outlet. Thanks to her developing business she was able to start pig farming. 

The loan will be used to buy jute bags for resale. She wants to become a wholesaler in jute bag sales.

loans.use: buy 1600 jute bags

loans.name: Buganvilla Group

texts.es:
Maria Tiene 32 años de edad, soltera, tienen 3 hijos de 2, 6 y 9 años, y su negocio es la venta de queques.
Ella es constante, generosa y muy amigable. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona Sur de la ciudad, caracterizada por acoger a la mayor parte de la población y por la producción manufacturera en todas las áreas, de clima cálido tropical muy húmedo.
Maria Es de tez morena, esta tura mediana y de cabello negro azabache largo (segunda de la izquierda, viste polera azul y pantalón capri celeste), su lengua materna es el guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. El deseo de mejorar su negocio la llevó a liderar la banca de emprendimiento, los negocios de los socios son; confección de sábanas, venta de comida, venta de empanadas, frutería, verdulería, tienda de abarrotes y taller de cerrajería. Su negocio es la venta de queques;  estos son una masa que llevan como ingredientes,  harina, leche, huevos, azúcar, levadura y se hornean dentro de un molde, actividad que realiza en su domicilio en un horno casero, “horneo y salgo a vender aún calientes, estos se venden más rápido…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que vende toda su producción a diario, la desventaja es la capacidad de su horno casero. Su sueño es tener un puesto de venta en el mercado para dejar de ambular, ella desea comprar un horno industrial. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que María solicita un préstamo para comprar un horno industrial para hornear mayor cantidad de queques.
texts.en:
Maria, 32, is single and has three children, ages 2, 6 and 9. Her business is selling cakes.

She is consistent, generous and very friendly; and does her work in the southern part of the city which is known mainly for housing most of the population and for wide range of manufacturing activity its humid, tropical climate.

Maria has a dark complexion, is of medium height and has long black hair (she is second from the left wearing a blue top and light blue capri pants). Her mother tongue is Guarani which she speaks at home; she also speaks Spanish for general purposes and when doing business.

She shares her life with her children who attend school. They live in a rented brick house that has running water, electricity and sewage pipes.

Maria sells cakes which she makes at home in a domestic oven. For her products she needs flour, milk, eggs, sugar and yeast. "I bake the cakes and go out and sell them hot so they go a lot faster..." she says. The advantage of her business is that she sells everything she makes on a daily basis. The disadvantage is the lack of capacity of the home oven. Her dream is to have a stall at the market so she does not have to work as a street vendor. She wants to buy an industrial oven. This is her first loan through the institution in the five years she has been in business.

Maria is requesting the loan to buy an industrial oven to make more cakes.

loans.use: to buy an industrial oven to make more cakes.

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es:
María, de 64 años de edad, es viuda, tiene dos hijos que ya son mayores de edad, ella solo vive con dos nietos a quienes cuida y les paga la escuela, ella no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, debido a los problemas que sufrió el país a causa de la guerra.

María, se dedica a la crianza de especies menores como cerdos y también aves de corral, las cuales engorda por un tiempo para luego venderlas; ella desde pequeña aprendió el arte de elaborar hamacas de mezcal, lasos y matates de mezcal, este oficio se lo enseñaron sus padres y antes solo trabajaba criando ganado en pequeña escala, ahora tiene cinco vacas y sus nietos le ayudan a cuidar y alimentar los pollos y los cerdos.

María, necesita el préstamo para comprar 3 cerdos para engordarlos y también para mejorar el techo de la granja. 

El sueño de María, es  seguir trabajando en la crianza de especies menores y en la crianza de ganad
texts.en:
María, 64 years old, is a widow and she has two children who are of age. She lives with two grandchildren whom she takes care of and pays for their school education. She did not have the opportunity to study due to the problems suffered by the country because of the war.

María makes a living breeding small animals like swine and also poultry. She fattens them up for a period of time to sell them afterwards. As a child, she learned how to make agave fiber hammocks, lassos and bags. Her parents taught her this craft.

Previously she only worked breeding livestock on a small scale. Now she has five cows and her grandchildren are helping her to take care and feed the chicken and swine.

María needs the loan to buy 3 pigs to fatten them up and also to improve the farm's roof.

María's dream is to continue working breeding small animals and livestock.

loans.use: to buy 3 pigs to fatten them up and also to improve the farm's roof.

loans.name: Alhaji Abdu

texts.en:
Alhaji Abdu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Alhaji Abdu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Alhaji Abdu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Alhaji Abdu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Alhaji Abdu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land.

Alhaji Abdu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Abdulrazak

texts.en:
Abdulrazak is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Abdulrazak is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Abdulrazak would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Abdulrazak will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Abdulrazak now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Breakthrough Group

texts.en:
The women in the picture above believe that every challenge you encounter in life is a fork in the road. You have to choose which way to go; backward, forward, breakdown or breakthrough. Although everybody else is standing, these women aspire to stand out in their businesses through hard work and perseverance. In this case surely, winners are not born winners; they are learning and practising how to win. As for Demetria and her group members; while most are dreaming of success, they wake-up and work hard to achieve it. Despite the economic situation around them, they know that sometimes you win and sometimes you learn, therefore, giving up is never an option.

Demetria is a member of the Breakthrough group, she is 44 years old. Demetria is a cross-border trader to Zambia, South Africa and Botswana where she restocks new and second hand clothes for re-sale. She also runs a pre-school which currently has 34 pupils enrolled. Although her husband has been on retirement for 8 years now, Demetria has been taking care of her family with very little struggles. But sustaining two businesses has been taking a lot more than she expected. Since she opened her pre-school in 2014, Demetria has been unable to cross the border as much as she used to. To be competitive, she has to restock at least twice a month to South Africa, Botswana or Zambia. There is always not enough capital for her to cross the border and keep her pre-school running. This is when Demetria and her friends joined Thrive in September 2015. The training they received has gone a long way in enriching her business knowledge in areas such as savings, daily record keeping and marketing. With a loan from Thrive, Demetria hopes to boost both her business by growing her pre-school and restocking more clothing from the neighbouring countries.

loans.use: to buy books and other educational materials for her pre-school and more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: La Señora Marina actualmente vive en el Departamento de La Paz en la provincia Aroma  Municipio de Patacamaya desde muy joven se dedicó a la agricultura ayudando a sus padres tiene un nivel de instrucción primario por motivos económicos no alcanzo a terminar el colegio ya que no contaba con el apoyo económico de sus padres actualmente es de estado civil Soltera no tiene dependientes vive en compañía de su madre la misma que es una señora de la tercera edad a la cual cuida y le ayuda a su manutención, el año 2006  realizo el curso de corte confección de ropa deportiva y pollería (ropa de las señoras del altiplano paceño) que se llevó a cabo en la Comunidad de Chiarumani, como también realizo un curso de Pollereria en el Centro de Promoción de la mujer Gregoria Apaza con una duración de 3 meses desde entonces no alcanzo a comprar máquinas de coser para abrir un taller de confección de polleras  por lo que solicita el préstamo para la compra de máquinas de coser Recta y Over para la elaboración de polleras y enaguas para cholitas el crédito le será de gran ayuda para la señora ya que será un capital semilla para agrandar su propio negocio, incrementar sus ingresos y de esa manera mejorar su calidad de vida. La señora aparenta ser una persona honesta trabajadora muy emprendedora.
texts.en:
Marina lives in the department of La Paz in the province of Aroma in the municipality of Patacamaya. From a very early age she worked in agriculture helping her parents. She has a primary education but was unable to finish school for economic reasons since her parents could not afford it. She is single and has no dependents and lives with her elderly mother who she cares for.

In 2006 she took a sewing class in the Chiarumani Community and learned how to make sport clothing and local women's clothing. She also took a sewing course at the women's promotional center, Gregoria Apaza, which lasted three months Afterwards, though, she was unable to buy sewing machines to open a sewing shop. Therefore she is requesting a loan to buy a straight sewing machine and an overlock machine to make women's skirts and underskirts.

The loan will be of great help since it will be the seed capital for expanding her business and increasing her income. This will improve her quality of life.

She is someone who appears to be honest, hardworking and very enterprising.

loans.use: to buy a straight sewing machine and an overlock machine to make women's clothing to generate more income for her mother.

loans.name: Vera Lucia

texts.es:
Vera es una mujer de 29 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 1 hijo de 3 años y su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano.
Ella es emprendedora, dinámica y muy responsable. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona sur de la ciudad, caracterizada por recibir la migración campo-ciudad, por diferentes razones, familias desplazadas por desastres naturales y personas buscando nuevas oportunidades, de clima cálido tropical muy húmedo.
Vera es de tez trigueña, cabello castaño largo y físico mediano, su lengua materna es el guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica a la construcción y con su hijo que aún no se encuentra en edad escolar, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de ropa y zapatos de segunda mano, siempre se asegura de que la ropa esté en buen estado, las marcas más comerciales son, Zara, lee, Blanco, Tommy, Levis, Lefties, La coste y otros, la procedencia es mayormente de Holanda, Bélgica, Luxemburgo, Alemania y España, “tengo todas las prendas de verano como invierno, trabajo todos los días en esta fechas de fin de año…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son diarias, la desventaja es la falta de mercadería variada. Su sueño es tener una tienda propia donde vive, él desea comprar ropa de segunda mano por mayor. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 7 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Vera solicita un préstamo para comprar ropa y zapatos de segunda mano para mejorar las ventas de fin de año.
texts.en:
Vera is a 29 year old woman, she lives with her partner, has 1 three year old son and her business is the sale of second-hand clothing. She is entrepreneurial, dynamic and very responsible. She operates her business in the south part of the city, characterized for receiving the migration from rural areas to the city and of families displaced by natural disasters and people looking for new opportunities. It has a warm tropical, very wet climate. 

Vera is brown skinned, has long brown hair and a medium build. Her native tongue is guarani, which she speaks with her family, and she speaks Spanish because of general culture and the business she is in. She shares her life with her partner who is in construction and her son who is not yet old enough to attend school. They live in a rented room, built out of brick, with potable water, electric energy and sewage. 

Her business is the sale of second-hand clothing and shoes, while always making sure that the clothing is in good shape. The commercial brands include, Zara, lee, Blanco, Tommy, Levis, Lefties, Lacoste and others. The clothing comes mainly from the Netherlands, Belgium, Luxembourg, Germany and Spain. "I have all the summer and winter clothing, I work every day during this end-of-year time" she comments. Her business' advantage is that the sales are on a daily basis, but the disadvantage is that she is lacking a variety in her merchandise.

Her dream is to have her own store where she lives and buy second-hand clothing at wholesale. This is the 1 sequence of loans with the institution in 7 years during which she has been in this business. These are the reasons Vera is requesting a loan to purchase second-hand clothing and shoes to improve the end-of-year sales.

loans.use: purchase second-hand clothing and shoes to improve the end-of-year sales.

loans.name: La Charmante Group

texts.fr: Justine est un senior entrepreneur qui commerce des habits dans un magasin de la ville, présidente du groupe de crédits «La Charmante», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée 53 ans, mère de 9 enfants dont 5 étudient et 4 sont déjà grands. Elle va s’approvisionner en robes, jupes, tricots, etc. Il y a 20 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité, avec le premier capital reçu de son mari. Elle souhaite acheter une parcelle et scolariser ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Justine is a senior entrepreneur who retails clothes in one of the city's shops. She is president of the "La Charmante" loan association, and member of the Hekima MFI.

She is a 53-year-old married mother of nine children, of whom five attend school and four are already grown.

She will stock up with dresses, skirts, knitwear, etc. She has been in business for the past 20 years with initial funding received from her husband.
