She wants to buy a parcel of land and see to her children's education. Finally, she thanks Hekima for its support to non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: stock up with dresses, skirts, knitwear, etc.

loans.name: Garba

texts.en:
Garba is a maize farmer from Sarki village. As a Babban Gona member, Garba is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Garba would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Garba can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Garba no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Garba hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en:
Haruna is a maize farmer from Gidan village. As a Babban Gona member, Haruna is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Haruna would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Haruna can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Haruna no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Haruna hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Tijjani

texts.en:
Tijjani is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Tijjani is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday. Traditionally, Tijjani would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a member of Babban Gona, Tijjani can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Tijjani has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land.

Tijjani is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having had no money to pay for his children's school fees and looks forward to using his additional earnings to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Alhaji Umaru

texts.en:
Alhaji Umaru is maize farmer from Gardago village. As a member of Babban Gona, Alhaji Umaru is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Alhaji Umaru would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Alhaji Umaru can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Alhaji Umaru is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Laguna Las Garzas Group

texts.en:
The municipality of San Antonio Ilotenango is located in the northwestern part of Guatemala and has deep roots in its pre-Columbian origins. The residents of this place care about conserving the most important elements of their indigenous identity and culture, traditions such as communal living and elaborate dress, especially for women, as well as their language, Maya K’iché, which is used on a daily basis.

In this context, 7 women, known for their determination to reach their dreams, join together to form the Laguna Las Garzas trust bank. Micaela is a 47- year-old group member and the mother of 7 children. Her business is in animal husbandry, and she is currently soliciting a loan to buy 6 more pigs and food to fatten them up. With her profits, Micaela intends to improve her quality of life, giving better food, healthcare and educational opportunities to her children.

The women of Lagunas Las Garzas trust bank are dedicated to various businesses, some of which include the sales of animals, buying and selling of vegetables, and sales of orange juice within and outside of their community. With a median age of 35 years, 99% of the women in this group did not receive the opportunity to go to school and are mothers to an average of 4 children.

Currently, the women are starting their second loan cycle with Kiva, and they say, “Thank you, Kiva investors, for the opportunity you give us through investing in community trust-banks. With the profits we gain as a result of your investments, we are able to support our families”.

loans.use: to buy 6 more pigs and food to fatten them up.

loans.name: Dayana Jhanina

texts.es: LA SEÑORA DAYANA JHANINA, es una persona de 25 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, alcanzo a estudiar una carrera universitaria, es licenciada en contaduría pública, no cuenta con dependientes económicos a cargo y actualmente vive en el domicilio de su padre la cual se halla situado en la ciudad de Cochabamba. La señora Dayana cuenta con dos actividades económicas la principal por el cual tiene mayor ingreso es por prestar servicios de transporte de pasajeros (taxi) dentro del radio urbano de la ciudad de Cochabamba, para ello cuenta con su propio vehículo el cual trabaja con un chofer quien diariamente le entrega un renta de $us 14.57. Asimismo la segunda actividad económica que la cliente desarrolla es ejerciendo su carrera universitaria en la Universidad del Valle como auxiliar de archivos. Finalmente la señora  Dayana manifiesta ser una persona trabajadora y responsable que tiene el deseo de realizar la chapería y mantenimiento general de su vehículo que es su principal  herramienta de trabajo de tal manera se vea presentable para sus clientes pasajeros lo que le permitirá generar mejores ingresos que van a mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Dayana Jhanina, 25, is single and has a university degree and license as a public accountant. She has no dependents and lives with her father in the city of Cochabamba.

She has two main activities which generate most of her income, one of which is her passenger transport (taxi) service in the urban area of the city of Cochabamba. She has her own vehicle which she rents to a drive who pays her $14.57 a day. She also works in her profession at the Universidad del Valle as an archive assistant.

Lastly, Dayana claims she is a hard-working, responsible person who wants to have body work and general maintenance done on the vehicle which is her main work tool. This will make it more presentable for customers and allow her to earn more income which will improve her quality of life

loans.use: to repair the vehicle that allows her to work (her taxi).

loans.name: Cristeta

texts.en:
For ten years now, Cristeta has been an active member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT). She has availed several loans in the past that have helped nurture her variety store business. Because she finds the cooperative very helpful, she maintains her good standing record by attending its weekly fellowship and by faithfully repaying her loans. CCT's partnership with Kiva and the untiring support of Kiva lenders encourage her all the more, since the partnership gives better opportunities for small entrepreneurs like herself to avail of higher loans.

Cristeta's previous loan amounting to 25,000 PHP went a long way. It enabled her to buy enough groceries, toiletries and beverages to fill her inventory. It resulted to a higher income that supported her family's daily needs. Recently she started a bakery and is now paying three helper-bakers.

She plans to further improve her business not only for her family but also for the families of her helper-bakers. This is why she appeals for loan of 35,000 PHP this time. She will use it primarily to buy additional supplies for her variety store plus raw ingredients for her bakery. She doesn't stop thinking about possible ways to enhance her businesses.

Cristeta is determined to maintain her good record, and she continues to meet with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week. It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from religion.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital and repay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies for her variety store plus raw ingredients for her bakery.

loans.name: Fhebe

texts.en:
Generally, people are conscious about their looks. Wherever they are, they want to look beautiful and handsome, or at least appear neat and presentable. Others also try hard to catch up with the latest hairstyle and fashion. Fhebe, 38 years old, also loves fashion and hair trends. She makes it her hobby and source of income. She pays three stylists in her salon located in Malibay, Pasay City. Her business not only contributes to their daily provision of food and utilities, but it also satisfies their hobby. They consider it an art, and indeed it is.

As Fhebe continues to improve her business, she plans to buy a stock of hairdressing supplies and equipment with a PHP 20,000 loan. Anticipated income from this will support her family’s usual needs, her employees/stylists, and will add to her savings. In due time, she will put up several branches, if her savings suffice.

Fhebe’s business partner is her husband, Jimmy. Their two children inspire them to work hard, as it is their dream to see their children with a college diploma and stable career someday.

Fhebe regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members at CCT Credit Cooperative every week. She finds encouragement from their inspiring stories and Bible reflections. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy a stock of hairdressing supplies and equipment.

loans.name: Women Of Excellence Group

texts.en:
Excellence is a term used to describe superb, outstanding performance or deeds and high standards. It is then expected that if the name “Women Of Excellence" is given to a group, the group members would perform exceptionally well and beyond expectations.

One member of the group Women Of Excellence is Getrude. She has always been a businesswoman at heart and one who had a knack for rearing poultry. Even when she was formally employed, she would be seen delivering dressed chickens to her workmates and churchmates.

Getrude is age 53 and a widowed mother to four children, some of whom are still school-going.

Women Of Excellence group recently applied for its second loan from Thrive Microfinance. The group still consists of four members, but only three have applied for this second loan. The other member, who is currently a “silent partner,” regularly meets with the group. The group resides in Cranborne, a medium density area in Harare.

Getrude used her first loan well and grew her batch from 150 chickens at a time to 200 chickens. She also extended her fowl run to sensitive broiler chickens, which need good aeration. She is also a caterer and caters occasionally for functions like cocktail parties, bridal showers and parties.

Getrude highlighted that she enjoyed the Thrive training and believes that is the reason why her star is shining brighter as a businesswoman. The lesson on savings is one that she took to heart. She started saving money and these savings were a lifesaver as she used them to buy a ticket for her daughter to come back home after studying in Ukraine on a scholarship. She now keeps proper track of her business through the record-keeping lessons she attended.

She believes that working in a group has benefited her immensely through being inspired by her group members and receiving social and emotional support from them.

Getrude is planning on using her second loan to get more chickens and feed that can take the chickens up to the requisite six weeks at a healthy and good weight. She has established a good customer base in her neighbourhood and church. She is anticipating good returns during the festive season as it is a time that people will be spending lavishly.

loans.use: to get more chickens and feed in preparation for the festive season.

loans.name: Zujeily Del Carmen

texts.es: Zujeily de 28 años es una mujer con un gran carisma y disposición, ella está comprometida y reside con su pareja en Galapa un municipio del Atlántico, allí funciona su negocio de comidas rápidas que heredó de su madre quien se disponía a cerrarlo, Zujeily le pidió que se lo cediera puesto que consideraba que existía mucho potencial en el sector y que cerrarlo sería un error, así que consiguió unos recursos para relanzarlo y organizarlo mejor.  En la esquina de la vivienda de su madre se encuentra ubicado, un lugar estratégico, donde fluctúa mucho personal, allí atiende los días lunes, miércoles, viernes hasta el domingo y en el caso de haber festivos, sus clientes degustan de perros calientes, hamburguesas, salchipapas, pinchos, gaseosas, cervezas y bebidas refrescantes.  La  acogida por parte de sus clientes ha permitido que su negocio sea todo un éxito, en la actualidad realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar un enfriador y conservar bebidas, cervezas y carnes frias.  Zujeily se proyecta a futuro ofreciendo sus comidas en un local comercial y su meta es tener vivienda.
texts.en:
Zujeily, 28, is a woman of great charisma with a kid disposition. She and her fiance live in Galapa, a municipality of the area kown as Atlantico. There she runs a fast food business which she inherited from her mother who was going to close it. Zujeily asked her not to because she believed there was great potential for it and that closing it would be wrong. So she obtained enough resources to relaunch and reorganize the business.

The corner where her mother's house is located is a strategic area where there are many passersby. She attends to customers there on Monday, Wednesday, Friday and even Sunday around holiday time. Her customers enjoy the hot dogs, hamburguers, dogs and fries, appetizers, sodas, beers and soft drinks she sells. The popularity of her business has made is a success. She is currently requesting a CrediKiva loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation to buy a cooler to keep the drinks, beers and cold meats.

Zujeily sees herself in the future running a food shop. Her goal is to own a house.

loans.use: to buy a cooler to keep beverages, beers and cold meats.

loans.name: Mungoode Allah Saabon-Zongo Group

texts.en:
Humu is a 37-year-old married woman and a mother of 4 kids, all of whom attend school. She lives in Saabon- Zongo in the upper east region of Ghana.

Humu is a member of a women's group called ‘Mungoode Allah, Saabon-Zongo’, which means ‘We thank God’ group of Saabon-Zongo. Humu is the individual pictured standing first from the left holding a hand bag. She has been in the business of food selling for the past five years.

Humu and her group are challenged with capital inadequacy and have therefore requested a loan of GHC 20,500. Humu needs GHC 600. out of the whole amount to buy food stuff for her food selling business. She wants to get a good income to pay back this loan and support her kids with their basic needs.

Humu dreams to grow her business into a restaurant and also employ several people to work with her. The livelihood of Humu’s family depends on her business. She wants to give the family a dignified life by working hard with the support of Grameen Ghana and Kiva partnership. She is really grateful and thanks Kiva lenders for the support.

loans.use: To buy food stuff for her food selling business.

loans.name: Leivis Yaneth

texts.es: El amor por los animales fue el motor que impulsó a Levis a estudiar en una universidad pública la carrera de sus sueños, “Veterinaria”.  Al culminar sus estudios empezó a ejercer y hace cuatro años es la doctora de centenares de mascotas de un barrio localizado en Soledad, allí ofrece servicios médicos veterinarios, vacunación, control de pulgas, peluquería canina y hospitalización. Ella no tiene horario laborar pues está al servicio de emergencias veterinarias, sin embargo trabaja en promedio 8 horas diarias y su stock de medicamentos debe estar siempre bien surtido para atender oportunamente aquellos casos en los que se requiera de emergencia, es por ello que realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar insumos médicos y medicamentos: jeringas, gasas, sondas, esparadrapo, hilo quirúrgico, antibióticos de amplio espectro y demás. Leivis es madre soltera de una niña de 4 años de edad y su meta es fortalecer su negocio para ofrecer una excelente calidad de vida a su única hija.
texts.en:
The love for animals was what drove Leivis to pursue, in a public university, her dream career, "veterinary." Upon finishing her studies, she started her practice and has been the doctor to hundreds of pets in a neighborhood located in Soledad. Here she lends her services as a veterinarian, provides shots, flea control, canine haircuts and hospitalization. 
She does not have a working schedule as she is at the service of veterinary emergencies, however, she works on average 8 hours a day and her medicine stock must always remain well stocked to attend promptly to those cases which may require them in an emergency. This is why she is making a loan request, a credikiva, as an opportunity to join the financial life through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation to purchase medical supplies and medicines: syringes, gauze, tubes, medical tape, surgical thread, broad-spectrum antibiotics and more.
Leivis is a single mother with a 4 year old daughter, her goal is to strengthen her business in order to offer and excellent quality of life for her only daughter.

loans.use: purchase medical supplies and medicines: syringes, gauze, tubes, medical tape, surgical thread, broad-spectrum antibiotics and more

loans.name: Hector Melidio

texts.en:
Melidio is 66 years old. He’s an afro who has been dedicated to farming since he was a child. He didn’t finish school and one of his life’s dreams is to see his children studying and reaching better opportunities than he did. He’s married and father of three children. His oldest child is an adult and works with him in the field.

They live in a small town in northern Ecuador. In his house live seven people, including the son of his oldest child and his son’s wife. His other children are the school. In their free time, his younger children help him to work in the field, and on the weekends, go out to sell to the city market with their mother.

On his small ground, Melidio plants sugar cane. He will use the loan to purchase fertilizer, pay labor and fix his water pump.

This summer was stronger than previous years and some of his crops were damaged. Melidio trusts in his own work. He would like his youngest children go to university and get a degree related to agronomy. He hopes he can count on Kiva support.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, pay labor and fix his water pump.

loans.name: Songnaaba Group

texts.fr: Edwige, est une femme agée de 36 ans. elle exerce son activité depuis 6 ans. ce qui fait marcher son activité c'est qu'elle vend moins chère sa marchandise et de la bonne qualité, elle respect ses client et aussi les accueillent bien.Elle veut le prêt pour acheter 10 complets de pagnes à 75 000 F cfa. L'utilité du prêt c'est de s'approvisionner en quantité suffisante afin de renforcer son activité.Elle à déjà reçu le prêt une fois et à rembourser à la date prévue à ACFIME
texts.en:
Edwige is a 36-year-old woman, who has been running her business for the past six years. It is prospering because she sells quality merchandise at lower prices, shows respect to her customers and greets them well.

She wants the loan to purchase 10 sets of pagnes (colorful West-African fabric) for 75,000 CFA francs. The purpose of the loan is to acquire sufficient quantities to bolster her business activity.

Elle has already received the loan once and repaid it on time to ACFIME.

loans.use: buy 10 sets of pagnes (colorful West-African fabric) for 75,000 CFA francs.

loans.name: Ramadan

texts.en:
Ramadan is 23, single and has a small animal-fattening project. In his project, he fattens and sells calves and makes and sells cheese, butter and milk in the market.

He takes care of and is financially responsible for his aging father who has leg problems, his mother, and his two siblings.

Ramadan is requesting a 10,000 EGP loan to buy a cow to expand his project and generate more income.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Rosibel

texts.es: Rosibel, tiene 31 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo, tiene dos hijos y reside en una aldea del Municipio de Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara.  Ella siempre se ha dedicado al comercio, lleva 6 años de dedicarse a vender ropa para damas, caballeros y niños. Ofrece sus productos de manera ambulante en la comunidad, vende vestidos para niñas, ropa para niños, camisetas, blusas  y otros. Además ha iniciado a vender calzado para generar otros ingresos. El préstamo es por 15,000 lempiras para comprar fardos de ropa variada de segunda para surtir y vender en esta temporada navideña y aprovechar de esa manera aumentar las ventas. En un futuro piensa poner su negocio en un local propio y poder darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Rosibel, aged 31, lives with her spouse and two children in a village in the municipality of Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara.

She has always worked in commerce, for six years she has sold clothing for men, ladies and children. She sells her products as a street vendor in the community. She sells dresses for little girls, as well as other children's clothing, shirts and blouses etc. Aditionally, she has started to sell footwear as another source of income.

This loan is for 15,000 lempiras to buy bundles of assorted women's secondhand clothing to sell during the Christmas period, to make the most of this opportunity to increase sales. In the future, she would like to be able to set up her business in her own premises, and to be able to give the best to her family.

loans.use: to buy bundles of assorted women's secondhand clothing to sell during the Christmas period.

loans.name: Samia

texts.en:
Samia is 30, a widow, and has one son.

She wants to start a sewing project to afford her son's education and monthly expenses.

She is requesting 10,000 EGP loan to buy a sewing machine and colorful cloth to make modern clothing.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and colorful cloth.

loans.name: Fawzy

texts.en:
Fawzy is 53, married, and has two children.

He has a grinding machine service project in which his wife helps him.

He is requesting a 10,000 EGP loan to buy another grinding machine as well as corn and wheat for grinding to generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy another grinding machine as well as corn and wheat to grind.

loans.name: More Blessings Group

texts.en:
More Blessings, as the group is called, is composed of two strong hardworking women. These women are very dedicated in their field of business, dealing in the the sale of use clothes and saucepans in a very industrious area of Teshie.

Eunice is the group representative, and she sells second-hand clothes. Her main disadvantage is the lack of capital to expand her business. She therefore seeks a loan from Kiva through ID-Ghana to buy more used clothes to supply in abundance to meet customers' needs.

loans.use: to buy more used clothes to supply in abundance to meet customers' needs.

loans.name: God Is One Group

texts.en:
Gladys is the 43-year-old woman in the middle of the group picture. She comes from Twifo Praso in the Twifo Atti-Morkwa district of the central region of Ghana.

Gladys is married with two children. Gladys’ husband is a businessman who has been very supportive in taking care of the family. She sells mother care products like baby walkers, children's dresses, antiseptics, feeding bottles, diapers etc.

She is the group representative of the God is One group. She has owned and operated her business for the past eight years. As a serious businesswoman, she became delighted to add Elsa Stove distribution to her business after she witnessed the community education on the repercussions of climate change and the introduction of Elsa Stove to her community by field officers. Gladys has done the necessary market surveys with a very positive result.

Gladys and her group members want to be part of a wealthy course of using the most reliable and efficient way of cooking due to availability of the Elsa stoves fuel, waste materials within their community. There has been an increase in demand for the Elsa stoves within the community and the nearby villages. The stove uses palm kernel shells as fuel. The Elsa stove improves indoor air quality and the health of the users, and it is cost saving.

Gladys and her group members need a micro loan to buy more stoves to meet the demands of their customers. Funding their loan will also reduce deforestation and help green the environment. Gladys and her group members thank all their Kiva micro lenders for their generosity and help to improve the environment within the communities they operate.

loans.use: to buy Elsa stoves to sell.

loans.name: Elvia Petra

texts.en:
Elvia is a 60-year-old woman; she is single and she is the mother of three sons who have grown onto adults and have families of their own. None of them depend on her.

Elvia's biggest accomplishment is rising three kids as a single mother; she is really proud of herself and now she has been rewarded with grandchildren.

In order to make a living, Elvia has been selling clothes; she has been in this line of business for a very long time, but two years ago she made a change. She decided to stop buying t-shirts to sell them. Instead, she bought a sewing and a printing machine to craft clothes of her own.

Kubo Financial looks up to her because she become more independent and employs two people who help her. She is applying for a 10,527 MXN loan which will allowed her to cover the client demand for the upcoming Christmas season by buying fabric, thread and printing material.

Elvia runs her business along with her sister, and they have both doing well with it. They think that with this loan, can get a huge profit from the upcoming season.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.en:
Victor is a 40-year-old farmer. He’s married and has two children. The the older is 15 and the younger is 8 years old. He lives in a humble house in Pusir. Pusir is a small town northern Ecuador. This area is characterized as predominantly agricultural and has very rich lands.

Agriculture is his main source of income, but Victor and his wife also sell clothes and footwear. They sell those things in the city’s market on weekends, so they have to wake up around 4 a.m. to take the bus and start to sell at 8 a.m. In the afternoon they stop selling at 5 p.m. and go back home. They arrive at home around 7 p.m. This activity and farming work have enabled them to support their family.

This loan will allow Victor to buy fertilizers and rent a water pump to irrigate sugar cane. This year has been hard for Victor as his crops have had to endure a strong summer. Damage to irrigation canals has not allowed their crops to be irrigated. Therefore, he needs to invest in more fertilizers to prevent crop damage by pests.

Victor would like to thank the Kiva lenders for helping him improve his life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and rent a water pump to irrigate sugar cane.

loans.name: Mujeres De Canamixtoj Group

texts.en:
In San Antonio Llotenango, Central Guatemala, a rural area that is about 15 minutes outside of of Quiché by bus, is where the 8 women of Mujeres de Canamixtoj trust bank, or Women of Canamixtoj trust bank live. Between 24 and 60 years of age, most of these ladies were not able to study more than a few years in primary school.

To make a living and provide a better life for themselves and their families, the Mujeres de Canamixtoj run various classes of businesses. The majority grows vegetable crops such as corn, tomatoes, potatoes and onions, and sell their products; some raise animals such as chickens, cows and pigs; or run convenience stores.

Juana is a 40-year-old woman who studied up to 4th grade and has 6 children between the ages of 9 and 22 who are happily studying, thanks to the hard work of Juana and her husband, who has been far away from his family, working. Managing a convenience store, snack stand, clothing business - weaving and selling traditional cortes, or skirts, and aprons - and her small farm, where she raises chickens and pigs, as well as about 10 acres of corn Juana has her hands full. With her loan, she will invest in restocking her store by buying sugar, juices, pasta, soda and other products that her clients are demanding.

Throughout her time working with Friendship Bridge, this intelligent woman has seen substantial growth in her profits with the opening of her store and the success it has had. Juana only hopes for more of this: moving forward in the accomplishment of her efforts, step by step, with confidence.

loans.use: to invest in restocking her store by buying sugar, juices, pasta, soda and other products that her clients are demanding.

loans.name: Las Rosas De Chibuc Group

texts.en:
The Department or State of Quiche (pronounced “key-che") is one of the most populous in Guatemala. The population is of Mayan descent and they are involved in various business ventures including farming (of corn and beans), traditional textile production, as well as the manufacture and sale of straw hats. The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank Las Rosas de Chibuc was formed here by nine entrepreneurial women who seek to raise the living standard of their lives, eliminate poverty, empower themselves and educate their children. These women have various businesses including animal husbandry; the sale of bakery items including bread; and the sale of vegetables, peanuts and caramel corn.

The Secretary of the Trust Bank is 27-year-old Juana who is married with three children. Two of the children are in school since Juana is very aware of the value of education in their lives. Juana sells peanuts and other seeds both at the retail and wholesale level. Because of increased demand, Juana is requesting a loan that she will use to buy a large quantity of peanuts at the wholesale level and then resell. She wants to have plenty of inventory available since she wants to attract more customers, increase sales and generate more income.

Juana and the ladies in the Trust Bank feel blessed and fortunate to participate in the “Microcredit Plus” Program of Friendship Bridge that combines small loans and education. Many of the women have had little or no formal education and so the educational component of their monthly meetings is especially important and beneficial.

Thank you, Kiva investors, for learning about Juana and her friends in the Trust Bank. With your help in funding their much needed loans, the women are poised to step into a more prosperous time in their lives, benefiting themselves and their families.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of peanuts at the wholesale level and then resell.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 26, single and has a small poultry project. In his project he raises ducks and chickens for a month and then sells them. He has a motorcycle that he uses for selling the birds in his village and in other neighboring villages.

He is asking for a 5,000 EGP loan to buy ducks and chickens to expand his project and generate more income.

loans.use: to buy ducks and chickens to expand his project and generate more income.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 61 years old, married, and has seven children, one of whom is still in school.

Elizabeth is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She has been raising livestock for ten years now and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Elizabeth requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Elizabeth would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Corralense Group

texts.en:
About two hours away from Quetzaltenango, the second largest city in Guatemala, there is a small village where nine visionary women have formed the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank Corralense. One must travel on a dirt road, surrounded by pine trees as the elevation is high, to get there. The ladies are involved in various commercial endeavors including animal husbandry, candle-making, and weaving of the traditional wrap-around skirts called 'cortes'.

Angelica, a 36-year-old member of the group, has a traditional textile business. She weaves 'cortes' that the indigenous women wear as part of their 'traje', or customary outfit, consisting of a 'huipil', or ornately embroidered blouse; 'corte' and 'faja', or intricately woven belt. Angelica sells her cortes in a nearby town. She also raises and sells pigs. Angelica is determined to be successful in her business and is requesting a loan to purchase lots of different colors and textures of thread as well as two additional pigs.

The women of the Trust Bank meet monthly with a Facilitator from Friendship Bridge. They spend the first portion of their meeting making payments on their loans. The second half is devoted to educational training with one relevant topic presented for the ladies to participate in each month. Since the ladies have prioritized health care as being quite important and an essential step toward stability, the Facilitator emphasizes how important knowledge about nutrition, hygiene and the use of medicinal plants is for the women and their families.

Thank you, Kiva investors, for learning about Angelica and her friends in the Corralense Trust Bank. The group is appreciative of the opportunity to secure a loan and that the interest rate is low for them. They have started their journey out of poverty and are on the path to a more prosperous future; benefitting themselves, their families and their community outside of Quetzaltenango.

loans.use: to purchase lots of different colors and textures of thread.

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
Benita previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. As a widow, her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another loan of the same amount, 20,000 PHP, to buy more toiletries and personal care products, plus food containers and other household needs. It's better if she has more items on display and available on hand. It will lead to more sales that will ease up their daily expenses.

With a grateful heart, she looks forward to this financial support from you, kind lenders. She hopes you would consider her again as she has shown her good record several times before.

She faithfully meets up every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and religion.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study religion, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more toiletries and personal care products, plus food containers and other household needs.

loans.name: Angela Liz

texts.es:
Angela es una mujer de 26 años de edad, soltera, tiene 2 hijos de 2 y 4 años, y su negocio es la venta de ropa deportiva.
Ella es paciente, conversadora y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona Sur de la ciudad, caracterizada porque más de la mitad de la población de la ciudad vive en este lugar y por recibir la migración preveniente del campo.
Angela es de tez morena, cabello castaño y ojos marrones, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con sus hijos que aún no se encuentran en edad escolar viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de ropa deportiva, ella se ocupa de comprar ropa deportiva por mayor para venderla por menor de forma ambulante en diferentes áreas peatonales y zonas comerciales, “vendo buzos deportivos, chaquetas y poleras que son bastante cómodos para el uso diario…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que conoce y visita varias ferias y zonas comerciales realizando buenas ventas, la desventaja es la falta de mercadería variada para ofertar. Su sueño es abrir una tienda de ropa, ella desea comprar ropa deportiva por mayor. Esta es la 1 secuenciad e préstamos con la institución en 3 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Angela solicita un préstamo para comprar ropa deportiva para vender ambulantemente.
texts.en:
Angela is a 26 year old woman, she is single and is the mother of two children (ages 2 and 4). Her business is the sale of sportswear. She is patient, conservative and very hard working.
She operates her business in the south of the city, an area characterized for having more than half of the city's population living here and for receiving the migration coming from rural areas.
Angela is dark skinned, has brown hair and brown eyes, her native tongue is Guarani, which she speaks with her family, and she speaks Spanish for general culture and the business she runs. She shares her life with her children who are not yet old enough to attend school. They live in a rented room, built of bricks, which has potable water, electric energy and a sewage system.
Her business is the sale of sportswear. She purchases sportswear at wholesale prices and sells it retail as a traveling merchant in different pedestrian areas or commercial zones. "I sell sport sweaters, jackets and shirts which are very comfortable for daily use..." she comments. Her business' advantage is that she knows and visits various fairs and commercial areas making good sales, the disadvantage is that she lacks varied merchandise to offer. Her dream is to open a clothing store and wishes to purchase clothing at wholesale prices. This is the first sequence of loans with the institution in the 3 years she has been in this business. These are the reasons Angela is requesting a loan to purchase sportswear to sell as a traveling merchant.

loans.use: purchase sportswear to sell as a traveling merchant.

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita is 44 years old and has six children. Lucita is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Lucita is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She has been raising livestock for four years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Lucita requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

In the future, Lucita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Digna

texts.en:
Digna, 60, is a married woman with 11 children, two of whom are still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Digna has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 24,500 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

Digna would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Asunta

texts.en:
Asunta is an artisan from Peru who specializes in reverse-painted glass mirrors and trays. She would like to invest in a bulk purchase of glass, wood, and lacquer.

Asunta has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is her story:

"At first my husband's family taught the craft, then we united our skills and labor. I realized that the more I practiced, the more the craft won me over, offering me tremendous gratification. Now I consider it a way of life.

"This whole process demands incredible patience and attention to detail. My designs are inspired by nature, and by traditional scenes from my town and region. I feel very proud of the works that I create.

"I am one of the original artisans from NOVICA's Andes region, and when I think about how far I've come, I can't help but smile. This growth has impacted not just me, but also my family. My children have been able to attend college thanks to my craft.

"This Cajamarca style of art that I create is not made by as many artisans as in the past, and the designs have started to shift away from traditional patterns in recent years. I always try to stay true to the traditional style, and am glad that I have been able to connect with distant people who appreciate me and my work."

Use the link below to view Asunta's reverse-painted glass mirrors and trays on the NOVICA site:

http://www.novica.com/kiva/1028

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of glass, wood, and lacquer.

loans.name: Akaki

texts.en: Akaki is 38 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and daughter in Ozurgeti district. His wife is a sales lady and gets a small monthly income which is the only source of income for the family. Akaki decided to start a business and has requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 1,600 USD. With the received credit he will purchase a car and will serve locals as a taxi driver. This will give him a stable income and will enable him to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a car and start taxi business.

loans.name: Nkome Nfa 1 Group

texts.en:
Robert, who is in his late thirties, is married with three children who are still in school. He has been a trader for ten years now. He works from 7.30 am to mid-night daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be his 7th loan cycle from ID-Ghana. He used the previous loans to increase the quantity of drinks and has managed to repay his loans successfully. He is happy with the loan. He used the profit to pay school fees, to pay shop rent, to repay his loan and to cover household expenses. He will use this loan to buy more soft drinks on a gradual wholesale basis.

He is the group leader of Nkome Nfa 1 with his counterpart Hannah.

loans.use: to buy buy more soft drinks on a gradual wholesale basis.

loans.name: Zakariya

texts.en:
Zakariya is a maize farmer from Dan'asabe village. As a Babban Gona member, Zakariya is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Zakariya would have had to sell his maize at harvest time, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Zakariya can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Zakariya no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to 2,000 USD per hectare of land, Zakariya hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: ELLA ES UN SEÑORA CASADA  DE 45 AÑOS DE EDAD, SE ENCUENTRA PREOCUPADA POR SU ESPOSO DEBIDO A QUE ESTE SUFRE DE CATARATAS EN SU OJO IZQUIERDO POR LO QUE SU VISTA SE HA VISTO DISMINUIDA. EL TRABAJA COMO VELADOR DE UNA FABRICA POR LO QUE ESTE PADECIMIENTO LE AFECTA MUCHO EN SUS LABORES Y NO QUISIERA PERDER SU EMPLEO POR ESTA CAUSA. LAMENTABLEMENTE SUS RECURSOS NO SON SUFICIENTES PARA EL TRATAMIENTO QUIRÚRGICO QUE REQUIERE.
texts.en:
She is 45 years old and married. She is worried about her husband because he has cataracts in his left eye. His vision has diminished because of this. He works as a watchman at a factory. Therefore, this problem greatly affects his work. He does not want to lose his job because of it.

Unfortunately, they do not have enough resources to pay for the surgical treatment that he needs.

loans.use: to pay for ophthalmic treatment.

loans.name: Ermite

texts.fr: Ermite, 30 ans, vit en union libre. Elle est mère de quatre enfants qui sont régulièrement scolarisés. Pour  soutenir son mari à s’occuper du foyer financièrement, elle a décidé de monter une activité commerciale. Elle revend des pains en détails. Elle cherche un prêt pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en:
30-year-old Ermite lives in a common-law relationship. She is a mother of four children who attend school.

To support her husband in taking care of household finances, she decided to start a business. She sells bread retail, and is requesting a loan to increase her stock supply.

loans.use: increase her supply of bread

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: ELLA ES UNA SEÑORA DE 40 AÑOS DE EDAD, DESDE PEQUEÑA SUS DIENTES NO ESTABAN ALINEADOS APROPIADAMENTE, SIN EMBARGO SUS PADRES POR FALTA DE RECURSOS NO LE DIERON ATENCIÓN. ACTUALMENTE TIENE MUCHA DIFICULTAD PARA MASTICAR SUS ALIMENTOS Y SU RESPIRACIÓN ES BUCAL DEBIDO A QUE NO PUEDE CERRAR LOS LABIOS, LO QUE LE PROVOCA INFECCIONES RESPIRATORIAS. ELLA LABORA COMO INTENDENTE EN UNA EMPRESA DE TELEFONÍA Y ES EL ÚNICO SUSTENTO DE SU FAMILIA, POR LO QUE NO PUEDE COSTEARSE UN TRATAMIENTO DE ORTODONCIA.
texts.en:
She is 40 years old. Ever since she was little her teeth have not been properly aligned. However, due to her parents' lack of resources, she never received treatment. Now she has a lot of difficulty chewing her food, and she breathes through her mouth because she is not able to close her lips. This causes respiratory infections.

She works as a supervisor at a telephone company, and she is the sole support of her family. Therefore, she is not able to pay for orthodontic treatment.

loans.use: to pay for dental treatment.

loans.name: Esther Vanessa

texts.en:
Esther is a woman in her early forties. she is not married and does not have economic dependants. She lives on her own and only needs to provide for herself and sometimes helps her parents with their expenses.

To make a living, Esther works at a local university. She is happy there because she is able to help young students. More specifically, she works at the college administration.

Esther wants to make some house improves by repainting some rooms, changing a few windows, fixing a door and placing a new floor. To do this she is applying for a 21,053 MXN loan at Kiva, through Kubo. Kubo has interviewed her, and people who know her. Kubo's conclusion is that Esther is a reliable person who can be trusted.

loans.use: to repaint her house and fix other details.

loans.name: Talande

texts.fr: Talande a 39 ans, elle vit en union libre et a deux enfants. Elle vend des produits alimentaires au détail. Ses revenus lui permettent de faire vivre sa famille. Elle demande un microcrédit pour augmenter son stock de produits.
texts.en:
Talande is 39 years old. She lives in a common-law relationship and has two children.

She retails food products, and her income enables her to support her family. She is requesting a micro-credit loan to increase her stock of products.

loans.use: buy cartons of spaghetti

loans.name: Lociana

texts.fr: Lociana, 35 ans, vit en union libre. Elle a cinq enfants. Elle revend des produits cosmétiques et des lessives. C’est grâce à cette activité qu’elle arrive à gagner de l’argent pour aider son compagnon à couvrir les dépenses du foyer. Elle demande ce prêt pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en:
35-year-old Lociana lives in a common-law relationship. She has five children, and sells cosmetics and detergents.

Thanks to this activity she can earn money to help her companion cover household expenses. She requested this loan to increase her stock supply.

loans.use: increase her stock supply of detergents

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 57 years old and married. She has four children. With one child still in school, Thelma works very hard to provide for them.

Thelma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Thelma has been in this business for 30 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, detergent soap, fabric conditioner, coffee, cereals, noodles, etc. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Florbel

texts.en:
Florbel is 36 years old. She is married and has two children who are in school.

Florbel is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Florbel requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs.

Florbel has been in pig fattening for six years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Florbel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Atsoupe  Agossi

texts.fr: Atsoupe est une femme mariée qui vit à Baguida et ayant six enfants à charge. Agée de 41 ans, Atsoupe est une marchande de produits de beauté et des mèches qui s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché et le revend en parcourant les quartiers environnant. Atsoupe sollicite ce crédit pour commander des unités de mèches outrées et des tissages en vue de bien revendre puis tirer un maximum de profit afin de pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants et améliorer leur condition de vie quotidienne.
texts.en: Atsoupe is a married woman living in Baguida with six children to support. She is 41 years old and a merchant of beauty products and hair extensions, which are supplied four times a month from the market. She resells the merchandise by circulating through nearby neighborhoods. Atsoupe is requesting this loan to order units of outrée hair extensions and some weaves with the aim of doing well in her sales, thus to make the maximum profit for meeting the needs of her children and improving their day-to-day living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase 33 units of outrée hair extensions and 10 unites of weaves

loans.name: Ami  Beatrice

texts.fr: Mariée, Ami est une femme âgée de 27 ans résidant à Baguida. Ami vit avec ses deux enfants et son mari. Ami est une revendeuse  de chaussures et des détergents qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile et en circulant les quartiers environnant. Ami demande ce crédit pour réaliser son achat des paires de chaussures et des détergents en vue de mieux revendre et de gagner des bénéfices afin de pouvoir aider son mari à bien prendre en charge leurs enfants dans leur éducation scolaire puis à certaines dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
Ami, age 27, is married and lives in Baguida with her two children and her husband. She resells shoes and detergent. She gets her supplies at the market twice monthly, and resells at her home and by walking around nearby neighborhoods. 

Ami is seeking this loan to purchase pairs of shoes and detergent to resell, in order to make a profit and help her husband take care of their children's education and cover some daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy 60 pairs of women's shoes and 3 bags of detergent

loans.name: Kayi

texts.fr: Kayi est une femme mariée qui vit avec ses trois enfants à charge à Baguida. Agée de 36 ans, Kayi est une revendeuse des habits de friperies qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend en parcourant les quartiers environnant. Pour avoir un stock important et maximiser son profit afin de répondre à nombreuse attentes de ses clients, Kayi demande ce crédit pour commander des unités de jupes et le tas d’habits corsages en vue de gagner des bénéfices et venir en aide à  son mari aux diverses charges quotidiennes éprouvées par la famille.
texts.en:
Kayi, age 36, is married and lives in Baguida with her three children, whom she has to support. She resells secondhand clothing. She gets her supplies twice monthly at the market, and resells by walking around nearby neighborhoods.

In order to build up her stock and meet high customer demand, Kayi is seeking this loan to order skirts and one pile of blouses. She wants to maximize her profits and help her husband cover the various daily expenses of the family.

loans.use: to buy 1 pile of blouses and 50 skirts

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: EL ES UN JOVEN QUE DE NIÑO SUS PADRES NO ATENDIERON LOS PROBLEMAS DENTALES QUE PRESENTABA ESTO DEBIDO A LA FALTA DE RECURSOS. ACTUALMENTE SUS DIENTES NO ESTÁN ALINEADOS APROPIADAMENTE POR LO QUE SE LE DIFICULTA MASTICAR SUS ALIMENTOS. ASIMISMO COMO SU RESPIRACIÓN ES BUCAL SE CANSA MUCHO EN SUS LABORES. EL TRABAJA COMO ELECTRICISTA EN UNA EMPRESA Y LOS INGRESOS QUE PERCIBE NO LE ALCANZAN PARA EL TRATAMIENTO DE ORTODONCIA QUE NECESITA.
texts.en:
When he was a boy his parents did not attend to his dental problems due to the lack of resources. Now, his teeth are not properly aligned. Therefore, it is difficult for him to chew his food. As he breathes through his mouth, he gets tired a lot at his work.

He works for a company as an electrician, and he does not earn enough to pay for the orthodontic treatment that he needs.

loans.use: to pay for dental treatment.

loans.name: Badeya Group

texts.fr:
Yabogou  est l’un des membres du groupe Badeya  et c’est elle qui présente  le bélier dans la photo, elle est de nationalité malienne, âgée de 53 ans, mariée et mère de  4 enfants.
Elle réside à Pissa depuis 20ans et elle n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Elle gagne sa vie dans l’élevage ovin, elle achète les moutons  à koulogo et les revends  à Baye avec un chiffre d’affaire de 50 000 fcfa.
Afin d’augmenter ses revenus et d’acheter plus de moutons elle sollicite un  prêt auprès du RMCR.
De nos jours Yabogou est une ancienne cliente du RMCR après deux cycles écoulés sans défaillance Elle demande un troisième prêt pour le développement de son activité et son revenu dans le but de se prendre en charge  et préparer l’avenir des enfants.
En outres, elle souhaite fréquenter les grands marchés dans les jours à venir pour gagner plus de  bénéfice et d’être autonome financièrement.
texts.en:
Yabogou is a member of the group Badeya. She is the one in the photo presenting a sheep. She is a Malian national, 53 years old, and the married mother of four.

She has been residing in Pissa for 20 years and has never been to school. She earns a living by raising sheep. She buys the sheep in Koulogo and resells them in Baye with sale figures amounting to 50,000 francs CFA.

To increase her revenues and purchase more sheep, she is requesting a loan from RMCR.

These days, Yabogou is a former client of RMCR after having completed two cycles without defaulting. She is asking for a third loan to improve her business and her income with the goal of supporting herself and preparing the children’s future.

loans.use: to purchase reasonably priced sheep to raise for eight months and then to resell.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es: Don Juan de 58 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, cuenta con un taller de estructuras metalicas desde hace 10 años, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el quiere mejorar su vivienda contruyendo un muro y colocando piso ceramico pero como no posee de suficiente capital esta solicitando un credito para la compra de los materiales de construccion necesarios para poder tener una mejor vivienda.
texts.en:
Juan, age 58, lives with his wife in his own house. He has had a metal shop for ten years. With what he gets from his work he manages to pay for some of the household expenses.

He wants to improve his house by building a wall and laying down a tile floor. However, he does not have enough capital. He is requesting a loan to buy the construction materials needed to be able to have a better house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Albena

texts.en:
Albena works hard to support her family. Albena is married and has a poultry business in the Philippines.

Albena requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her chickens. Albena has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Albena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her chickens

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion works hard to support her family. Concepcion is widowed and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Concepcion requested a PHP 45,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, sugar, bread, eggs, candies, etc. to sell.

Concepcion has been in this business for 22 years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Concepcion would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, sugar, bread, eggs, candies, etc. to sell

loans.name: Binkadi Group

texts.fr:
Membre du groupe Binkadi Fatoumata est une malienne alphabétisé et c’est elle qui tient le bélier dans la photo, âgé de 35 ans elle vit avec son mari et ses 4 enfants . ,3 garçons et une fille les trois garçons sont scolarisés. Depuis 5 ans elle achète les béliers dans les marchés locaux, les engraissés et les revend. Son mari fait l’agriculture et le petit commerce pour nourrir sa famille.
Fatoumata a remboursé son premier prêt RMCR et elle demande un deuxième prêt pour acheter plus de béliers  afin de gagner beaucoup de bénefices au moment des ventes,Ce qui lui permettra de couvrir les dépenses familiales telles que  les frais scolaires et habillements des enfants. Elle souhaite devenir autonome en fréquentant les grands marchés dans le but d’augmenter son revenu et aider son mari dans la prise en charge des dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
A member of the group Binkadi, Fatoumata is a literate Malian woman. She is the one in the photo holding a sheep. Aged 35, she lives with her husband and her four children (three boys and a girl), who are in school. For five years, Fatoumata has been buying sheep at the local markets, fattening them, and reselling them. Her husband is a farmer and a has small-scale business to feed the family.

Fatoumata paid back her first RMCR loan and is asking for a second one to purchase more sheep, so as to earn a lot of profit upon selling. This will enable her to cover family expenses, such as school fees and clothing for the children. She would like to become autonomous by going to the big markets with the aim of increasing her revenues and helping out her husband to meet family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase sheep to raise for eight months and then to resell

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Emelita is 46 years old and has five children who are in school.

Emelita has a ready to wear business in the Philippines. Emelita requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear to sell to her customers.

Emelita has been in this business for four years. In the future, Emelita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 32 years old and married with four children. With four children currently in school, Marites works very hard to provide for them.

Marites runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items like detergent soap, shampoo, beer, candies, noodles, etc. to sell.

Marites has been in this business for 8 years and sells a variety of items such as detergent soap, shampoo, beers, candies, noodles, etc.

In the future, Marites would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like detergent soap, shampoo, beer, candies, noodles, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 58 years old and married with twelve children. With two children currently in school, Emma works very hard to provide for them.

Emma runs a general store in the Philippines. She requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

Emma has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as soft-drinks, biscuits, candies, noodles, coffee, cereals, etc.

In the future, Emma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Joani

texts.en:
Joani is 35 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines. Joani requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like seasonings, meat, spices, etc. for her food vending business.

Joani has been in this business for 4 years.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like seasonings, meat, spices, etc. for her food vending business.

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en:
Genelyn is 28 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like canned goods, beverages, and other groceries.

Genelyn has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as beverages, canned goods, soap, shampoo, junk foods and other groceries.

In the future, Genelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like canned goods, beverages, and other groceries

loans.name: Jenny Rose

texts.en:
Jenny Rose is 27 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Jenny Rose is borrowing 7,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Jenny Rose has been in this business for 1 year and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Ma. Merna

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Ma. Merna works hard to support her family.

She has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Ma. Merna is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy additional containers of coconut wine to sell for her coconut wine vending business.

Ma. Merna has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional containers of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Marie Madelene

texts.fr: Madeleine est une femme divorcée. Elle a 55 ans, mère de 4 enfants. Pour prendre soin de sa famille, elle revend des bonbons et autres sucreries. Cette petite activité l’aide à ne pas rester sans rien faire. Elle veut trouver un prêt pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en: Madeleine is a divorced woman. She is 55 years old and has four children. To take care of her family, she resells candy and other sweets. This small business helps her keep busy. She would like to find a loan to increase her stock.

loans.use: to buy a supply of candy.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 45 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosalina is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Rosalina has been in this business for five years and also earns additional income from coconut wine vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Ma. Heidi

texts.en:
Margaret Heidi buys and sells food supplements to earn her living. She earns an additional income from food vending. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. As the parent of two children, she works hard to support her family.

She requested a loan in the amount of PhP 7,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to purchase a variety of food supplements to offer for sale to her customers.

Margaret Heidi hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to  purchase a variety of food supplements to offer for sale to her customers

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Marivic works hard to support her family.

She has a buying and selling of personal care products business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Marivic is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy items like slippers, shoes, etc., to sell for her personal care products business.

Marivic has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items like slippers, shoes, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Rosa works hard to support her family.

She has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Rosa is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock of coconut wine to sell for her coconut wine vending business.

Rosa has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 50 years old and married with eight children.

Rosemarie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like canned goods, eggs, home care products, and other groceries.

Rosemarie has borrowed and paid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from coconut wine vending.

Rosemarie aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like canned goods, eggs, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Lucianne

texts.fr: Lucianne, 35 ans, marié et mère de cinq enfants qui sont tous régulièrement scolarisés. Son mari est artisan-maçon. Lucianne ne veut pas rester les bras croisés. Elle a démarré une petite activité de revente de produits alimentaires. Elle souhaite développer cette activité. Elle demande un prêt pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en: Lucianne is a 35-year-old, married mother of five children who are all in school regularly. Her husband is an artisanal mason. Lucianne does not want to be idle. She began a small business reselling groceries. She would like to grow the business. She is asking for a loan to increase her stock.

loans.use: to increase her stock of groceries.

loans.name: Enotte

texts.fr: Enotte a 34 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle fait le commerce de produits alimentaires. C’est ainsi qu’elle gagne sa vie et prend soin de sa famille depuis six ans. Elle demande un prêt pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en: Enotte is 34 years old. She is married and has two children. She has a business selling groceries. This is how she has been making a living and taking care of her family for the past six years. She is asking for a loan to increase her stock.

loans.use: to buy cases of condensed milk.

loans.name: Josephat

texts.en:
Josephat buys and sells snack food items to earn her living. She offers such snacks as "ampaw" (puffed rice) and a variety of breads. She earns an additional income by preparing and selling home-cooked meals to her neighbors and members of her community. Her husband is a carpenter and a welder, and they have two young children.

Josephat would like to improve her earnings, so she decided to join CEVI in order to access a loan. With her loan funds, she will acquire additional capital for her snack sales business, and she will also be able to purchase more ingredients for her food vending business, such as vegetables, meat, and seasonings. Adding a stock of these essential ingredients will improve her income and increase her profitability, which in turn will enable her to continue to augment her livelihood efficiently so that she can start to seek ways to become more productive.

In the future, Josephat is determined to continue to do her best to support the needs of her growing children.

loans.use: to acquire additional capital for her snack sales business, and she will also be able to purchase more ingredients for her food vending business, such as vegetables, meat, and seasonings

loans.name: Aprilyn

texts.en:
Aprilyn is a married woman who does domestic work for a living. She engages in food vending. She sells fresh fish to the locals in her place.

She lives in her own home with her 8-year-old son. Her husband's occupation is bus driving. She resides in the rural town of Maribojoc, Bohol.

She is asking for a loan to buy more fresh fish and purchase a boat. These items are very vital. These items will improve her profitability and allow her to continue to sell a variety of fish to her respective customers. Thus, she will be able to pay her obligations and invest in other sources of income to become sustainable.

She is grateful to Kiva for the support.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish and purchase a boat.

loans.name: Shella Marie

texts.en:
Shella Marie is 36 years old and married with six children.

Shella Marie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

Shella Marie has borrowed and paid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Shella Marie aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, like beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Susan works hard to support her family.

She has a buying and selling of rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Susan is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell for her rice business.

Susan has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 56 years old and widowed with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Zenaida is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Zenaida has been in this business for 11 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Liliosa

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Liliosa works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming corn. Liliosa is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as meat, vegetable, fish, etc.

Liliosa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 1 loan from NWTF.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as meat, vegetable, fish, etc.

loans.name: Samnang

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of Kampot province’s Kampong Trach district, Samnang is 20 years old and single. To make a living, he has been farming rice for several years and also raising cows to earn additional income. Low crop yield destroyed by insect pests is the main challenge for his business.

This is Samnang’s fourth loan cycle with VisionFund. The past loans have helped him to better support his family. Now he is requesting a new loan to pay for his university’s tuition fee. He hopes that this loan will enable him to find a good job after so he can continue supporting his family.

loans.use: to pay for his university’s tuition fee.

loans.name: Esther  Ablavi

texts.fr: Esther est une femme mariée âgée de 36 ans résidante à Baguida. Mère de quatre enfants, Esther est une revendeuse de produits alimentaires qui s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché et le revend sous un hangar à la devanture de son domicile. Esther désire ce prêt pour commander des sacs des paniers de piment vert, de gombo et des bols de farines de manioc. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera suite à une bonne vente, Esther compte améliorer sa prestation de vente et aider sa famille à avoir un bon épanouissement et une bonne éducation scolaire à ses enfants.
texts.en: Esther is a married, 36-year-old woman who lives in Baguida. She has four children. Esther resells grocery products that she purchases once a month at the market and resells from a shed at the front of her home. Esther would like this loan to order bags of baskets of green chilis, okra, and bowls of cassava flour. With the profit margin resulting from good sales, Esther intends to improve her sales performance and help her family to grow and to help her children have a good education.

loans.use: to buy two bags of green chilis, okra and bowls of red corn flour.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 25 años de edad y vivir de zona de alto riesgo, desde hace 5 años se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, la joven vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal para poder continuar con la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: The young woman whose face has been pixelated is 25 years old and lives in a high risk area. For five years, she has been dedicated to making and selling tortillas. Her business is located in her place of residence and she has a lot of customers. The young woman lives in her own house with her husband. She is requesting a loan to buy maize by the quintal and lime to be able to continue making tortillas and thus be able to have better income to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn quintals and lime.

loans.name: Benjie

texts.en:
Benjie is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 30 years old and has four children who are in school. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Benjie has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell in the market. She has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Benjie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell in the market.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is 50 years old, married, and has two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Juliana runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like personal care products, home care products, and groceries.

Juliana has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like personal care products, home care products, and groceries.

loans.name: Jovidjon

texts.ru: Човидчон 26 летный житель района Бохтар. Он живет вместе с матерью, сестренкой и женой. У него пока нет детей. В семье только работает Човидчон, и он кормить свою семью.
