Човидчон с детства был самостоятельным и талантливым парнем. У него есть цех по производство сундук. Човидчон работает один, и отличный резчик. 3 года он производит сундук.  У него отлично получается гравировкой. Резчиком не все справится, для этого у человека должен быть желание и талант. Човидчон хочет приобрести доска  производство сундук, и для продвижения деятельностью. У него нет такая сумма денег, и по этой причине Човидчон просит кредит. Он очень нуждается в помощи.
texts.en:
Jovidjon is a 26-year-old resident of the Bohtar region. He lives with his mother, sister and wife. He doesn't have any children yet. He is the only one in the family who works and he feeds the whole family. He has been an independent, talented guy since he was a child. He has a workshop where he manufactures wooden chests. He works alone and is an excellent carver, and his engravings turn out well too. He has had this occupation for three years. Not everyone can be a carver - for this a person needs to have both desire and talent.

Jovidjon wants to buy wood for making chests and to continue his business. He doesn't have enough money and for this reason is requesting a loan. He needs this help very much.

loans.use: to buy wood to expand his business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 24 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de semillas de marañón asadas, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 5 años y ya tiene clientes fijos que la prefieren por la calidad del producto y los buenos precios, la joven vive con su grupo familiar en casa propia, ella está solicitando un crédito para comprar más semillas de marañón por mayor para poder continuar con su trabajo y así poder tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: The young woman whose face has been pixelated in the photo is 24 and lives in a high-risk zone. She sells roasted cashew seeds, which she has been doing for five years. She has a loyal customer base who appreciate the high quality of her product and her good prices. She lives with her family in their own home. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cashew seeds at wholesale so she can continue working and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more cashew seeds at wholesale.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou, age 21, married at a young age and already has a two-year-old child and a two-month-old baby. Her husband works at a construction site, and Marilou needs to work hard to help him support the family. To earn an income, she makes and sells baskets. The family lives in Catigbian, Bohol.

Marilou has been making and selling baskets for five years, and she wishes to improve her business in order to enhance her earnings to better sustain her family's needs. She requested a loan in order to buy raw materials needed for making baskets, specifically rattan stems. (Rattan is a tropical palm.)

She reports that she will also use a portion of the loan money to buy feed, which suggests that she is also engaged in a hog-raising business, a common enterprise in many households in her region.

loans.use: to buy raw materials needed for making baskets (specifically rattan stems) and animal feed

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is into tuba (coconut) wine retailing. She buys at the same time tuba and soft drinks like Pepsi, to sell to the locals in her place. She has been doing that for four years ago. That serves as the family's main source of living. She is a 38-year-old married woman, with three children and all of them are still attending school. To have additional income, she also sells electronic top-up load, serving locals and neighbors respectively.

Due to scarcity of capital, Celia decided to avail loan to Kiva's field partner Cevi, to boost her business. She wants to buy seven containers of tuba (coconut wine), five cases of soft drinks and additional top-up load. The presence of these resources could maintain the inventory and attract potential customers to shop. Slowly her income will augment and enable her to set aside half of the profits for emergency use, while the other half is for livelihood expansion. Celia is determined that she will be more innovative in order to become successful someday.

loans.use: to buy seven containers of tuba (coconut wine), five cases of soft drinks, and additional top-up load.

loans.name: Brenda Aracely

texts.es:
Brenda es una mujer de treinta y tres años de edad, muy trabajadora y responsable, es madre de tres hijos, a los cuales ha logrado sacar adelante por medio de su negocio de venta de artículos de limpieza para el hogar. Ella empezó desde joven en el mundo del comercio, dado que salió embarazada a una edad temprana, no contaba con ninguna experiencia, su negocio inicio solo con una caja de jabones para baño, ahora distribuye todo tipo de jabones, detergentes y limpia pisos. 
Esta mujer realmente es un ejemplo de perseverancia y esfuerzo, gracias a su empeño, su negocio ha ido creciendo de forma notable. Brenda ha tocado las puertas de Kiva junto a MiCrédito porque planea utilizar este financiamiento para comprar artículos de higiene personal como shampoo, pasta de dientes, cepillos de dientes, máquinas de afeitar, jabones de baño, entre otros. En un futuro planea mejorar la infraestructura de su local y abrir otra puesto de venta.
texts.en:
Brenda is a 33 year old woman. She is very hard working and responsible. She is mother to three children who she has managed to progress through her business selling cleaning items for the home. She began in the world of commerce when she was young. Since she became pregnant at a young age, she had no experience. Her business began only with one box of bathroom soaps. Now she distributes all types of soaps, detergents and floor cleaners.

This woman really is an example of perseverance and effort. Thanks to her hard work, her business has been growing significantly. Brenda has knocked on the doors of Kiva along with MiCredito because she plans to use this loan to buy personal hygiene items like shampoo, toothpaste, toothbrushes, electric shavers, bath soap, among other items. In the future, she plans to improve the infrastructure of her shop and to open another stall.

loans.use: to buy personal hygiene items like shampoo, toothpaste,  toothbrushes, electric shavers, bath soap, among other items.

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.en:
Bonifacia is a 54-year-old married woman with nine children. Five of her children are adults and four are school-aged. Bonifacia lives a simple life in a small town of Catigbian, Bohol. Her husband is a construction worker and she helps her husband financially by making baskets to sell and selling charcoal to the community. Bonifacia has been doing this for seven years. 

Bonifacia is requesting a loan to buy raw materials to make baskets. She will use rattan (tropical palm) stems and will also buy coconut shells to use to make charcoal.  Bonifacia’s goal in life is to become successful and able to provide for the needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy rattan stems for baskets and coconut shells for charcoal

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is married and has one child. She earns a living by selling dried fish to the community of Tubigon. She works hard alone to support the needs of her family since her husband is unable to work. 

Elizabeth requested a loan, which she will use to buy more dried fish to sell. With the loan, she will be able to improve her business and make it more profitable. In spite of the obstacles she and her family have encountered, she will be able to stand up and continue doing for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish

loans.name: Faustino Jr.

texts.en:
Faustino is a 36-year-old man from the town of Tubigon, Bohol. He is married and has three children; who are nine, seven, and two years old. He earns a living driving his motorcycle and sellling vegetables.

He needs a loan to maintain his motorcycle maintenance and buy spare parts. He will also buy vegetable seedlings (such as bitter gourd) and nylon string that serve as trellis to grow his plants.

Faustino’s main goal in life is to improve his livelihood to have enough money to send his children in college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for a motorcycle and vegetable seedlings.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is a sari-sari (variety) storeowner, where she sells a variety of goods and vegetables. She is 63 years old and a married woman. She and her family live in a town of Calape, Bohol. Ana has been running her store for 20 years to earn. It is the business that sustains them.

Thus, she hopes to improve this business in the future for their sustainability. With this, she is requesting a loan to buy stock for her store such as canned goods, noodles, eggs, cooking oil, spices, snack foods, mosquito repellent, vegetables and other commodities.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, eggs, cooking oil, spices, snack foods, mosquito repellent, vegetables and other commodities.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz, age 43, operates a small family farm to earn an income. Her husband is an electrician and laborer, and Beatriz has been planting, harvesting, and selling vegetables for 20 years to help him support the family. They have six children, two of whom are now adults. The four younger children still attend school. Beatriz and her husband work hard to support them and offer them better lives. The family lives in Tubigon, Bohol.

Beatriz wishes to improve her business so that she can better sustain her family's daily needs, as well as to be able to pay her children's school fees. She therefore requested a loan in order to buy vegetable seedlings (such as squash) and fertilizer. A portion of the loan fund will also be used to pay laborers.

Her goal is to make a good living for her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seedlings (such as squash) and fertilizer, as well as to pay laborers

loans.name: Glomera Mae

texts.en:
Glomera Mae is a woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 22 years old now. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Glomera Mae requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell. She has been in this business for two years. In the future, Glomera Mae would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
Annaliza, age 43, runs a general store to earn her living. She has been engaged in this business for three years, and she sells a variety of grocery items and household goods in her store. She and her husband have four children, three of whom attend school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She requested a loan in the amount of PhP 15,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy items to offer for sale in her store, such as bread, condiments, and home care products.

In the future, Annaliza would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to offer for sale in her store, such as bread, condiments, and home care products

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 59 years old and has three children. She works very hard to provide for them. She operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 13 years, selling a variety of items.

Virginia requested a loan from NWTF for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase items to sell such as canned goods, liquor, home care products, and other groceries. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell such as canned goods, liquor, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie, age 49, earns her living as a fish vendor. She has been engaged in this business for 20 years. She and her husband have seven children, and she works hard to provide for them.

Virgie requested a loan in the amount of PhP 9,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy boxes of fish to offer for sale.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy boxes of fish to offer for sale

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a 47-year-old married woman with six children who is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has one child in school.

Rosalinda has had a fish vending business for 5 years and requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fish to sell.

In the future, Rosalinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Baloon Bay Group

texts.en:
May is a 33-year-old, widowed grocer with a dependent child in her care. She resides in the Teshie Province. May (pictured first from the right) has been operating her business for over five years, earning a remarkable profit. Her only child attends school.

As leader of this three-member group called Ballon Bay, May would like to request a loan, and will use her portion to buy thread, materials, needle, cloth and sewing accessories to sell and to improve her family’s income. In the future, May will expand her business, build a new proper house and support her only child to earn higher education.

loans.use: to buy thread, materials, needle, cloth and sewing accessories to sell and to improve her family’s income.

loans.name: Popheaktra

texts.en:
Popheaktra is 22-year-old single civil servant who is from Kandal Province in Cambodia. He earns around 6 USD per day. His major at the university is business administration. He is in his first year at university.

He would like to request a loan to cover his university fees. In the future, Popheaktra is going to find a better job in a company to earn a reasonable salary. He wants to save money to build his own house.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees for the first year

loans.name: April Love

texts.en:
April Love is a 27-year-old, married woman from Calape, Bohol. She is a mother of a 15-year-old girl who is the center of their life. With this, she and her husband are working hard to provide and give the best for their child. She and her husband are selling fish to the community to earn and support the needs of their daughter.

They have been doing this business for six years and hoping to improve this business. April Love is in need of a loan for additional capital to buy more fish to sell. In this way, it will help them increase their earnings and augment their profits.

loans.use: to buy more fish.

loans.name: Christian

texts.en:
Christian is a 26-year-old married man with two children who are nine months and four years old. He is from the small town of Catigbia, Bohol. For 10 years, Christian has supported his family by driving a motorcycle in town. Aside from driving, he also buys and sells animals such as pigs and goats. 

Christian is requesting a loan to buy spare parts to maintain his motorcycle. He will also use part of his loan to buy pigs and goats to sell. Christian will use his loan to improve his sales and augment his profit.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to maintain his motorcycle and buy pigs and goats

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en:
“Buko” or young coconut has a lot of benefits to the human body. Coconut water alone is a delicious thirst quencher, eliminates toxins in the body, and naturally flushes small kidney stones. While coconut meat is so versatile that it can be eaten raw, mixed in salad, shredded and juiced as main ingredient in many Filipino dishes.

Coconuts grow well in tropical countries like the Philippines. But the crowded cities cannot accommodate this tall tree, so the supply of coconuts in the city comes from the provinces. Virgilio, 56, saw this need many years ago, hence he decided to sell young coconuts in Pasay City. It continues to be a booming business as people learn this healthy alternative to soda drinks. It serves as Virgilio’s primary source of income that sustains his children’s needs and education. He’s already widowed, that’s why he tries his best to earn enough for their daily sustenance.

He is imploring your kindness to lend him additional capital of PHP 8,000. With this amount, he can buy more young coconuts to resell that will lead to his increased profit. He is praying that you would extend your hand to him. May bountiful blessings come your way.

Virgilio meets with his co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of his life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and religion. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more young coconuts to resell

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is a married woman with three children who works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business and earns additional income from food vending. Teodora is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fish to sell.

Teodora has sustained her business through 2 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream which is to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy  fish to sell.

loans.name: Maria Orbelina

texts.es:
María, de 36 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, es madre soltera, solo tiene un hijo que está estudiando y vive con ella y su bisabuela. 

María, trabaja bordando y tejiendo mantas, ella aprendió a elaborar este tipo de prendas desde que tenía siete años, ella se levanta temprano para realizar todos los quehaceres de su casa durante la mañana y por la tarde busca su aguja y sus hilos para ponerse a tejer las mantas durante toda la tarde, porque es cuando tiene espacio libre para hacerlo; ella vende las mantas en las panaderías y en las tortillerias, pues los diseños que ella hace son muy lindos y los ponen a la exposición de los clientes de dichas panaderías y tortillerias, de esa manera consigue nuevos clientes; pero también elabora petates de tule, este es un material bien fresco y es utilizado más que todo por las familias del campo y su hijo es quien le ayuda a ella a la elaboración de los petates.

María, necesita el préstamo para comprar materiales como mantas, agujas, hilo y lana para bordar.

María, sueña con que su hijo obtenga un titulo universitario, que le permita conseguir un trabajo digno y estable; ademas de eso ella quiere arreglar su vivienda porque está dañada.
texts.en:
María, 36, finished second grade. She is a single mother. She has only one son who is studying and lives with her and her great-grandmother.

María works embroidering and weaving blankets. She learned to make these types of garments when she was 7 years old. She gets up early to do all her housework in the morning and in the afternoon she looks for her needle and thread to weave the blankets in the afternoon because it is when she has free time to do so. She sells the blankets in the bakeries and tortillerias since the designs that she makes are very beautiful and her bakery and tortilleria customers put them on show. In this way, she gains new customers. But she also makes tule mats (rush mats). This is a fresh material and it is used mostly by families from the countryside and her son is who helps her making the mats.

María needs the loan to buy materials like blankets, needles, thread and wool to embroider.

María dreams of her son obtaining a university degree that allows him to get a dignified and stable job. In addition, she wants to fix her house because it is damaged.

loans.use: to buy materials like bed covers, needles, thread and wool to embroider.

loans.name: Iris Ann

texts.en:
Itris Ann is married and has four children. She works hard to support her family. She operates an internet café business in the Philippines. She earns additional income from selling feeds. 

Iris Ann is requesting her third loan from NWTF for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase an additional monitor, mouse, and other supplies needed in her business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase an additional monitor, mouse, and other supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Ricketh

texts.en:
Ricketh is a 34-year-old, married woman with three children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a buy-and-sell fish business in the Philippines.

Ricketh has requested a PHP 29,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell. She has been in this business for five years. In the future, Ricketh would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Sopheap is a local farmer who resides in Battambang province. He is a 20-year-old single man.

He has helped his parents grow cassava as the main source of income. He is a university student at Norton University, Cambodia. The recent cassava crop was poor and it effected his income. He is applying for a Kiva loan via VisionFund to pay his school fee, pursue his studies, and graduate. He hopes to get a good job after graduation and earn more income to improve his living.

loans.use: to pay his school fees and graduate.

loans.name: Masooma

texts.en:
Masooma is 27 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband operates his own auto repair shop, which he has been doing for 13 years. 

Masooma's husband needs to purchase tools, spare parts, and other accessories for his business. Due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to purchase these items. Masooma requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, which she will use to help her husband this merchandise for his business. With the loan, he will earn more income and will be able to support his family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase tools and spare parts for her husband's auto repair shop.

loans.name: Gaspar

texts.en:
Gaspar is a 28-year-old man. He is married to a loving wife who supports every one of his projects. They have been married for 5 years and live in his farther-in-law's house because his wife didn't want to leave her parents on their own.

To make a living, Gaspar drives a public transportation van. He is a hard working person and is deeply motivated by the thought of moving his family ahead, therefore he works 15 hours per day.

Gaspar is really excited because he is close to becoming a father, his wife is pregnant with a boy. Gaspar will be accomplishing a lifetime goal, "to have a family of his own". It wont be long before the baby arrives, but he needs to cover the medical expense of the delivery, so he is applying for a 15,000 MXN loan at Kiva, through Kubo (field partner) to pay the doctor and hospital fees.

loans.use: to pay for the delivery of his baby

loans.name: Marsih

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Marsih. She is a 45-year-old married woman with three sons and two daughters. Marsih is an employee, and her husband is a security worker.

She has asked for a loan of IDR 7,200,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to improve access to sanitation and clean water for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources, but Marsih will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all lenders.

loans.use: this loan will be used to improve access to sanitation and clean water for their family.

loans.name: Daana

texts.en:
Daana is a freshman in the International and Comparative Politics Program at AUCA. Among more than 93 universities in Kyrgyzstan, she has chosen to study at AUCA. She has a great desire to study here because only it has reputation of the honest and corruption free university, where all depends on everyone’s knowledge and aspirations. She wants to get strong and good knowledge and be successful as the AUCA Alumni, who work worldwide at Google, Cisco System, BBC, Citibank, IBM, etc.

An international atmosphere of the university also plays a great role for Daana, as she loves to meet foreign people, and discover something new for her. Lessons taught in English will improve her language skills and prepare her for the communication with people abroad. Daana wants to be a politician, so all above said knowledge and practice is needed for her future profession. She loves Kyrgyzstan and proud of it. She hopes to get a degree and be useful for her country. She thinks that assisting in the development of Motherland depends on every citizen and should be a must for everyone living here.

Daana lives with her mother and younger sister. Her mother works in two places as a psychologist and a manager, as she is the only person to support her family. Daana always studied well at school to help her mother somehow, to show her that her mother’s efforts will be not wasted, but invested in her, and that she will be a smart and a good assistant for her mother in the future. The opportunity to receive a Kiva loan is an important thing for Daana and her mother. It will constitute a significant relief for her family.

loans.use: to pay for her higher education in the International and Comparative Projects Program.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 21 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de semillas de marañón asadas, desde hace 3 años y ya tiene clientes fijos que lo prefieren por la calidad del producto y los buenos precios, el joven vive con su esposa en casa propia, el está solicitando un crédito para comprar más semillas de marañón por mayor para poder continuar con su trabajo y así poder tener junto con su madre una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: The young man whose face has been pixelated is 21 years old and lives in a high risk area. He has been dedicated to selling roasted cashew seeds for three years and already has fixed customers who prefer him due to the quality of the product and good prices. The young man lives with his wife in their own house. He is requesting a loan to buy more cashew seeds at wholesale to be able to continue his work and thus be able to have, along with his mother, a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more cashew seeds at wholesale.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene has raised and sold hogs for almost five years now. She is married and has one child and is still attending college.

Her husband has an income that could help defray the family's daily expenses.

Her clients are mostly locals in her place. Because the demands nowadays are at peak, she decided to increase the number of hogs she is raises. But she does not have enough funds to do so.

She has requested a loan from CEVI to boost her livelihood. Arlene wants to buy feed, piglets and vitamins. These are essential tool that enables her to produce and sell quality hogs.

In the long run, Arlene could able to roll out her capital and start to put up other sources of income.
In that way, she could improve her family's living conditions and continue support the schooling of her child.


She is excited that someday, she will become successful and she is thankful to Kiva for the support.

loans.use: to buy feed, piglets and vitamins.

loans.name: Sheila Mae

texts.en:
Sheila Mae has been a fish vendor for 5 years now. She helps her husband by peddling his catch to the nearby residents in her place. She lives in the town of Maribojoc, Bohol with her two young children and life partner, which gives her inspiration to strive hard. Her husband is a fisherman and does painting jobs, too.

She has a lack of funds to boost her business and would like to improve her husband's ongoing catch. To do this, Sheila Mae has requested a loan to buy fishing nets and materials for pump boat renovation. With this, her financial income will slowly improve. It would also provide ease when transporting her husband's catch.  

She would like to start investing in other sources of income to become sustainable. She dreams that someday she have her own capital and able to continue to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and materials for pump boat renovation.

loans.name: Ivonny

texts.en:
Ivonny is from the rural town of Maribojoc, Bohol. She is a 24-year-old married woman with a 5-year-old daughter. She prepares snack food such as banana cue (deep-fried banana in caramelized sugar on a bamboo skewered) and hot cakes to help her husband cover the needs and expenses of their household. She also sells Avon products.

She has join CEVI to access loans to support her food vending business. SHe will use the loan to buy meat and vegetables for her food vending business. She will be able to settle her obligations, expand her food business, and make it more productive.

She plans to improve the living condition of the entire family and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase meat and vegetables.

loans.name: Ireneo Jr.

texts.en:
Ireneo and his family live a simple life in a town of Tubigon, Bohol. He and his wife earn a living by selling banana cue (snacks) to their neighbors. They have been doing this for two years. They also raise pigs. They work together to provide for the needs of their children.

They have two children to support, ages six and one. Ireneo is a 26-year-old man who dreams of improving his business for his family. He wants to give them a better life. He is asking for a loan to buy bananas, sugar, cooking oil, and strong material for pigpens. He hopes to raise more pigs and augment his earnings.

loans.use: to buy bananas, sugar, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Virginia works hard to support her family. She runs a business buying and selling scrap in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fish vending. Virginia has been sustaining her businesses through her past two loans from NWTF.

Virginia is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more scrap to sell. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy scrap to sell

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is a 60-year-old married woman with five children. For the past ten years, she has been running a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Catalina is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Catalina is requesting an 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock of fish to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of fish to sell

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Roselyn works hard to support her family. She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from running a general store. Roselyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF.

Roselyn is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell for her business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman with one child in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Josephine is 47 years old now.

Josephine has a buy and sell dried fish business in the Philippines. Josephine requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy variety of dried fish to sell.

Josephine has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Josephine would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy variety of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en:
Carmencita is 44 years old and has seven children. She is married and has two children who are in school. She is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines.

Carmencita has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock. She has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Carmencita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a 52-year-old married woman with five children, four attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Zenaida has had an accessories business for 8 years and requests 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more accessories to sell.

In the future, Zenaida would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more accessories to sell

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 50 years old and has four children. Juliet is married and has three children who are in school.

Juliet is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Juliet requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Juliet has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Juliet would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Rosa Ervin

texts.es:
Rosa, de 32 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer año de bachillerato, está casada, su esposo labora para una unidad de salud de la zona, es madre de dos hijos que están estudiando.

Rosa, es comerciante de medicinas naturales y también de lociones por catalogo desde hace cinco años, ella inició este negocio por la necesidad de generar ingresos económicos para su familia y una amiga le comento que el negocio es rentable y que solo tenia que asesorarse por medio de la unidad de salud para empezar con el negocio de la venta de medicinas.

Rosa, necesita el préstamo para comprar más medicamentos y para comprar un mostrador para colocar las lociones.

Rosa, sueña con tener un bazar de ropa, zapatos, accesorios y todo tipo de ropa para niños, jóvenes y adultos.
texts.en:
Rosa, 32, finished her third year of her baccalaureate. She is married. Her husband works for a health unit in the area. She is mother to two children who are in school.

Rosa has been a trader of natural medicines and also of catalog lotions for five years. She began this business due to a need to earn economic income for her family, and a friend told her that the business is profitable and that she had only to be advised by a health unit to start a business selling medicine.

Rosa needs the loan to buy more medicines and to buy a counter in which to put the lotions.

Rosa dreams of having a bazaar for clothing, shoes, accessories, and all types of children's and adult clothing.

loans.use: to buy more medicines and buy a counter in which to put lotions.

loans.name: Kimleng

texts.en:
Kimleng is a local farmer who resides in Battambang province. He is a single man who is 20 years old. Nowadays, he helps his parents to grow rice and cassava, which has been the main source of income for years. On the other hand, he is a university student who major studies in Banking and Finance.

Recently, his crop was not growing well and it affected the income of this family. Due to not having enough capital to support his studying, he is now applying for a Kiva loan via VisionFund to pay for his school fee, which enables him to pursue his studies until he graduates. He hopes to get a good job after graduating in order to earn more income to improve his living standard.

loans.use: to pay for his school fees, which enables him to pursue his Bachelor degree in Banking and Finance until he graduates.

loans.name: Anees

texts.en:
Anees is a 31-year-old lady and the responsible mother of 5 children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running his own sound system business for past 7 years. 

Anees's husband needs to purchase different types of merchandise for his business, such as a sound system and musical instruments. Due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to purchase this merchandise. To fulfill the needs of her husband's business, Anees has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she will help her husband to buy this merchandise for his business. This will be good for him to earn more income, and this income will support and fulfill his family's needs.

Anees is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband expand his musical sound system business.

loans.name: Raheela

texts.en:
Raheela is 43 years old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan and is a mother of four children. Her husband is the guardian of family and responsible to fulfill the need of all family members. Raheela has been running her own beauty salon for past 20 years, she also contribute her income with her husband to manage the house hold.

She needs to buy different types of cosmetics i.e creams, hair brush, and other accessories for her beauty salon but due to financial constraints she is not capable to buy these items for her business purpose. Therefore Raheela has applied for Kiva loan. This loan will help her to buy the relevant items so that she can provide better services to her customers. It will also be helpful for her to earn maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family.
on this financial assistance Raheela is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her beauty salon business.

loans.name: Chantha's Group

texts.en: Chantha’s group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Chantha makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help both of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Najum

texts.en:
Najum is 51 years old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan and mother of 4 children. Her husband has been running a general store for past 40 years. Najum's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities e.g rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items for his business purpose. But due to financial constraints her husband is not in suitable position to buy all above these products.

Therefore Najum has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these commodities and also helpful for him to earn maximum profitable income to manage his household and business.
Najum is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's general store business.

loans.name: Nav's Group

texts.en:
Nav’s group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Nav makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as factory laborer and construction worker to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these group members to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Sreyneang's Group

texts.en:
Sreyneang’s group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Sreyneang​​ works as a seller to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sreytouch's Group

texts.en:
Sreytouch’s Group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Sreytouch works as a farmer and she also does extra work as a factory laborer and policewoman to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Phan's Group

texts.en:
Phan’s Group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Phan works as seller and he also does extra work as a factory laborer and security to support his family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and this man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Khim's Group

texts.en:
Khim’s Group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Khim works as driver and she also does extra work as a factory laborer and a construction worker to support her family.

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Aziret

texts.en:
Aziret is an 18-year-old freshman studying Human Rights in the Liberal Arts and Science Division at AUCA. Since childhood he wanted to be a lawyer who would protect the rights of people. He is confident that he has good qualities to become a lawyer such as sociability, honesty, a good memory, logical thinking, making the right decisions, and responsibility. Respecting others and decency are his main goals. The difficulties and obstacles that come with this occupation sparked his interest in it and give him an incentive for further development. It motivates him to help people and he is sure that his help and knowledge will be needed by people.

Aziret came to study at AUCA from the south part of Kyrgyzstan. In Jalal-Abad he has a family of six people: his parents, two elder sisters, himself, and a younger sister. His father used to be a building engineer, but for the last 6 years he has run his own small shop. Aziret’s mother is a 44-year-old housewife. His two elder sisters are also students at universities in his home town -- one is a future economist and other is a future lawyer. They study at ordinary local universities, as his family hasn't had the opportunity to send them to study in the capital.. Taking into consideration that Aziret is the only son in the family, his parents are trying their best to assist him to study at AUCA. Aziret’s education plays great role in his family since, according to the Kyrgyz people's mentality, he will be the right hand and the main supporter of his family after his father. Being the only son to assist his family in the future makes Aziret a serious and a diligent student. He loves his family and respects the traditions.

By supporting Aziret Kiva lenders not just help him to get a degree, but help the whole country raise the next lawyer with big ambitions.

loans.use: to pay for his higher education.

loans.name: Thouch's Group

texts.en: The members of Thouch’s group live in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Thouch works as a seller, and she also does extra work as a factory laborer to support her family. In her village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these group members to safeguard the health of their families, to save money on medical expenses, and to save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is a 31-year-old man who is married and blessed with two children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014 to benefit from the training, especially enterprise development and financial management. This training enabled him to effectively manage his businesses. He was also able to hire a piece of land and start farming vegetables. 

He currently does vegetable and dairy farming to earn a living. He is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy dairy feed to increase his milk production. This will consequently increase his income.

He is grateful to Kiva and the lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy dairy feed to increase milk production.

loans.name: Seinoun's Group

texts.en:
Seinoun’s Group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Seinoun does work as a farmer to support her family.

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and the man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family

loans.name: Sumiyati

texts.en:
Sumiyati is a 40-year-old married with two sons and two daughters. She has been selling food and her husband is an employee. She has asked for a loan of IDR 7.000,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build water source at their home to improve access to clean water and sanitation for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources but Sumiyati will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all lenders.

loans.use: to build a toilet at their home to improve access to clean water and sanitation for their family.

loans.name: Malohat

texts.en: Malohat was born in 1976 year. She is widowed and she is the careful mother of 4 children. Her children are still small. Malohat needs money for feeding her children, so she has begun a business with buying and selling food items 7 months ago. She has a rental shop where she sells a variety of food items. Malohat sells meat products, sweets, bread, butter, milk products and etc. Many of her buyers are neighbors and friends and are satisfied with her goods. Malohat is going to increase her working capital and in this way to develop business. Her son Parviz has promised to help her in this way. Malohat is asking for a loan of 10000 Somoni to buy food items for increasing working capital. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy food items for increased working capital.

loans.name: Ana Ruth

texts.es: Ana de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia y con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda cambiando las puertas pero con lo que obtiene de su trabajo no le alcanza para realizarlo, por esa razon solicita un credito para la compra de puertas y pago de mano de obra y asi poder tener una vivienda mas segura.
texts.en:
Ana is 42 years old and lives in her own house with her family. She has a small shop located in her home, and with the profit that she gets she manages to cover some of the household expenses.

She wants to improve her residence by changing out the doors, but with what she earns from her job she is not able to achieve this. For this reason she solicits a loan in order to buy doors and pay for labor, and thus be able to have a more secure residence.

loans.use: to buy doors and pay for labor.

loans.name: Flor Del Carmen

texts.es: flor de 35 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de semillas de marañon desde hace 8 años y con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas semillas de marañon por mayor y asi poder tener mejores ingresos economicos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Flor, 35, lives in her own home with her family. She has been selling cashews for 8 years and with the profits she obtains she manages to cover some household expenses. She is requesting a loan to buy more cashews wholesale, and thus be able to can have better economic returns for a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy more cashews wholesale.

loans.name: Judegen

texts.en:
Judegen, age 43, is a fish vendor from the town of Loon, Bohol. Her husband is a fisherman, and he brings her his daily catch so that she can offer the fish for sale to members of her local community. He supplements his income with carpentry work. They have four children.

Judegen would like to improve her husband's ongoing yield, but she has very limited funds to work with. She therefore joined CEVI in order to access a loan to boost their fishing business. With her loan funds, she will buy fishing materials like fishing nets, nylon, and floaters. These are essential tools to bring about a bountiful catch. She expects this investment to augment her income. Judegen handles her finances wisely and has repaid her previous loan successfully.

She is grateful to have the opportunity to access a loan that will allow her to build and improve her fishing business.

loans.use: buy fishing materials like fishing nets, nylon, and floaters

loans.name: Mahfirat

texts.en:
Mahfirat is an industrious woman from the capital of Tajikistan. She is married and has three children. Her children are Najibullo, Mehrina and Aminjon. Her husband Nasrullo is a migrant in Russia.

Mahfirat has her own business deal. She has been busy with buying and selling food items for 15 years. She has great experience in this field, and she knows all aspects of her business well. Mahfirat sells biscuits, sausage, bread, vegetables, etc. Her shop is located in a local market. She periodically increases the assortment of her goods because the business struggle is big in a local market.

Mahfirat is asking for a loan of 10,000 Somoni to buy food items for increasing working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy food items for increasing working capital

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is a hardworking 42-year-old married woman, who earns a living engaging in a direct-selling business. She sells food supplements, vitamins and other household items, which she has used to manage the economy of her house. She has her own property where she lives with her four children and husband, and she is happy to have her family. In addition to that, she also engages in food vending, to cope with the needs of the entire family.

Marcelina wants to continue improving her quality of life, which is why she is requesting a loan with Cevi to acquire additional capital to purchase more stock like vitamins C and food supplements. It that way, she will be able to continue maintaining the inventory of her stock and roll out her capital. She used the previous loan to stock her shop and wants to continue doing so.

loans.use: to acquire additional capital to purchase more stock like vitamins C and food supplements.

loans.name: Jenesa

texts.en:
Jenesa is a 23-year-old woman who lives in Tubigon, Bohol. She married at her early age and manages her own business. She has sold barbecue for six years; her husband works hard as a security guard.

They have two children to support, ages five and one. Jenesa requests 5,000 PHP to buy pork, chicken legs, chicken wings, liver and hotdogs. In the future, Jenesa dreams to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy pork, chicken legs, chicken wings, liver, and hotdogs.

loans.name: Fredelyn

texts.en:
Fredelyn is a resident of Catigbian, Bohol. She is married and has two children, 22 and 16 years old. Her husband went to another country to earn more in order to support and provide all their needs while Fredelyn takes good care of them.

To earn more, Fredelyn started her own business. She buys and sells food (snacks) such as “polboron” (semi-sweet concoction made of toasted flour, powdered milk, sugar, and butter) and peanuts. Aside from this, she also does pedicures and manicures in her neighborhood for extra income.

Fredelyn and her husband want the best for their children. That is why they work hard to earn.

Fredelyn wishes to improve her food-selling business. Thus, she decided to request a loan to buy more stocks of “polboron” and peanuts to sell. She will also buy materials for pedicures and manicures, such as nail polish and nail polish remover.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of “polboron” and peanuts and nail polish and nail polish remover.

loans.name: Marie Dee

texts.en:
For the past 2 years, Marie Dee's source of income is by raising hogs.
She is married and has two young children. Her husband is a government employee.
Together with her family, she lives in the rural town of Maribojoc, Bohol.


She would like to improve the number of livestock. But, at the moment, she has out of budget. Marie Dee join CEVI to cater her financial need.

She has requested a loan to buy feed and piglets. In that way, these will help provide adequate supply of animal feed and raise quality hogs. 

For the future, Marie Dee is excited to continue improve her hog raising livelihood for the welfare of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglets

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a 48-year-old married woman with one child in school. Imelda works very hard to provide for them.

Imelda has run a general store for 10 years and requests 25,000 PHP through NWTF to buy canned goods, beverages, home care, products, and groceries.

In the future, Imelda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages, home  care products, and groceries.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 45 years old and has one child in school. She has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Gina has requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as meat and bamboo sticks, etc. Gina has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as meat and bamboo sticks, etc.

loans.name: Mak's Group

texts.en: The members of Mak’s group live in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Mak works as a musician, and she also does extra work as a factory laborer to support her family. In her village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help these group members to safeguard the health of their families, to save money on medical expenses, and to save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: San's Group

texts.en: The members of San’s group live in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. San works as a seller, and he also does extra work as a factory laborer and construction worker to support his family. In his village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help these group members safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Mylen

texts.en:
Mylen is a 40-year-old married woman with five children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Mylen has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. She requested a 12000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials needed in her business.

Mylen has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is 44 years old woman, she lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her 3 children. Naseem is providing sewing services and earn the income to contribute with her husband to manage the household.

She needs different kinds of goods e.g needles, threads, pieces of cloth, machine oil etc for her business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore she has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these above accessories and also helpful for her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.
Naseem is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her tailoring business.

loans.name: Thorn's Group

texts.en: The members of Thorn’s group live in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Thorn makes a living cultivating rice, and he also does extra work as a tailor to support his family. In his village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help both of these men safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Ly's Group

texts.en: The members of Ly’s group live in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Ly makes a living cultivating rice, and he also does extra work as a farm laborer to support his family. In his village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help these group members safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Yek's Group

texts.en:
Yek’s group live in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Yek makes a living cultivating rice and also does extra work as a seller by selling construction equipment to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Noy's Group

texts.en:
Noy’s group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Noy makes a living cultivating rice and also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Koun's Group

texts.en:
Koun’s group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Koun makes a living cultivating rice and also does extra work as factory laborer and security guard to support his family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Saory's Group

texts.en:
Saory and the other members of her group live in a rural village in the province of Phnom Penh in Cambodia. Saory makes a living cultivating rice. She also performs extra work as a farm laborer and a factory worker to supplement her income in order to support her family.

In Saory's village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time previously spent collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Aruuke

texts.en:
Aruuke is a freshman in the International and Comparative Politics Program at AUCA. She is applying for AUCA’s financial aid and Kiva loan to cover the part of her university tuition fee as her family has financial difficulties.
Aruuke’s family has 4 members: her father, her mother, brother and herself. As the majority of Asian people, her parents work at local market/bazaar. They have to wake up at 4-5 am in the morning and work till 5-6 pm until the market closes. Aruuke says that her family’s income was always enough to feed its members, but the last economic crisis has made it worse. After Kyrgyzstan’s entrance into the Customs Union and the Eurasian Economic Union, the rise in customs tariffs in neighbouring Kazakhstan cut the volume of imports from Kyrgyzstan to Customs Union countries. And so Kyrgyzstan was left with a choice: either continue re-exporting goods to Kazakhstan and Russia (in smaller quantities and with less profit) or join the economic alliance and try to increase domestic production. The government chose the second option.
Aruuke says that the happening changes in the country’s political and economic system is very interesting to discover and make a research for her, as she is the future politician. But the given circumstances cause a problem with her university tuition payment.

Choosing the right university is as important for her as choosing the future profession. First when Aruuke’s parents heared the amount of her payment, they disagreed with her. Having learnt about AUCA’s financial aid and Kiva loan, they gained relief and found a solution to help their daughter. Aruuke is happy to join the Kiva community and thanks all its members.

loans.use: to pay for her higher education in the International Comparative Projects Program at AUCA.

loans.name: Em's Group

texts.en: Em’s group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Em works as a policeman and she also does extra work as a factory laborer and security to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sary's Group

texts.en:
Sary and the other members of her group live in a rural village in the province of Phnom Penh. Sary works as a seller, but she also performs extra work as a factory laborer and a motor driver in order to support her family.

In Sary's village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these borrowers to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time previously spent collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Nyam-Osor

texts.en:
Mr. Nyam-osor, 27 years old, lives with his father, mother and brother in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as a welder since 2011. His brother studies at the university. Using his previous loan, he has purchased a computer for his brother, who has lots of homework to do with the computer.

Now he is requesting a loan of 1600 USD to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam for house renovation. By doing so, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned for heating, releasing less pollutant into air.

loans.use: to renovate his house in order to burn less coal

loans.name: Marziya

texts.en:
Marziya is 65 years old, married, and has four children. She is kind and hardworking woman from North Tajikistan. Her husband is a pensioner. Marziya has a great experience in sewing because she has learned to sew when she was young. She operates a sewing business, which she has been doing for more than 19 years. She sews women's clothes and national dresses and has a workshop in her house. Her clients are glad for her service. 

Marziya now needs financial support because she and her husband are ill. She requested a loan for 7,000 TJS, which she will use to buy medicines for herself and her husband.

loans.use: to purchase medicines for herself and her husband

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 21 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica desde hace 3 años a la venta de ropa nueva y de segunda mano, su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas variedad de ropa por mayor para continuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: The young woman whose face has been blurred in the photo is 21 years old. She lives in a dangerous area. For the last three years she has made a living by selling new and second hand clothing. She runs her business from home and has many customers. The income she earns allows her to meet household expenses. She has applied for a loan to buy a variety of clothing wholesale so that she can continue to sell and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing wholesale.

loans.name: Rafael Orlando

texts.es: Rafael de 53 años de edad se dedica desde hace varios años a la agricultura siembra maíz y tambien a la crianza de ganado, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, vive con su compañera de vida en casa propia, el cliente está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Rafael, 53, has been working in agriculture for several years; he plants corn and also raises livestock. He sells his products in the various markets close to his home. He lives with his life partner in his own house. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of seeds, fertilizers, manure, pest control, etc. and to improve the land shown in the photograph, in order to be able to continue with his work and have higher income.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, pest control, etc. and improve the land.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Selling of imported clothes was Jane source of income. She is 49 years old, married and has five children. Her husband is a farmer, while Jane is selling variety of clothes, and bags in the market. Their revenues from their respective businesses is use to meet their daily foods, and needs. Most of their income generated income went for the education of their children. Jane needs to sell more items in able to earn greater income. Thus, she is requesting a loan of P30,000 to buy clothes to sell. Jane hope to expand the business and further acquire their needs.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Camila

texts.en:
Camila, age 47, raises pigs to earn her living. She has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She and her husband have four children, three of whom are are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Camila requested a loan in the amount of PhP 15,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

In the future, Camila would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Tha's Group

texts.en:
Tha and the other members of her group live in a rural village in the province of Phnom Penh. Tha works as a seller, but she also performs extra work as a factory laborer in order to support her family.

In Tha's village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time previously spent collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Mayda Rosa

texts.es: Mayda de 51 años, reside en compañía de su cónyuge en Galapa un municipio del Atlántico, ella inició su negocio para poderlo ayudar con los gastos en el hogar, ellos son padres de dos hijos, de los cuales aún uno de ellos es menor de edad y se encuentra cursando estudios académicos. Su idea de negocio surgió al observar que en su pueblo no había panadería, así que decidió comprar panes, queso, leche, suero y carnes frías, todo lo requerido para un desayuno tradicional en esta región.  Diariamente comercializa a sus vecinos estos productos a primera hora de la mañana 4 a.m. hasta las 8 p.m. y para continuar en su negocio sin inconvenientes, realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar surtido de panes, queso, leche, suero y embutidos.  Mayda sueña con tener una panadería y comprar una casa propia.
texts.en: 51-year-old Mayda lives with her husband in Galapa, town in the Atlántico department. She set up her business to help her husband cover the household expenses. They have two children, one of whom is still a child and at school. She got the idea of setting up a business when she noticed that there was no bakery in her town and so she decided to buy bread, cheese, milk, whey and cold meats - all the ingredients for a traditional breakfast in this region. She sells her products to her neighbours, working daily from 4 am to 8 pm and, to avoid problems in her business, she applied for a Kiva loan. This gave her the opportunity to get involved in the world of finance through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and to be able to buy various types of bread, cheese, milk, whey and sausages. Mayda's dream is to run a bakery and buy her own home.

loans.use: to buy various types of bread, cheese, milk, whey and sausages

loans.name: Santiago Felipe

texts.es:
Santiago es un hombre trabajador, que ama la vida en el campo, desde muy pequeño aprendió el oficio de ser labrador de tierra y sembrador de maíz y frijoles los principales productos de su pueblo. Es padre de tres niños, junto con su esposa poseen sus propias tierras, las cuales él se encarga de aprovechar al máximo sembrando maíz. 
En estos momentos Santiago ha recurrido a la ayuda de kiva junto a MiCrédito solicitando se le otorgue un préstamo que le permita sacar adelante una siembra de maíz, para luego cosecharlo y venderlo en el mercado de la ciudad más cercana. El ocupara el financiamiento para comprar abono, urea, pesticidas, refrescantes de tierra y pagar mano de obra. En un futuro desea mejorar la infraestructura de su casa e incursionar en el negocio de la ganadería.
texts.en:
Santiago is a hard-working man who loves life in the fields. At a very early age he learned to work the soil and grow corn and beans, the main products of his town.

He is the father of three children. He and his wife own their own land, and he uses it to maximum advantage by growing corn.

Currently Santiago has sought help from Kiva and MiCrédito, requesting that they grant him a loan to help with planting corn for eventual harvest and sale in the nearest city's market. He will use the loan to buy fertilizer, urea, pesticides and soil revitalizers, and to pay for labor. In the future he hopes to improve his home's infrastructure and get into the livestock business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, urea, pesticides and soil revitalizer, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Sadia

texts.en:
Sadia is 37 years old woman, and mother of four children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her son is fruit seller by profession. Her son is only responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household.

Sadia's son needs to purchase different types of fruit for reselling purpose so that he can increase the size of business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to unfavorable financial position her son is not in condition to purchase fruits for his business purpose.
Therefore Sadia has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her son to purchase the above items.
She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruits for her son to increase his business.

loans.name: Yin's Group

texts.en: Yin’s group live in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Yin makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as factory laborer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these woman and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Bombo S. School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Ibrahim. He is the Deputy Head teacher of Bombo Secondary School, a mixed school in the Urban area of Luwero with 1000 students. Bombo Secondary School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Bombo Secondary School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Ibrahim ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Ravil

texts.en: Ravil is 21 years old, single and lives with his parents and sister. His family has been IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from Fuzuli city and now lives in the Bala Bahmanli of the Fuzuli region. Ravil’s mother is a housewife, his father is a taxi driver and his sister is a student. Ravil has been in the butcher shop business for two years. He wants to buy a new fridge for his butcher shop. He needs his first loan in the amount of 1800 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). Ravil wants to get married and to have his own family in the future.

loans.use: to buy a new fridge for his butcher shop

loans.name: Fuerza 2008 Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “FUERZA 2008” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. 
La socia Rosa sigue  dedicándose al negocio de restaurante, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y responsable que espera mediante su negocio poder obtener mas ganancias para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia, la socia continua preparando diferentes tipos de comida como arroz con pollo, saltados entre otros para todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de aceite, arroz, carnes entre otros.
Las socias que salen adjuntas a  la foto pidieron  permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
Los socios en general agradecen el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: The members all belong to the "FUERZA 2008” communal bank run by Asociación Arariwa in the city of El Cusco. Rosa, the featured member, is still running her restaurant business. She is am enterprising and responsible woman who wants to use her business as a means of improving her income and supporting her family. She still prepares different types of food such as rice with chicken, stir-fries etc. for customers who order them. She wants to be able to continue doing this so that she can continue to support her family. She is applying for the loan to buy oil, rice, meat, etc. The members who are not in the main photo asked permission to arrive at the meeting late for work reasons. All the members are grateful for the loans they are granted and promise to repay them all back in full.

loans.use: to buy oil, rice, meat, etc.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es: Reynaldo de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos, el se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de queso, crema y requeson desde hace 11 años, vende de manera ambulante por las diferentes colonias que estan cerca de su casa, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de leche por mayor para elaborar los productos lacteos y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Reynaldo is 36 years old and lives in his own house with his life partner and their two children.  For 11 years he has made a living by making and selling cheese, cream, and cottage cheese.  He sells as a street vendor throughout the different colonies that are near his home.  With the profits he earns, he manages to cover some of the household expenses.  He is soliciting a loan in order to buy wholesale milk so that he can make the dairy products and thus have better economic income.

loans.use: to buy wholesale milk.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a hardworking, 53-year-old woman who earns a living making charcoal. She has seven children and three of them are still attending school. She hails from the town of Cortes, Bohol. For the past ten years now, she has been engaged in making charcoal. She faces challenges in expanding her livelihood. First, she has very limited capital and second, the seasonality of charcoal trade.
