She has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner Cevi, to access loans and to rebuild her project. Nenita would like to invest in more coconut shells. In that way, more materials will be acquired to produce maximum output. She can continue to support the schooling of her children and provide nutritious meals, too. Thus, she could slowly pay her obligation and start to invest in other sources of income to become more productive.

loans.use: to invest in more coconut shells.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 40 year old green grocer at Mombasa Kenya. She is a mother of four who has been on operation for the last two years earning a  good income, and the spouse supports her business

This is her first borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance her business, she will use the loan to purchase tomatoes, green bananas ,cabbages, kale and fruits in her food stall.

With the anticipated profit, Margaret will be able to repay her loan and expand her current business.

Her hopes and dream for the future is to have a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, green bananas, cabbages, kale and fruit for her food stall.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 42 years old and one of her children is in school. She has a flower vending business in the Philippines.

Jocelyn has requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stock of flowers to sell. Jocelyn has been in this business for nine years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of flowers to sell.

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en:
Rizalina is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rizalina is 56 years old and one of children is in school.

Rizalina has a general store business in the Philippines. Rizalina requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like bread, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Rizalina has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Rizalina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like bread, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Nelita

texts.en:
Nelita is 49 years old and married with four children. With two children in school, Nelita works very hard to provide for them.

Nelita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Nelita has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Nelita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima is 49 years old, married, and has four children, one of whom is still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Zosima has a business where she buys and sells mineral water in the Philippines. She requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock of mineral water to sell.

Zosima has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Zosima would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of mineral water to sell.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mary Ann is 32 years old and has two children who are in school.

Mary Ann has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, home care products and other groceries.

Mary Ann has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
Rosalyn is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosalyn is 37 years old and has five children who are in school.

Rosalyn has a abaca weaving business in the Philippines. Rosalyn requested a PHP 19500 loan amount through NWTF to buy abaca fiber and other materials needed in her business.

Rosalyn has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Rosalyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy abaca fiber and other materials needed in her business

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is a hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He used his previous loan to buy manure and fertilizer for his farm. He still carries out farming as his main business alongside livestock that helps him earn an extra income. He has been operating these two businesses for over fifteen years and he works throughout the week given the nature of his business. Though he has responsibilities of educating his children and providing for his family, he also wants to at least grow his businesses so as to serve his multipurpose intentions but he faces problems of inadequate capital and seasonal customers.

Benard requests for a loan to buy mulch for his banana plantation and pay workers.

loans.use: to buy mulch for his banana plantation and pay workers.  .

loans.name: Somoul's Group

texts.en: Somoul’s group live in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Somoul does work as seller to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

Channy and the other members of her group live in a rural village in the province of Phnom Penh. Channy works as a factory laborer and a construction worker, and she also performs extra work as a seller in order to support her family.

In Channy's village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time previously spent collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

Saren makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a factory laborer to support her family. In her village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help both of these women safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

texts.en: Sarun’s group live in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Sarun works as a farmer and she also does extra work as a factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

Roenu’s Group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Roenu works as a farmer and she also does extra work as a factory laborer to support her family.

Ran’s Group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Ran works as a farmer and she also does extra work as a factory laborer to support her family.

loans.name: Vanvich's Group

texts.en: The members of Vanvich’s group live in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Vanvich works as a policeman, and he also does extra work as a factory laborer to support his family. In his village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help both group members safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Sim's Group

texts.en: The members of Sim’s group live in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Sim makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a factory laborer to support her family. In her village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help both group members safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Dilnoza

texts.en:
Dilnoza is young and a hardworking woman. She is married and has a child. She lives with her family in a village and she has been busy, as are many local people, with animal husbandry. Since her childhood, Dilnoza has helped her parents with feeding cows and sheep, so she has some experience in this field. Her experience helps her to develop her business.

Dilnoza has been busy with animal husbandry more than three years. Her husband helps her with managing the business.

Dilnoza is ill now and she must to treat herself. Dilnoza is asking for a loan of 7,000 Somoni to buy medicines for treatment. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy medicines for treatment

loans.name: Rogelio De Los Angeles

texts.es: Rogelio de 57 años de edad se dedica desde hace 15 años a la agricultura siembra maíz y hortalizas, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, vive con sus tres hijos en casa propia, el cliente está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: 57-year-old Rogelio has worked in agriculture for 15 years. He grows corn and vegetables and sells his produce in the various  close to his home. He lives in his own home with his three children. Rogelio is applying for a loan to buy seeds, fertiliser, manure, pesticide, etc. and to improve his plot of land (shown in the photo) so he continue his work and boost his income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertiliser, manure, pesticides, etc. and to improve his plot of land

loans.name: Señor De Huanca De Cusco Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE HUANCA DE CUSCO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Marcia es una trabajadora muy empeñosa, ella tiene 48 años  y hace muchos años se dedica a  la venta de Zapatos traídos desde la capital, la socia saca adelante a su familia y su deseo es tener una mejor calidad de vida.
La socia solicito el préstamo para comprar Zapatos,ya que necesita incrementar su capital de trabajo por temporada.


Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de frazadas, negocio de crianza de animales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.

Los socios agradecen el préstamo dado y se comprometen a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas asignadas.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank “SEÑOR DE HUANCA DE CUSCO”; this bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

Marcia is a very earnest worker, she is 48 years old and for many years she has been selling shoes brought from the capital. She supports her family and her desire is to have a better quality of life. She requested the loan to buy shoes, because she needs to increase her seasonal working capital.

The other members work selling blankets, raising animals, running a grocery store, and selling food. The members are grateful for the loan given and promise to make the assigned payments punctually.

loans.use: buy shoes.

loans.name: Orencio

texts.en:
Orencio is a vegetable farmer. He grows beans, okra, eggplant and other green leafy vegetables. He is a 53-year-old married man and has five children. His youngest child is 18 and still attending school. Together with his family, he lives in the town of Cortes, Bohol.

He asking for a loan from CEVI to purchase fertilizers and vegetable seedlings. In this way he hopes to improve his financial income. He could able to boost his farm and produce a bountiful harvest.

With his previous loan, Orencio managed to invest farm maintenance, for which he is very grateful.

For the future, he aims to become a successful business man.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and vegetable  seedlings

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is 31 years old poultry farmer at Kisumu. She is a mother of one whose spouse provides with additional income. For the last two years she has been in the beauty parlor business and doing well.

This is her first loan from VisionFund Kenya to purchase more salon products especially relaxers, hair conditioner, hair oil and shampoo.

With the anticipated profit she will be able to repay her loan.

She hopes to own a successful business in future.

loans.use: to purchase more salon products especially relaxers, hair conditioner,hair oil and shampoo

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a 36-year-old hardworking married man with three children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He used his previous loan to buy more general merchandise, like crates of soda, sugar, salt, soap and other things to sell during the Easter season. He was so grateful for the support that enabled him make good profits. Two of his children attend school, and it is what makes him the happiest.

He still operates a retail shop to earn income, though he also earns additional income from agriculture, especially the growing of coffee.

In the future, Paul hopes to be self sufficient and educate all his children, although he is limited by inadequacy in his business.

He is requesting for a loan to buy more sugar, salt and bread to sell.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, salt and bread to sell.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 38 years old and single, Rosita works very hard to provide for her daily needs.

Rosita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home product care, and other groceries.

Rosita has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Rosita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 54 years old and married with seven children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Mercedita is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Mercedita has been in this business for 20 years and also earns additional income from a general store. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Chi's Group

texts.en: Chi’s group live in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Chi does work as a teacher and officer and  she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Rim's Group

texts.en: The members of Rim’s group live in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Rim works as a farmer, and he also does extra work as a factory laborer to support his family. In his village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help these group members safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 35-year-old mother of one whose spouse provides additional income.

She sells secondhand pairs of shoes at Kisumu, a business she has done for the last two years and it has been doing well.

This is her first borrowing from VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to purchase more secondhand pairs of shoes.

With the anticipated profit, Jane will be able to repay her loan.

She hopes to prosper in business more.

loans.use: to purchase more secondhand pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Sokeng's Group

texts.en:
Sokeng’s group live in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Sokeng makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a factory laborer and a seller to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Olimpia Roxana

texts.es:
Olimpia, de 19 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañada, su pareja es albañil y trabaja en construcciones, actualmente no tienen hijos, ellos viven con sus suegros.

Olimpia, se dedica a los oficios domésticos, pero aparte de eso también se dedica a la crianza de pollos junto a su pareja, pues es otra actividad que realizan juntos para generar ingresos económicos para cubrir sus necesidades.

Olimpia, necesita el préstamo para comprar maya metálica para encerrar a los pollos y protegerlos, también comprar 100 pollitos y alimento concentrado; pues quiere tener una buena producción.

Olimpia, sueña con seguir estudiando y terminar su carrera universitaria y casarse por la iglesia y tener hijos.
texts.en:
Olimpia, 19, attended school until the ninth grade. Her partner is a brick layer and works in construction. They do not have children, and live with his parents.

Olimpia does housework, and aside from that she also raises chickens with her partner, as it is another activity they do together to generate income to cover their expenses.

Olimpia needs the loan to purchase wire mesh to enclose and protect their chickens, and to purchase 100 baby chicks and concentrated chicken feed, since she wants to have a good production.

Olimpia dreams of going to school and earning a college degree, getting married in the church and having children.

loans.use: to buy wire mesh to enclose and protect her chickens, and to buy 100 chicks and chickenfeed.

loans.name: Mai's Group

texts.en:
Mai’s group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Mai does work as a factory laborer, and she also does extra work as a business woman to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Dina's Group

texts.en:
Dina’s group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Dina makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a factory laborer and driver to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Masyoro Voc. School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Denis. He is the Head teacher of Masyoro Voc School, a mixed school in the rural area of Sheema with 450 students. Masyoro Voc School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent, clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children.

Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term, as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450-litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Masyoro Voc School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Denis ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases, as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Darun

texts.en:
Darun is 22-year-old, single man from Kandal Province, Cambodia. He is a security guard and works in MFI in the province. Darun is pursuing a bachelor’s degree at a university in the city, majoring in Finance and Banking.

Darun has decided to take out a loan because he is short of the money needed to cover his university fees for the third year. With this loan, he will be able to cover his university fees and earn a bachelor’s degree.

After graduation, Darun dreams of having a better job with a reasonable salary and he also wants to save money to build his own house.

loans.use: to cover his university fees for the third year.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of five children, Marivic works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Marivic is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients such as vegetables, fish, meat, etc. for her food vending business.

Marivic has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as vegetables, fish, meat, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Lilia

texts.en:
Ma. Lilia is a 54-year-old married woman with four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Ma. Lilia has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business, such as meat, spices, chicken, etc.

Ma. Lilia has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Ma. Lilia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-vending business, such as meat, spices, chicken, etc.

loans.name: Twekambe Paacwa Group

texts.en:
Evas, whose hand is raised, is a member of Twekambe Paacwa Group, where members guarantee one another for a loan. She is an energetic young woman aged 27, married with two children who all live in Kagadi, Uganda.

She majorly deals in a mobile money business, having started with an intention of generating income for the family. She has worked for 12 hours a day throughout the week since 2012. Her desire is to have a money detector to prevent her from getting fake notes since she has suffered loss as her family dream is to educate her children to university. Evas also complains of theft and high license fees.

She is now looking for credit to buy an oxford cow for milk production.

loans.use: to buy an oxford cow for milk production.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 42 years old and has four children who attend school. She works very hard to provide for them. Lourdes operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for five years.

Lourdes requested a loan from NWTF for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional items to sell such as eggs, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell such as eggs, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Florinda

texts.en:
Florinda is 52 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Florinda has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from food vending. Florinda aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a hardworking married father. He lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. He runs a butchery in addition to farming, businesses which he started six years ago with the intention of growing his earnings and taking good care of his family.

In the future, William wants to expand his butchery business so as to realize more profits and educate his children but he faces challenges of inadequate capital to meet the increasing demand and a high rate of competition. This limits his stock turnover and the productivity of his business.

William seeks financial support in the form of a loan to buy more goats to slaughter.

loans.use: to buy more goats to slaughter.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He used his previous loan to buy more cows to add to his farm. He still deals in cattle-fattening as a main source of income and livelihood, though he supplements this income with proceeds from gardening.

He is active and works all days of the week with an aim of doing the best to get money to pay school fees for his children. In the future, Godfrey plans to expand his farm, modernize his gardens and increase on household income, though he is challenged by inadequate capital.

He is requesting a loan to buy more cows to add to his farm.

loans.use: to buy more cows to add to his farm.

loans.name: Samoul's Group

texts.en:
Samoul’s group lives in a rural village in the Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Samoul makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a factory laborer to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of the group members to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Grace School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Divina. She is the Director of Grace Primary School, a mixed school in the Urban area of Kiteezi in Wakiso with 350 students. Grace Primary School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Grace Primary School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Divina ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Narcizo Obispo

texts.es:
Narciso es un agricultor especializado en la producción de café de alta calidad, a sus 38 años de edad tiene más de 17 años de experiencia en la producción de café y más de 5 años en la preparación de cafés especiales que comercializa directamente con sus compradores con el apoyo de COCAFCAL de la cual es socio, Narciso es Padre de 2 hijos, la principal meta de Narciso es poder darles a sus hijos una vida digna y que puedan aprender a trabajar el café de la mejor manera posible para que produzcan calidad en armonía con el ambiente.
Narciso es muy amigo de la calidad por lo que tiene certificado su cafetal como: Comercio Justo, orgánico y UTZ, además para mejorar la calidad del café lo prepara en secadoras solares, el preparado del café en secadoras solares acentúa los sabores y aromas del grano además de homogenizar su humedad para hacer más lento el proceso de degradación en bodega razón por la cual este café es muy preferido por muchos compradores.
Narciso solicita un crédito para construir una secadora solar el crédito le ayudara a comprar los materiales tales como: Nylon, zarandas, clavos entre otros.
El crédito ayudara a Narciso a continuar preparando su café en las más óptimas condiciones posibles lo que le permite optar a mejores mercados para su producción de café, con las ganancias obtenidas por el café Narciso quiere mejorar sus condiciones de vida e invertir para preparar mejor café y hacer sus fincas más amigables con el ambiente.
texts.en: 38-year-old Narciso is a farmer who specialises in the production of high quality coffee. He has 17 years' experience of coffee production and over 5 years' experience in producing special coffees which, with the support of COCAFCAL of which he is a member, he sells direct to his buyers. Narciso is the father of two children and his main aim is to give them a decent life and teach them to grow coffee in the best way possible so that they can produce quality in an environmentally friendly way. Narciso is known for the quality of his products as his coffee plantation holds Fair Trade, Organic and UTZ certification. To improve the quality of his coffee even further, he prepares it in solar-powered dryers. This increases the beans' flavours and aroma and maintains a constant level of humidity which slows down the rate at which it deteriorates in the warehouse. It is for this reason that many buyers prefer his coffee. Narciso is applying for a loan to build a solar-powered dryer. The money will help him to buy materials such as: Nylon, sieves, nails, etc. The loan will enable Narciso to continue producing his coffee in the best possible conditions which will allow him to choose the best markets for his coffee. Narciso wants to use this income from his coffee to improve his living conditions and make investments to help him produce better coffee and make his plantations more environmentally friendly.

loans.use: to buy nylon, sieves, nails, wood and other materials he needs to build a solar-powered dryer for his certified coffee.

loans.name: Lhat's Group

texts.en:
Lhat’s Group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh province, in Cambodia.

To support her family, Lhat makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a factory laborer.

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean, drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these members to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Siguitimogosson Group

texts.fr:
Mariam est la femme qui qui as sa main sur le bélier sur la photo. Elle est membre du groupe siguitèmogosson constitué en majorité des femmes,  mariée, âgée de 45 ans mère de 4 enfants dont 3 enfants scolarisés âgés de 09 à 16 ans. Son mari fait l’agriculture. Mariam a une expérience de 5ans dans l'activité d'élevage de mouton elle s’approvisionne dans le marché de DIN (Burkina Faso).
Mariam sollicite  un  prêt auprès du RMCR après avoir bien remboursement le prêt précédent  pour acheter plus de  moutons et d’aliments bétail afin de les engraissés et les revendre  dans le but d’augmenter ses revenus mensuels estimés à 10000 fca. Cela va l’aider a payé les frais de scolarité, santé et habillement de ses enfants. Elle souhaite développer son activité  et gagner beaucoup de bénéfices  afin de bien préparer l’avenir des enfants.
texts.en:
Mariam is the woman with her hand on the ram in the photograph. She is a member of the Siguitèmogosson Group made up mostly of women. She is the married, 45-year-old mother of four children between 9 and 16 years old, three of whom are in school. Her husband is a farmer. Mariam has five years of experience in raising sheep that she purchases at the DIN Market (Burkina Faso).

Mariam is asking for a loan from RMCR, after having paid back the previous loan, to buy more sheep and livestock medicine in order to fatten them and resell them. Her goal is to increase her estimated monthly revenue to 10,000 francs. This will help her pay her children's school fees, health and clothing expenses. She would like to increase her business and make a large profit in order to prepare for her children's future.

loans.use: to buy less expensive sheep to raise and then resell after eight months.

loans.name: Khern's Group

texts.en:
The two members of Khernn’s Group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Khern makes a living cultivating rice. He earns extra income as a factory laborer to support his family. 

In the village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each group member to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to purchase a water filter to provide safe drinking water for the family.

loans.name: Kyeibare Girls

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Benon. He is the Deputy Head teacher of Kyeibare Girls School, a girls school in the rural area of Mitoma in Sheema with 400 students. Kyeibare Girls School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent, clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children.

Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term, as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450-litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Kyeibare Girls School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Benon ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases, as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Saly's Group

texts.en: Saly’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Saly makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as factory laborer and driver to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Hatunchaskas Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “HATUNCHASKAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

la socia Lucila tiene 59 años de edad y tres hijos, ella se dedica a su negocio de tienda de aratesania, gracias a aesta labor saco adelante a sus hijos, por ello sus sueños es seguir ampliando su negocio que le permita abrir mas mercados para sus productos. 
la socia solicito el préstamo para comprar chullos y ponchos. 

Los socia que estan pegados a la foto grupal se le tomo la foto después de la reunión porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de artículos deportivos, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes , negocio de carpintería y brindar servicios de turísticos.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The partners belong to the community bank “Hatunchaskas”; this bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco in the department of Cusco.

Lucila is 59 years old and has three children; she has a crafts store. Thanks to this work she raised her children. Therefore her dream is to continue expanding her business that it may allow her to open more markets for her products. Lucila requested a loan to buy chullos [Peruvian style winter hats] and ponchos.

The partners whose photos are attached to the group photo had their pictures taken after the meeting because of work reasons. The other partners work in sporting goods sales, clothing sales, grocery store, carpentry, and tourist services.

The partner is grateful to those who are part of this dream through this medium and promises to make her loan payments within the established timeline.

loans.use: buy chullos [Peruvian style winter hats] and ponchos.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 26 años edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la crianza de ganado y al cultivo de granos basicos se dedica desde hace 8 años, y comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados q se encuentran cerca de su casa, el joven vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de una novilla para repasto y asi poder continuar con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: The young man whose face is pixelated is 26 years old and lives in a high risk area.  For eight years he has made a living raising livestock and growing basic grains, and he sells his products in the different markets that are near his home.  The young man lives in his own house with his two children.  He is soliciting a loan in order to buy a heifer for grazing, and thus be able to continue his work so that he can get better economic income.

loans.use: to buy a heifer for grazing.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a 62-year-old married woman with three grown children. She lives in the town of Cortes, Bohol. Ten years ago, she started producing charcoal to cover the needs and expenses of her home. Her work is done late in the afternoon. She prepares the materials like coconut shells put inside a drum or an empty container, then burns it slowly and covers it with banana leaves to prevent rain, dew or moisture from being absorbed.

She has requested a loan to purchase more coconut shells. In that way, she could improve her profitability. She could also start to settle her obligations and manage her finances wisely. She could now set aside some of the profit for future use, and the other for business expansion.

She is determined that she will be handling her business properly for sustainable living.

loans.use: to purchase more coconut shells

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Lilian is 25 years old, married, and has six children. Her spouse provides additional income for the family. Lilian sells cereals as well as poultry at Kisumu, which she has been doing for two years. Her business is profitable.

Lilian requested her first loan from VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to buy additional stock of cereals such as maize, beans, lentils, and rice. She will use the anticipated profits to purchase feeds for her poultry as well as repay her loan. She hopes to live a successful life.

loans.use: to purchase  additional stock of cereals such as maize, beans, lentils, and rice.

loans.name: Azubed

texts.en:
Azubed is married with one child. He operates a retail shop and also sells phone accessories. This helps him to boost his family's welfare. He is doing well, though faces the challenge of competition.

Azubed wants to manage this competition by adding foodstuffs like maize and cassava flour to his inventory so as to be in the same class as his competitors. He requests money to buy the above items to improve his stock so that he will be able to win more customers.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs like maize and cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a hardworking married man and devoted father who lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. He used his previous loan to buy more salt, sugar, soap and other general merchandise to sell. He runs a retail shop which is always open throughout the week.

He supplements his retail shop with livestock farming to earn extra income and have an enhanced standard of living for his family. His dream is to move to a wholesale standard so as to earn more profits in order to educate all his children and equip them with skills that can also help them earn a living and income to sustain themselves. His main challenge is inadequate capital.

He wishes to use the loan facility to buy more soap, salt, sugar and soda to sell.

loans.use: to buy more soap, salt, sugar and soda to sell.

loans.name: William Armidio

texts.es:
Williams, de 21 años de edad, estudio ingeniería agronómica, está soltero, ahora trabaja en la siembra de hortalizas, vive con sus padres y sus hermanos que trabajan juntos para satisfacer todas las necesidades del hogar.

William, tiene dos años de experiencia sembrando hortalizas, principalmente cultiva loroco, la mayor parte de los conocimientos que tiene de la agricultura, los adquirió gracias a su padre; antes sembraba tomates, chiles verdes, pipianes, ejotes gûisquiles, entre otros, la parcela donde cultiva está a 150 metros de su casa y le ayudan sus hermanos y sus padres porque son una familia muy unida. 

William, necesita el préstamo para comprar abono para sus cultivos y para comprar una porción más de tierra para sembrar.

Los sueños de William son, que su cultivos sean más productivos, tener su propia vivienda y obtener un trabajo donde pueda ejercer su profesión de agronómo.
texts.en:
William is 21 years old and studied Agricultural Engineering. He is single and now works growing vegetables. He lives with his parents and siblings, and they all work together in order to support their household.

William has two years of experience growing vegetables. He mostly grows loroco. He learned most of what he knows about farming from his father. He used to grow tomatoes, green chiles, and different varieties of squash. The plot of land that he farms is 150 meters from his home, and his parents and siblings all help him, because they are a very close family.

William needs this loan to buy fertilizer for his crops as well as another plot of land to farm.

William's dreams are to make his crops more productive, to have his own home, and to get a job in his field and work as an agricultural engineer.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his crops and another plot of land.

loans.name: Tha's Group

texts.en:
Tha’s group lives in a rural village in the Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Tha makes a living cultivating rice, and he also does extra work as farm laborer to support his family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these group members to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Yan's Group

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Fanta est la femme qui présente le bélier dans la photo courageuse et très sérieuse,elle est membre du groupement Benkadi constitué de femmes qui font l’élevage de moutons.Fanta est une malienne à Sodongara  âgés de 26 ans, elle y réside depuis sa naissance. Mariée à un cultivateur, Fanta est mère de 3 enfants âgés de 4 à 12 ans dont 01 scolarisé. Elle n’a jamais fréquenté l’école, depuis 5 ans elle fait l’élevage mouton pour se prendre en charge et d’apporter un soutien financier à son mari. Elle s’approvisionne au marché local de Koulogo et y effectue aussi ses ventes.
 Fanta est une ancienne cliente du RMCR qui a déjà obtenu une fois le crédit dans l’institution, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursé. Elle sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès du RMCR pour renforcer son activité, acheter plus de moutons  afin de se faire plus de revenus pour de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille précisément  les frais scolaires, les frais médicaux et l’habillement des enfants.
texts.en:
Fanta is the woman presenting the ram in the photograph. She is courageous and very serious. She is a member of the Benkadi Group, made up of women who raise sheep. Fanta is 26 years old from Sodongara, Mali where she has lived since birth. She is married to a farmer. Fanta has three children, ages 4-12, one of whom is in school. She never went to school. For the past five years she has raised sheep to take charge and support her husband with financial support. She purchases supplies at the local market in Koulogo, where she also makes her sales.

Fanta is an former client of RMCR who has already received a loan from the institution, credit which she paid back well. She is asking for a second loan from RMCR to strengthen her business, to buy more sheep in order to make more profit. She wants to meet her family's needs, specifically school fees, medical expenses, and clothing for her children.

loans.use: to raise sheep.

loans.name: Bun's Group

texts.en:
The three members of Bun’s Group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia.  Bun makes a living cultivating rice. She earns additional income as farm laborer to support her family. 

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to purchase a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their families.

loans.name: Mukuiisyo Self Help Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand is Rodah, a member of Mukuiisyo Self Help Group. She is 58 years old and blessed with five children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2012 and has benefited from enterprise and financial management trainings.

She operates a grocery and she is borrowing a Kiva loan to increase stock by buying more kales, cabbages, onions, potatoes and capsicum. This will increase her income, which will enable her to cater for the basic needs like foods, clothes and shelter. She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to add stock to her grocery store, hence more income to cater for the family's basic needs such as food, shelter and clothing.

loans.name: Dina's Group

texts.en: Dina’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Dina does work as a farmer, and he also does extra work as a farm laborer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help both this woman and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.en:
Lilian is a 26-year-old mother of one whose spouse provides additional income. She has been selling secondhand clothes for the last two years as her core business and it has been doing well.

This is her first borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance her business. She will use the loan to purchase more bales of clothes to sell.

With the anticipated profit, Lilian will be able to repay her loan. She hopes to have her business more successful in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more bales of clothes

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda is a married woman with one child in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 49 years old now.

Rosenda has a buy-and-sell personal product care business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like lotion, shampoo, etc.

Rosenda has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like lotion, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Darwin Alexis

texts.es:
Darwin con sus metas claras, los objetivos propuestos, ayudar siempre a su madre y estudiar para convertirse en un profesional, viene hoy este joven de tan solo 18 años de edad a solicitar tu apoyo para iniciar con su negocio de barbería.
El capital será destinado en la compra de: silla de barbería, tocador,, espejo, implementos y adecuación de la barbería.
texts.en:
Darwin has clear goals and defined objectives; he always helps his mother and is studying to become a professional. At only 18 years of age, he is asking for your support to initiate his barber shop business.

The loan will be used to buy a barber's chair, dressing table, mirror, implements and supplies for a barber's shop.

loans.use: to buy a barber's chair, dressing table, mirror, implements and supplies for a barber's shop.

loans.name: Phasei's Group

texts.en:
Phasei’s group lives in a rural village in the Kandal province in Cambodia. Phasei makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a factory laborer to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
As a parent of one child, Mary Ann works hard to support her family.She has a general store business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from retailing ready-to-wear clothing.

Mary Ann is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like beverages, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries for her general store business.

Mary Ann has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like beverages, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Yerng's Group

texts.en:
Yerng’s group lives in a rural village in the Kandal province of Cambodia. Yerng makes a living cultivating rice, and she does extra work as factory laborer to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of the group members to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Phally's Group

texts.en:
Phally’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia.

Phally does work as factory laborer and construction worker to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 26-year-old, single mother of one child. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013, so as to benefit from trainings, especially enterprise development and financial management.

Her economic activity is vegetable farming (e.g., kale, cabbages, and spinach). She also does casual jobs to supplement her income.

Mary is borrowing from Kiva to buy fertilizer and manure to boost her vegetable farming production. This will enable her to earn more income to cater to her basic needs.

Mary is grateful to Kiva and their lenders. She promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and manure to boost her vegetable farming production.

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Modibo est membre du  groupe djèkafo et c’est lui qui présente le mouton dans la photo.  Il est malien âgé de 44ans domicilié à Sodongara  sa femme est ménagère il a 6 enfants (2 Filles et 4 garçons) dont un scolarisé. Il réside à Sodongara  pendant  25 ans.
Modibo est un éleveur de mouton qui s’approvisionne dans un marché voisin de son village.
 Pour acheter plus de moutons  il a fait recours au RMCR afin d’augmenter ses achats de moutons et son revenu qui lui  permettra de se prendre en charge les depenses de sa famille. De nos jours Modibo e est un ancien client du RMCR, il a remboursé son crédit précèdent et il sollicite un autre crédit  pour augmenter son chiffre d'affaire dans le but d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille  et particulièrement  l’éducation et  la santé des ses enfants .
texts.en:
Modibo, touching the sheep in the photo, is a member of the group Djèfako. He is Malian, 44 years old and lives in Sodongara. His wife is a housekeeper and he has six children (two girls and four boys), of which one is in school. He has lived in Sodongara for 25 years.

Modibo is a sheep farmer and makes his purchases in a market close to his village. He will use the RMCR loan to purchase more sheep and increase his income, which will allow him to pay for his family’s expenses.

Modibo is a previous client of RMCR and repaid his previous loan. He is requesting another loan to increase his revenue with the goal of improving his family’s living conditions, in particular his children’s education and health.

loans.use: to purchase less-expensive sheep to raise them and resell them.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
El señor José Luis con una edad de 27 años, vive actualmente en la ciudad de Potosí, se dedica a la elaboración de productos en metal mecánica como ser tinglados, barandas, catres, etc. Esta actividad los adquirió al ser ayudante con soldadores profesionales. Ahora con el afán de mejorar sus ingresos y poder posicionarse en el mercado con el que cuenta actualmente y generar mayores ingresos para mantener a sus 2 pequeños hijos, el señor destinara el dinero en la elaboración de catres de metal los cuales expondrá en una feria departamental que le servirá como publicidad y para hacerse conocer y tener más demanda, así mismo el cliente indica que tiene pensado a futuro poder adquirir su propio terreno y poder así darles a sus hijos un mejor hogar. 

El Sr. José Luis para seguir desarrollándose económicamente solicita el préstamo para adquirir materiales de soldadura y participar de la feria y exponer sus productos en metal mecánica.
texts.en:
José Luis is 27 years old and currently lives in the city of Potosí. He works building metal structures like sheds, railings, bed frames, etc. He learned the business as a helper, working with professional welders.

In order create a better position for himself in the current market and improve his income so that he can support his two young children, he will use this money to build metal frames which he will exhibit at a regional fair. This will be good advertising for him, and allow him to become known and have more demand.

This borrower also says that his long-term goal is to buy his own land so that he can give his children a better home.

José Luis wants to continue advancing financially, and for this reason he will invest his loan in purchasing welding materials so that he can participate in the fair and exhibit his metal products.

loans.use: to buy welding materials.

loans.name: Santos Pastor

texts.es:
Santos, de 71 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador, solo estudio hasta cuarto grado, está casado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios del hogar, junto a ella tuvieron 9 hijos, pero solo 7 están vivos porque dos fallecieron debido a la guerra civil que sufrió el país, todos los demás ya se acompañaron pero viven cerca de su casa.

Santos, a sido agricultor toda su vida, él aprendió este oficio gracias a su padre, su jornada de trabajo inicia a las 5 de la mañana cuando se dirige a sus cultivos de maíz y frijol y regresa a las 12 del mediodía y por la tarde se dedica a cuidar un terreno en donde tiene un cafetal, en todos los trabajos que realiza es ayudado por sus hijos e hijas.

Santos, necesita el préstamo para cancelar el arrendamiento del terreno que utilizo para cultivar sus granos básicos y para pagar el arrendamiento de un vehículo que traslade los granos básicos.

Santos, sueña con poder seguir trabajando en la tierra y tener la fuerza necesaria para poder trabajar junto a sus nietos enseñándoles todo lo que él sabe de la agricultura.
texts.en:
Santos, who is 71, is a hardworking man. He only studied through the fourth grade. He is married and his wife is a homemaker. Together they had nine children, but only seven are alive today. Two were killed in the civil war that the country endured. All the rest are married but live near home.

Santos has been a farmer all his life. He learned the trade from his father. The work day begins at 5am when he tends to his crops of maize and kidney beans until noon. In the evening he takes care of the land where he has a coffee plantation. His children help him with all he does.

Santos needs to loan to pay rent for land that he uses to cultivate basic grains and to rent the vehicle he uses to transport the grains.

Santos dreams of being able to continue working the land and to have the fortitude necessary to be able to work next to his grandsons so that he can teach them everything he knows about agriculture.

loans.use: pay rent for land that he uses to cultivate basic grains and to rent the vehicle he uses to transport the grains.

loans.name: Bunthoeun's Group

texts.en:
Bunthoeun’s group lives in a rural village in the Kandal province in Cambodia. Bunthoeun makes a living cultivating rice, and he also does extra work as a factory laborer to support his family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help both group members to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

Oeurn makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: EL ES UN PADRE DE FAMILIA, RECIENTEMENTE QUEDO VIUDO,  UNA DE SUS HIJAS RECIÉN CASADA QUE ESTABA EN ESPERA DE SU PRIMER HIJO FUE DIAGNOSTICADA CON UN EMBARAZO ECTÓPICO, POR LO QUE TUVO QUE SER SUSPENDIDO, PUES SU VIDA  ESTABA EN RIESGO, ELLA PRESENTO FUERTES DOLORES EN LA PARTE BAJA DEL ABDOMEN POR LO QUE TUVO QUE SER SOMETIDA A UNA INTERVENCIÓN. DEBIDO A LA URGENCIA EL NO CUENTA CON LOS RECURSOS SUFICIENTES PARA SOLVENTAR EL GASTO.
texts.en: This borrower is a family man who was recently widowed.  One of his daughters was recently married and was expecting her first child.  However, she was diagnosed with an ectopic pregnancy, and so the pregnancy had to be terminated because her life was at risk.  Later, she had severe pain in the lower part of her abdomen, and so she had to undergo an emergency surgical procedure. He does not have sufficient resources to pay for the surgery.

loans.use: A loan of $575 helps this borrower to pay for surgery

loans.name: Chanthol's Group

texts.en:
Chanthol’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia.

Chanthol makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer and teacher to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of her family and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy thanks Kiva for her previous loan. She was able to buy quality fodder that enabled her to improve her milk production and meet her customers' demand.

Nancy is borrowing another Kiva loan to buy fertilizer and certified seeds so that she can increase her maize production. This will increase her income and enable her cater for her family’s upkeep and paying education fees.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and certified seeds.

loans.name: Ndeye

texts.fr:
Ce membre fait partie du banc villageois  qui a été crée le 27  décembre 2011. Il est composé de femmes qui sont très solidaires et très dynamiques, qui entretiennent de bonnes relations depuis des années et s’activent dans le petit commerce et l’embouche.
NDEYE sur la photo est la présidente du banc villageois depuis des années. Elle mène pleinement son rôle de présidente. Elle est âgée de 50 ans, mariée et mère 4 filles et 4 garçons. Elle s’active dans le commerce de produits agricoles.
Avec ce prêt, elle compte s’approvisionner dans un marché prés de sa localité. Elle compte acheter 10 barils d’arachides de 100 kilogrammes chacun, 5 barils de mil de 100 kilogrammes chacun. Elle compte acheter aussi des produits phytosanitaires pour la conservation des produits pour une valeur de 5 000 FCFA. Les produits sont stockés en attendant la hausse des prix sur le marché. 
Les bénéfices serviront à satisfaire les besoins familiaux (nourriture…), assurer la scolarité des enfants, rembourser son prêt et enfin  renforcer son épargne au niveau du banc villageois.
texts.en:
This member is part of a banc villageois that was established on December 27, 2011. It is made up of women who are very united and dynamic who have had good relationships for years and are active in small business and animal fattening.

Ndeye, in the photo, has been the president of the banc villageois for years. She excels in her role as president. She is 50 years old, married and the mother of four girls and four boys. She is active in agricultural trade.

With this loan, she plans to purchase supplies in a market close to her location. She plans to purchase 10 barrels of peanuts (100 kilograms each) and five barrels of millet (100 kilograms each). She also plans to purchase phytosanitary products to preserve her products for a value of 5,000 FCFA. The products are stored while waiting for the market prices to rise.

The profits will be used to cover family needs (food, etc.), to ensure her children go to school, to reimburse her loan and finally to strengthen her savings with the banc villageois.

loans.use: to purchase 10 barrels of peanuts and five barrels of millet.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza has been a fish vendor for two years. She sells fish to her neighbors and local residents in her area. She is a 32-year-old woman and has three young dependents. She lives in the rural area of Lila, Bohol.

To be able to make her family's ends meet, she also sells Avon products like body spray, face powder, and whitening soap.

Liza needs to improve her earnings, by providing assorted fish and various Avon products, but she does not have enough funds to do it. Therefore Liza is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner CEVI to purchase a variety of fish and Avon products. In this way, she will be able to cope with demands. She can use the profit amount as savings to fulfill her future needs as well.

Liza is very thankful to Kiva and CEVI.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fish and Avon products.

loans.name: Liliana Estela

texts.es:
Lina es una joven de 25 años de edad, una mujer emprendedora, trabajadora, sonriente, pujante, con sueños como comprar vivienda, pagar la educación de sus hijos, una persona dispuesta a laborar arduamente para cambiar su realidad y tener un mejor futuro.

Inicio su negocio, un restaurante, en un pequeño local que tiene un inconveniente y es la inseguridad que este representa, pero ahora puede arreglar este pequeño problema, ya que se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para la compra de rejas, puertas, mejoras locativas todo ello para asegurar su restaurante, brindarles a sus clientes en sitió cómodo que genere tranquilidad.
texts.en:
Lina is a young woman of 25, an enterprising, hardworking, smiling, and vibrant woman, with dreams such as buying a home and paying for the education of her children. She is a person willing to work hard to change her reality and have a better future.

She started her business, a restaurant, in a small locale that has one drawback and it is the lack of security that this represents. But now she can fix this small problem, since she is applying for a loan to buy bars, doors, and make improvements to the locale, all to make her restaurant safe, and offer her customers a comfortable place that generates peace.
.

loans.use: buy bars, doors, and make improvements to the locale, all to make her restaurant safe.

loans.name: Dauda

texts.en:
Dauda is married and has children. He is a business man dealing in entertainment services. He is faced with a challenge of competition from the large service providers.

Dauda reqeusted another loan from UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd. for 1,500,000 UGX, which she will use to buy more stock of chairs to increase his clientele. 
       
Pictured is Dauda with the UGAFODE Credit staff (left to right).

loans.use: to purchase chairs to boost his business.

loans.name: Ana Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda, de 33 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, está acompañada, su pareja se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura sembrando hortalizas, juntos tienen 10 hijos pero 8 ya están acompañados y viven a parte, solo 2 hijos viven con ellos.

Hilda, se dedica a los oficios domésticos en su casa, pero aparte de eso junto a su pareja se dedican a reproducir mariposas en un mariposario, esta actividad requiere de mucho cuidado y siempre tiene que estar pendiente de ellas para recolectar las larvas y colocarlas en otra área para que puedan hacer la metamorfosis, tiene 5 años de dedicarse a esta actividad.

Hilda, necesita el préstamo para construir otro invernadero para las mariposas, principalmente para pagar la maño de obra, este nuevo proyecto le generara mayor producción y también mayores ingresos económicos para ella y su familia.

Los sueños de Hilda, son ser una exportadora en grande de mariposas, además desea que sus hijos sigan estudiando para que sean personas de bien en la sociedad y también desea reparar su casa.
texts.en: Hilda is 33 years old, married and attended school to the third grade. Her husband works in agriculture growing vegetables. They have ten children, eight of which are married and have left home. Only two of their children live with them. Hilda takes care of the household chores, but in addition she and her husband make a living by rearing butterflies in a butterfly farm.  This business requires great care; one must always attend to the butterflies to collect the larvae and place them in another spot so that they pupate. They have been in this business for five years.  Hilda needs a loan to pay for the labour to build another butterfly greenhouse. This new project will increase production and thus provide more income for her and her family. Hilda dreams of becoming a major exporter of butterflies. She also hopes that her children keep studying and grow into positive members of society, she also wants to repair her home.

loans.use: to pay for the labour costs of building another butterfly greenhouse, to increase production.

loans.name: Khun's Group

texts.en: Khun’s group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Khun makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a seller and policeman to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these people to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

Malis’s Group lives in a rural village in Kandal province, in Cambodia.

To support her family, Malis makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer.

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean, drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: ELLA ES UNA JOVEN SEÑORA MADRE DE FAMILIA SE ENCUENTRA PREOCUPADA POR SU PEQUEÑA  HIJA  DEBIDO A QUE A SU CORTA EDAD PRESENTA SEVERO CASO DE PERDIDA DENTAL, NECESITA URGENTEMENTE SER ATENDIDA PARA EVITAR QUE EL PROBLEMA AVANCE. AUN Y CUANDO ELLA TRABAJA COMO SECRETARIA EN UNA EMPRESA SUS RECURSOS SON INSUFICIENTES PARA COSTEAR EL TRATAMIENTO DE SU HIJA, YA QUE NO CUENTA CON EL APOYO DE SU PAREJA QUIEN DESDE HACE TIEMPO NO SE RESPONSABILIZA  DE LA FAMILIA.
texts.en: This borrower is a young mother who is concerned about her young daughter.  At a very young age, she has a severe case of dental loss and urgently needs care to prevent this problem from getting worse.  Even though this borrower works as a secretary in a company, she lacks the resources to pay for her daughter's treatment, as she does not have support from her partner, who has not been responsible for the family for some time now.

loans.use: to pay for dental treatment

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a 31-year-old lady, and she is married and blessed with two children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014 and has benefited from all the training they offer, especially enterprise development and financial management.

Lucy does maize farming as her main enterprise and she is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy quality fertilizer and certified seeds so that she can increase her output and in return increase her profits from sales. This will assist her in catering to her family’s basic needs such as food and clothing, as well as payment of school fees for her children.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: to buy certified seeds and fertilizer to increase her output.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El es un joven casado y en espera de su primer hijo, su esposa presenta fuerte dolor en una molar superior pero como tiene 7 meses de embarazo no ha querido recibir atención médica por temor a tener complicaciones con su embarazo,  ella necesita tratamiento de endodoncia urgente para quitar el dolor e inflamación, sin embargo por el momento no cuentan con el dinero para el tratamiento.
texts.en: This young borrower is married and is awaiting his first child.  His wife is having a lot of pain from an upper molar, but since she is 7 months pregnant she has not wanted to have treatment for this because she fears it would cause complications with her pregnancy.  She needs urgent endodontic treatment to stop the pain and inflammation.  However, at this time they lack the money to pay for this treatment.

loans.use: to pay for dental treatment

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josphine is married and has five children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2011 and has benefited from enterprise development trainings, which has enabled her run her enterprise well.

Josphine sells fresh vegetables and bananas. She requested a Kiva loan, which she will use to add stock to her grocery store so as to earn more income. With the loan, she will be able to her continue supporting the family by paying education fees for her children and meeting the daily household needs of food and clothing.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her grocery store

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El es un padre de familia, actualmente labora en un empresa de manofactura en turnos para la manutención de su esposa e hijos. Sufre de problemas dentales en sus muelas por una infección y el mal cuidado que ha tenido con su dentadura. También tiene problemas en las encías por lo que requiere un tratamiento urgente de limpieza y regeneración del área afectada.
texts.en: This borrower is a father who currently works shifts in a manufacturing company to support his wife and children.  He suffers from dental problems in his molars due to an infection and bad dental care.  He also has problems with his gums, and so he urgently needs a treatment to clean and regenerate the affected area.

loans.use: to pay for dental treatment

loans.name: Cisse's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 26 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été crée en Septembre 2014. Il est constitué de femmes du même village et des environs. Elles ont de bonnes relations et s’activent dans le commerce, l’agriculture et l’embouche. Une bonne ambiance anime les réunions de groupe.
CISSE, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main gauche est l’emprunteuse vedette, elle  est âgée de 36 ans. Elle est mariée et mère deux filles et trois garçons. Elle s’active dans le petit commerce de produits agricoles.
Avec le prêt reçu, elle compte  acheter  quatre  barils de mil 100 Kilogrammes chacun  et 200 Kilogrammes  d’arachides. L’arachide sera transformée en huile à travers un processus de pressage traditionnel pour ensuite revendre le litre à 800 FCFA et les tourteaux obtenus après extraction de l'huile à 500 FCFA l'unité. 
Les bénéfices serviront à faire face aux charges familiales, celles  de ces enfants en particulier ainsi qu’à ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
This group has 26 members and is part of a banc villageois that was created in September 2014. It is made up of women from one village and its surrounding area. They have good relationships and are active in trade, agriculture and animal fattening. There is a good atmosphere at group meetings.

Cisse, standing and holding up her left hand at the right of the photo, is the star borrower and is 36 years old. She is married and the mother of two girls and three boys. She is active in small agricultural trade.

With the loan received, she plans to purchase four barrels of millet (100 kilograms each) and 200 kilograms of peanuts. The peanuts will be made into oil through a traditional pressing process, and the oil will be sold for 800 FCFA per liter. The peanut byproduct remaining after each oil extraction will be sold for 500 FCFA.

The profits will be used to cover family expenses, in particular for her children, as well as her personal needs.

loans.use: to purchase four barrels of millet and 200 kilograms of peanuts.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia owns a rice paddy and grows rice. She has been working in the field and growing rice for many years now. She is married and has five children, two of whom are still young dependents.

She is striving hard to improve her income. Aside from farming, she also sells prepaid electronic top-up load to the locals in her area. This serves as an additional source of income to meet the expenses of the entire family.

Lucia resides in the rural town of Pilar, Bohol. Her husband is a farmer, too.

She would like to take out a loan to purchase additional top-up load, medicines, and food for the family. These are vital instruments that would improve the profitability of both her sources of income. She dreams of utilizing other ways and means to become more productive in handling her livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase additional top-up load, medicines, and food for the family.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: ELLA ES UNA MADRE DE FAMILIA SE ENCUENTRA SUMAMENTE PREOCUPADA POR UNA DE SUS HIJAS DEBIDO A QUE LE SANGRAN MUCHO LAS ENCÍAS, NECESITA ATENCIÓN INMEDIATA, DE NO SER ASÍ  CORRE EL RIESGO DE PERDER PIEZAS DENTALES, DE MOMENTO NO CUENTA CON LOS RECURSOS NECESARIOS PARA SOLVENTAR EL GASTO DEL TRATAMIENTO.
texts.en: This borrower is a mother who is extremely worried about one of her daughters because she has bleeding gums.  She needs immediate treatment, or she runs the risk of losing her teeth.  Right now, this borrower lacks the financial resources to pay for this treatment.

loans.use: to pay for dental treatment

loans.name: Khern's Group

texts.en: Khern’s group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Khern does work as a factory laborer and she also does extra work as an officer to support her family.
