In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these people to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Siyasat

texts.en:
Siyasat was born in 1975. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) from the town of Fuzuli and now lives together with his happy family in the Govshadli village of the Fuzuli region. He is married. Siyasat’s family consists of four people, including his wife, who is housewife, and two children, a boy who is studying in the eleventh class and a girl who is studying second course at technical college.

Siyasat has been in the car washing business for four years. Today, he needs his first loan in the amount of 1,900 AZN (Azerbaijan new manat). He wants to buy a new car wash machine. He is thankful to the Kiva organization and lenders for help.

loans.use: to buy a new car wash machine

loans.name: Renato

texts.en:
Renato is 52 years old and married and lives at Amulung with his family. He manages a farming business and patiently grows rice for future harvest.

He wants to continue to improve his crop production and needs additional capital of 50,000 PHP. He will invest it in his farming business and nourish rice crop. He will buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and insecticides and pay labor costs.

He hopes to continue to improve his crop output and gain good profits for education, meals and revolving capital in his business. He promises to pay back his loan in full.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.en:
Miguel always wanted to own his own business. He and his wife together own and run their towing business, a Towing Service in New Jersey. 

Together, they have managed to learn everything they need to know to successfully build clientele and obtain long-term business contracts. Currently Miguel and his wife provide their services to insurance companies, auto functions, and other businesses. The greatest difficulty they have had has been trying to get loans to continue to invest in their business. Miguel is currently seeking a loan to have access to working capital he and his wife need to expand their services to a larger number of businesses in the New Jersey region. Their vision is to become a well known and reputable towing service company in their area.

loans.use: to access working capital

loans.name: Lani

texts.en:
Lani is 44 years old and married with one child who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Lani has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Lani has been in this business for five years. In the future, Lani would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Maria Sorelly

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 31 años de edad que perseverando alcanzo su meta de constituir un local comercial en el cual vende accesorios para mujer, inició su negocio por gusto y vocación al trabajo independiente y su empresa el da el sustento para pagar todos su gastos, es su única entrada por ello se esmera cada día en ser una gran vendedora, formal, cordial y ofrecer productos que agraden y fidelicen a sus clientes.
Su objetivo a largo plazo es comprar una vivienda, un reto importante para el cual necesita una suma alta de dinero pero con el tiempo lo ira recogiendo, confía en sus habilidades y en su almacén.
La cliente actualmente se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para la compa de un surtido completo de accesorios para mujer, pensando en la temporada navideña, comprará bolsos, collares, bisutería, diademas, correas, reloj,  etc.
texts.en:
Maria is a 31 year-old woman who persevered and reached her goal of having a store where she sells women's accessories.  She chose this business because it was to her liking and because she had a desire to work independently.  Her business gives her the support to pay all of her expenses.  This is her only activity, and so she does her best every day to be a great retailer.  She is formal and friendly, and offers products that her customers appreciate, making them loyal to her business.

Maria's goal in the long term is to buy a house.  This is an important challenge because she will need a large sum of money, but over time she will be saving, relying on her abilities and her business.

Right now, Maria is requesting a loan to stock up on women's accessories for the Christmas season.  She will buy handbags, necklaces, accessories, headbands, belts, watches, etc.

loans.use: to buy accessories to sell

loans.name: Armando Rafael

texts.es: Armando es un joven enérgico y trabajador, con muchos deseos de hacer crecer su negocio para continuar ayudando a su familia, él tiene una microempresa de artículos para el aseo en el hogar, un negocio que ha trascendido de generación en generación y que aprendió de su abuelo a quien ayudaba cuando era un niño.  Con el pasar del tiempo decidió independizarse y emprendió su microempresa en el año 2012, allí fabrica traperos en hilo y comercializa escobas, recogedores y algunos productos limpiadores.  Sus principales clientes son propietarios de bodegas y mayoristas de la ciudad de Barranquilla a quienes les vende de contado e incluso les brinda facilidades de pago. Alterno a su actividad principal ofrece servicio de mantenimiento y reparación de computadores, labor que le permite incrementar sus ingresos. Armando está necesitando comprar más materias primas para incrementar su producción es por ello que realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar hilo para tejer mechas de trapeadores.  Esta inversión lo ayudará a cumplir su meta de expandirse a nuevos territorios y lograr más ventas y a futuro proyecta tener su negocio en un local propio.
texts.en: Armando is an energetic and hard-working young man, with a lot of desire to grow his business to continue helping his family. He has a micro-business of cleaning items for the home, a business that has gone from generation to generation and he learned it from his grandfather who he helped as a boy.  With the passing of time, he decided to become independent and undertook a micro-business in the year 2012, there he makes mops from yard and sells brooms, dustpans, and some cleaning products. His primary customers are shop owners and wholesalers in the city of Barranquilla to whom he sells them in cash and even offers payment terms. Other than his primary business, he offers computer maintenance and repair services, work that allows him to increase his income. Armando needs to purchase more raw materials to increase his production and for this he applied for a loan, a Kiva loan, an opportunity to become part of the financial world through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to purchase yarn to make mop heads. This investment will help him to meet his goal of expanding to new territory and achieving more sales and in the future he expects to have his business in its own retail space.

loans.use: to purchase yarn to make mop heads.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is 57 a year old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She resides in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and four children. Her elder son has been running his own tailoring shop in the local market for 25 years. He is solely responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family.

Sajida's son needs to buy different types of tailoring accessories e.g. pieces of cloth, laces, needles and sewing machine accessories. Due to financial constraints her son is not in a suitable condition to buy these items for his business purposes. Therefore Sajida has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, she will assist her son to acquire these tailoring accessories to fulfill his business needs, so that he can earn more income.

Sajida is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy tailoring supplies for her son's business.

loans.name: Kabuku Success Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand holding a passbook is called Damaris. She is 25 years old. married and blessed with one child who is currently attending school. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013 to benefit from trainings, especially enterprise development and financial management. This greatly improved her business management skills.

She operates a beauty salon and mobile banking service (Mpesa) business. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy beauty products to satisfy customers' needs and increase sales and income.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support. She promises to repay it promptly.

loans.use: to buy beauty products for her salon business to attract more customers and increase her income.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana María es una mujer de 64 años de edad, casada la cual se dedica a vender mercancía principalmente artículos de papelería en una vitrina la cual ubica en su hogar.
Tiene 4 hijos, mayores de edad, trabaja por necesidad económica, por alimentarse, comprar medicamentos, pagar servicios públicos, por vivir dignamente.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de una vitrina, aumentar inventario, comprar insumos para la fotocopiadora y un aviso publicitario.
texts.en:
Ana María is a 64-year-old woman, married, who works selling merchandise, primarily paper goods, at a display case she has located in her home.

She has 4 children, adults, and she works for economic necessity to feed herself, to purchase medicines, to pay for utilities, and to live with dignity.

She asks for a loan to purchase a display case, increase her income, and purchase supplies for a photocopier and an advertisement.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for the photocopier and an advertisement.

loans.name: Jose Alirio

texts.es:
Una foto espectacular, este es el paisaje que diariamente el señor José un agricultor enfocado en el cultivo de flores, el cual solicita un apoyo económico para comprar materiales para terminar de construir la sala de empaque.
Es un hombre casado de 41 años de edad que tiene como propósito exportar su producto y pagar la educación de su pequeño de 6 años de edad.
texts.en: A spectacular photo, this is the daily landscape of Jose, a farmer who focuses on growing flowers. He is requesting a loan  to buy materials to finish building a packing room.  He is 41 years old and married. His plan is to export his products to pay for the education of his child, who is 6 years old.

loans.use: to buy materials to finish building a packing room.

loans.name: Kei's Group

texts.en: Kei’s group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Kei makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a factory laborer and security to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Punly's Group

texts.en: The members of Punly’s Group live in a rural village in Kamong Speu province in Cambodia. Punly makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as seller to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Ciudad Nueva Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Ciudad Nueva está en su segundo ciclo, ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras que se unieron para poder dar a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida. Están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, esforzándose por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Blasida quien es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, trabaja para poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos y darles todo lo que ella no pudo tener. Se dedica a la elaboración y venta de productos de limpieza y por medio de ello tiene los medios para procurar una mejor calidad de vida para ella y su familia.
La Sra. Blasida solicita de este préstamo para la compra de productos que necesita para la elaboración de lavandina, desodorante de ambiente, y otros, y agradece por la oportunidad que tiene de poder seguir creciendo y saliendo adelante.
texts.en:
The group called "Ciudad Nueva" ["New City"] is in its second cycle. They are very hard working, entrepreneurial women that unite in order to be able to give their families a better quality of life. They are in a poverty elimination program, making an effort to be able to improve their living conditions and those of their families.

One of the members is Mrs. Blasida, who is a very hard working, entrepreneurial woman. She works to be able to help her family and loved ones and to give them everything that she could not have. She earns a living making and selling cleaning products and through it she has the means to get a better quality of life for her and her family.

Mrs. Blasida requests this loan for purchasing products that she needs for making bleach, air deodorizer, and other things. She is grateful for the opportunity that she has to be able to continue growing and getting ahead.

loans.use: to buy products to make bleach, air deodorizer, and other things.

loans.name: Jena

texts.en:
Jena is a sari-sari (variety) store owner and has been proficiently running this business for almost 11 years to earn a living. She and her family live in Concepcion, Iloilo. Her husband works hard as a fisherman to support the needs of their 12-year-old son.

Jena is a 58-year-old woman who dreams of a business improvement for her family. She wishes for her son to finish his studies and have a better life in the future. Because of this, Jena is asking for a bigger amount of loan for additional capital to buy commodities such as canned goods, noodles, spices, eggs, cooking oil, sugar, coffee, flour, powdered chocolate drink and milk, chips, candies, bread, laundry soap and toiletries. Part of her requested amount is to buy a new boat engine.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, spices, eggs, cooking oil, sugar, coffee, flour, powdered chocolate drink and milk, chips, candies, bread, laundry soap, etc. Part of the loan is for a new boat engine.

loans.name: Vivencia

texts.en:
Vivencia is 48 years old and marred with five children. With three children in school, Vivencia works very hard to provide for them.

Vivencia owns a general store in the Philippines.  

She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as canned good, noodles, sugar and other groceries. She requested a loan through CEVI in order to purchase more groceries to sell. She will also use the money for fertilizer and materials for house renovation like cement and steel.

In the future Vivencia, would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her general store, fertilizer, cement and steel

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is a 39-year-old woman from Baybay, Leyte. She is married and has four children. The oldest child is 17 years old while the youngest child is 10 years old. Victoria needs an amount of PHP6, 000 for additional capital to her sari-sari store (varieties) business which runs for almost two years. She will buy grocery items such as soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, spices, cooking oil, toiletries, laundry soap, sugar, chips, biscuits, candies, powdered juice and powdered milk from the amount she is requesting. In the future, she wishes to have other business opportunities that will enhance their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, spices, cooking oil, toiletries, laundry soap, sugar, chips, biscuits, candies, powdered juice and powdered milk from the amount she is requesting

loans.name: Virgelio

texts.en: Virgelio is a married man and a responsible father to five children aged one to twelve. He operate a Sari-sari (general) store business and raises hogs to support their needs. He is asking a loan to buy feed, piglets, canned food, noodles, sugar, cooking oil, toiletries and seasoning to enhance his business and maximize his income. Like most father, Virgelio is focused on giving his children a proper education for a better life. He is 41 years old and lives in San Miguel, Bohol.

loans.use: to buy feed, piglets, canned food, noodles, sugar, cooking oil, toiletries and seasoning

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes is a 47-year-old woman from Catigbian, Bohol. She is married with seven children; three adult and four-school-aged children. To earn a living, Lourdes is engaged in various businesses such as raising pigs, selling fish and “buri” (the largest palm in the Philippines) weaving. Thus, she is asking a loan to buy piglets and feed. In addition to this, she will also buy fish to sell. In the future, Lourdes wants to improve her business for her children.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, drinking liquor, canned goods, noodles, spices, eggs, cooking oil, chips, candies, biscuits, chocolate bars, sugar, powdered chocolate drinks and juice

loans.name: Adriano

texts.en:
53-year-old Adriano owns a rice paddies. He has grown rice for many years now. He is married and has three children. One of the child is still attending school. He is striving hard to improve his income. He lives in the town of Bilar, Bohol.

He would like to take a loan to purchase fertilizers and rice seedlings. These inputs will hopefully produce a bountiful harvest, improving his yield to continue to provide for his family. Then he could look for other sources of income to become even more productive. He is looking forward to improving and is always seeking ways to become more efficient in handling his business. His dream is to continue financing the schooling of his youngest child.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and rice seedlings

loans.name: Mario Jr.

texts.en:
Mario is a motorcycle owner. He has been driving for four years to earn a living and to support his family. He is 24 years old, married and has a one-year-old child. Aside from driving, he also raises pigs, and his wife is engaged in basket making. They work together for their family.

Mario is asking for a loan to buy spare parts for his motorcycle to be able to maintain its good condition. Aside from this, he will also buy feed for his pigs and raw materials for his wife's baskets, specifically rattan stem (rattan is a tropical palm). Mario’s goal in life is to enhance their livelihood so they can have better lives in the future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorcycle, feed for the pigs, and rattan stems for basket making.

loans.name: Donati

texts.en:
Donati is a thirty-six-year-old married man with four children who all attend school. He deals mainly in livestock. He lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. Donati also supplements his income with farming, which he uses to cater to the needs of his extra family members whom he looks after.

His uppermost vision is to construct a permanent house for his family and also expand on the size of his farm. However this is not so possible since he faces a challenge of inadequate capital to meet the increasing demand. Donati hopes to increase the household income with time since most of his children are almost through with school. He is requesting a loan to get more cows for his farm.

loans.use: to get more cows for his farm.

loans.name: Olga Elena

texts.es:
Olga es una mujer de 36 años de edad que actualmente se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para pagar un curso de químicos 2 (belleza), dictado en la corporación Interactuar, con el objetivo de actualizarse en tendencias de peluquería, buscando prestar un mejor servicio, generar mayores ingresos para aumentar la calidad de vida de ella y su familia.
Su sueño es progresar, consolidarse como peluquera y tener empleadas.
texts.en: Olga is 36 years old. She is requesting a loan to pay for a course in chemical techniques for beauticians provided by the Interactuar corporation. Her goal is to update herself in hairstyling trends so that she can provide better service, and thereby earn more income and improve the quality of life for herself and her family. Her dream is to progress, establish herself as a hairstylist, and have employees.

loans.use: to pay for a course in chemical techniques for beauticians

loans.name: Yessica Natalia

texts.es:
Yessica es una joven de 21 años de edad, soltera y con una pequeña de 3 años de edad, abandono los estudios por criar a su hija, actualmente no puede buscar trabajo ya que no tiene quien le cuide a su princesa, es por esta razón que solicita de tu apoyo para iniciar un negocio el cual pueda operar desde su casa, será una tienda de productos de la canasta familiar.
Ella quiere tener un medio de ingreso para el sostenimiento de su hija, no quiere ser una mantenida, va a demostrar su carácter, responsabilidad y ganas de salir adelante.
El préstamo será para la compra de estantería, vitrinas, congelador, víveres, abarrotes, productos de refrigeración en general, refrescos.
texts.en:
Yessica is 21 years old and single with a 3-year-old daughter. She gave up studying to raise her daughter and she can't currently look for work because she has no one to care for her princess. She is asking for your support in order to start a business which she can run from home. The business will be a store selling staple products.

She wants to have a means of income in order to support her daughter as she doesn't want to be dependent. She will demonstrate her character, responsibility and desire to succeed.

The loan is to buy shelving, display cabinets, freezer, food, groceries, general cold storage products and soft drinks.

loans.use: to buy shelving, display cabinets, a freezer, food, groceries and general cold storage products.

loans.name: Delmy Emely

texts.es:
Delmy, de 42 años de edad, es una mujer luchadora, estudio hasta séptimo grado, actualmente está casada, su esposo se dedica a trabajar con su vehículo transportando personas desde la comunidad donde vive hasta la ciudad, juntos tienen tres hijos.

Delmy, se ha dedicado a los oficios del hogar durante toda su vida, pero junto a su esposo decidieron iniciar un proyecto de crianza de pollos de engorde, después de esta actividad decidieron establecer una pequeña tienda en su casa, en la cual ella se encarga de administrar y se levanta a las 4:00 a.m. para realizar las labores de su hogar y preparar el alimento para su familia, para después dedicarse a atender la tienda y a cuidar las aves y toda la jornada de trabajo finaliza a las 8:00 p.m. 

Delmy, necesita el préstamo para comprar: maíz, frijol, arroz, azúcar, gaseosas, jugos, pan, entre otros productos de la canasta básica, con los cuales podrá tener una mayor cantidad de productos para ofrecerle a sus clientes y de esta manera mejoraran las ganancias ya que las ventas aumentaran.

Delmy, sueña con ver crecer a sus hijos y verlos graduarse de una carrera universitaria y también desea que sus negocios de la crianza de pollo y la tienda crezcan cada día más.
texts.en:
Delmy, 42 years old, is a determined woman, she went to school up to the seventh grade, currently is married, her husband works with his vehicle transporting people from the community where they live to the city, together they have three children.

Delmy has done the household chores her whole life, but with her husband they decided to start a project raising chickens to fatten, after this work, they decided to establish a small store in their house, which she is in charge of running and she gets up at 4:00 am to do the household chores and prepare the food for her family to later work tending the store and caring for the birds and the whole work day ends at 8:00 pm.

Delmy needs the loan to purchase: corn, beans, rice, sugar, soft drinks, juice, bread, and other basic pantry items, with which she will be able to have a larger quantity of products to offer her customers and in this way her earnings will improve since sales will increase.

Delmy dreams of seeing her children grow and seeing them graduate with a university degree and also she wants her businesses of raising chickens and the store to grow more each day.

loans.use: to purchase corn, beans, rice, sugar, soft drinks, juice, bread, and other basic pantry items.

loans.name: Samath's Group

texts.en: Samath’s group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Samath makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a factory laborer and seller to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Eae's Group

texts.en:
Eae’s group lives in a rural village in the Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Eae makes a living cultivating rice to support her family.

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Kerubo

texts.en:
Kerubo is a 42-year-old lady, married and blessed with four children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 and has benefited from enterprise development and financial management trainings.

She does maize and beans farming as her main activity and she is borrowing a Kiva loan to purchase more quality fertilizer and certified seeds. This will greatly increase her income, which will enable her to cater to her family’s basic needs such as food and clothing.

She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to repay her loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and certified seeds to make more income to cater to her family's basic needs such as food and clothing.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia hails from the town of Pilar, Bohol. She is married and has 12 children, six of whom are still attending school.

She raises and sells hogs. She works hard to support the needs of her children. Aside from hog raising, she toils the land and grows rice. Her husband is a farmer . Together, they strive hard to support the basic necessities of the household.

She needs funds to support her existing projects. She has requested a loan to purchase pig feed and fertilizer. It will boost her income and continue to handle it properly, supporting her family and providing better living conditions. With these, she will be able to roll-out her capital and invest in other sources of income.
Sonia is hoping that someday, she will be productive in her chosen field.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed and fertilizer

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 40 years old and married with six children. With five children in school, Irene works very hard to provide for them.

Irene runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, home care products and other groceries.

Irene has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items. In the future, Irene would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Viviana Maria

texts.es:
Viviana es una mujer de 30 años de edad, madre soltera y cabeza de familia la cual se dedica a vender ropa para hombre mujer, niño y niña en un almacén el cual ha estado levantando y posicionando desde el año 2011.
Tiene un pequeño de 8 años de edad, su muchacho goza de una buena alimentación, estudia, tiene un techo donde dormir y todo gracias a esa madre guerrera que tiene que daría todo solo pro verlo sonreír.
La cliente quiere solicitar un préstamo para comprar surtido de ropa juvenil para hombre y dama, el motivo principal es abastecerse de ropa para atender la demanda de fin de año, esperando obtener buenas ganancias que ayuden al crecimiento de su hogar y a brindarle una feliz navidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Viviana is a 30-year-old woman, single mother, and head of household who sells clothing for men, women, boys, and girls in a store she has been building and positioning since 2011.

She has an 8-year-old little one. Her boy enjoys good nutrition, goes to school, and has a roof under which to sleep, all thanks to this warrior mother who would give everything just to see him smile.

She wants to request a loan to buy male and female children's clothing. The main motive is to stock up on clothing in order to respond to the year-end season demand, hoping to obtain good profits that help her home to grow and provide a merry Christmas to her family.

loans.use: to buy male and female children's clothing

loans.name: Janith

texts.es: Janith de 50 años es un padre de familia responsable que reside en un barrio de Soledad en compañía de su familia, ellos fueron víctimas del desplazamiento forzoso en su tierra natal y encontraron en el municipio de Soledad una esperanza para un nuevo comienzo.  Janith tomó un vehículo de tracción animal para expender frutas y verduras en el municipio y sus alrededores para conseguir el sustento de su familia, él es padre de tres hijos de 15, 10 y 9 años, quienes se encuentran cursando sus estudios académicos, sin embargo el sueño de Janith es verlos graduados en las profesiones que ellos deseen.  Hoy en día lleva 3 años en su negocio y como su capital es insuficiente, realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para surtir con frutas de temporada como guayaba, guanábana, mora, tomate de árbol entre otros. Su meta a futuro es comercializar frutas y verduras en un punto fijo que le garantice un ingreso seguro.
texts.en: Janith is 50 years old, and a responsible father who lives in a neighborhood in Soledad with his family. They were victims of forced displacement from their native land, and in the municipality of Soledad they found hope for a new beginning. Janith acquired a vehicle drawn by an animal to sell fruits and vegetables in the municipality and surrounding areas, in order to support his family. He is the father of three children aged 15, 10 and 9. They all attend school, and Janith's dream is to see them graduate in their chosen professions. He has had his business for 3 years. Because he has insufficient capital, he is requesting a loan from Kiva. which is an opportunity through the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo to be connected with financing. With the loan he will supply himself with seasonal fruits such as guava, soursop, blackberry, tree tomato and others. His future goal is to sell fruits and vegetables from a fixed location, which will guarantee him a stable income.

loans.use: supply himself with seasonal fruits such as guava, soursop, blackberry, tree tomato and others.

loans.name: Claudia Andrea

texts.es:
Claudia es una mujer de 33 años de edad, una persona trabajadora, pujante, luchadora, la cual se dedica a prestar los servicios de peluquería con los implementos que con ahorros ha logrado comprar.
Su principal sueño es tener su propio salón de belleza, algo que ha querido hace mucho tiempo pero la falta de capital ha sido su principal impedimento para alcanzar su sueño.
Pero todo puede cambiar y tú puedes ser partícipe de un gran cambio en la vida de Claudia, ya que está solicitando un préstamo para comprar todos los implementos ya activos para tener su salón de belleza.
Comprará silla de peluquería, tocador, espejos, químicos, tratamientos, lava-cabezas, mesas, sillones, sofá, televisor.
Su sueño es generar los recursos suficientes para darle a su familia y en especial a su hijo una excelente calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Claudia is a 33-year-old woman. She is a hard-working person, strong, and a fighter, and she provides hairdressing services with the tools she has been able to buy with savings.

Her main dream is to have her own beauty salon, something she has wanted for a long time, but the lack of capital has been her main impediment to achieving her dream.

But everything can change and you can be a participant in the great change in Claudia's life, since she is asking for a loan to buy all the tools and assets to have her beauty salon.

She will buy a hairdresser's chair, dressing table, mirrors, chemicals, treatments, shampoo bowls, tables, chairs, a sofa, and a television.

Her dream is to generate sufficient resources to give her family, and especially her son, an excellent quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a hairdresser's chair, dressing table, mirrors, chemicals, treatments, shampoo bowls, tables, chairs, a sofa, and a television

loans.name: Eleonor

texts.en:
Eleonor works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell of rice grains business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

Eleonor has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Eleonor would like to save enough to buy more farm land.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Brudys Esther

texts.es:
Brudys es una joven de 20 años de edad, una mujer a través del trabajo está sacando su familia adelante.
No tiene hijos, ni pareja, trabaja incansablemente por apoyar a sus padres, quiere pagar sus estudios, ella vende mercancía principalmente lociones y desodorantes, los oferta puerta a puerta.
Esta joven emprendedora quiere solicitar un préstamo para abastecerse de productos e iniciar a vender ropa, lo que quiere es ampliar su portafolio de servicios y generar más ganancias que apoyen sus deseos.
texts.en: Brudys is 20 years old, and is helping to support her family through her work. She has no children or partner, but works tirelessly to support her parents, and would like to pay for her own education. She sells products door to door, primarily lotions and deodorants. This young entrepreneur is requesting a loan to supply herself with products and start selling clothing. She would like to expand her portfolio of services and earn more income her support her wishes.

loans.use: to start selling clothing.

loans.name: Murata Women Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Faith, a member of Murata Women Group. She is 36 years old, married and blessed with three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014.

Apart from farming maize and beans, Faith keeps dairy cows. With the training she got from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa, she has been able to run her enterprise better and profitably, unlike before. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer. This will increase her farm production, meet the demand for cereals, earn her more income and hence go a long way in supporting her children's education and her family's basic needs.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer that will increase her farm production and meet the demand for cereals, thus earning more income.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
The lady in the photo is Ruth. She is 45 years old with three children. She is married and living with her husband.

She is a maize and dairy farmer. She is taking a loan to purchase fertilizer, dairy feed and certified seeds, which will ensure that her farm yields increase. She hopes that her business will generate more profits that will help increase her level of income. She will use the anticipated income to meet her family's basic needs such as food.

Ruth is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support and promises to pay promptly

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, dairy feed and certified seeds that will boost her farm output and thus more income.

loans.name: Lynette

texts.en:
Lynette is 38 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, eggs, soap, shampoo, and coffee.

Lynette has borrowed and repaid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from buying and selling vegetables.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, eggs, soap, shampoo, and coffee

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is a married mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over two years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. In addition she also operates a salon business. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking fat

loans.name: Shpresa

texts.en:
This is Shpresa, or 'hope' in English, who is requesting 100,000 Albanian Lek from Kiva lenders to pay her pension contribution and some little other stuff for her little home. Kindly note that recently, with the changes in the government, rural people have to pay for their retirement on their own, regardless of how much those people make. Some of them live under very extreme poverty, yet they are required to pay for the retirement pension.

She is a vulnerable ethnic Egyptian and a married mother of two grown ups and she lives in the rural part of the country. On the agricultural land that her family owns, they plant in large quantities wheat and beans and from selling these, she earns about $972/annually. Shpresa also has a horse to help with the transportation of produce and other things.

loans.use: who is a very poor rural vulnerable ethnic lady to pay her contribution to her retirement pension.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a cereals shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, cooking fat and oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, cooking fat and oil.

loans.name: Ma. Ruberosa

texts.en:
Ma. Ruberosa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Ma. Ruberosa has been in this business for 18 years now.

In the future, Ma. Ruberosa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Mechel

texts.en:
Mechel is 24 years old, married, and has one child. She works very hard to provide for them. Mechel operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for two years, selling a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, and other groceries.

Mechel requested a loan for NWTF for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more groceries to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Carlos Humberto

texts.es:
Carlos, de 38 años de edad, es muy trabajador y honrado, estudio tercer grado, lamentablemente no pudo continuar debido a que le surgió un problema en la vista y sus padres no contaban con los recursos económicos necesarios para poder ayudarle, vive en casa con sus padres, con una hermana y dos sobrinas que van a la escuela de su comunidad.

Carlos, desde hace 4 años trabaja como recolector de basura en la ciudad y también se dedica a cuidar y mantener una pequeña granja de pollo de engorde, decidió dedicarse a este negocio porque es algo que a él le gusta mucho y le genera buenos ingresos.

Carlos, necesita el préstamo para iniciar con su propia granja de pollos, específicamente necesita el préstamo para comprar concentrado y para comprar vacunas para prevenir enfermedades y para mejorar la instalación de la granja.

El sueño de Carlos, quiere tener una granja más tecnificada que le permita comprar y vender sus pollos a gran escala y así poder mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Carlos is 38 years old, and is very hard-working and honest. He went to school as far as the third grade, but unfortunately was unable to continue because his parents lacked the resources necessary to be able to help him. He lives with his parents, a sister, and two nieces who go to school in the community.

For four years Carlos has worked as a garbage collector in the city. He also works caring for and maintaining a small chicken farm. He decided to start this business because he likes it a lot and it earns good income.

Carlos needs a loan to start his own chicken farm. Specifically, he needs a loan to buy concentrated feed and vaccinations to prevent illness, and to improve the farm facilities. His dream is to have a more technical farm that will allow him to buy and sell chickens on a large scale, and also to be able to make improvements to his house.

loans.use: to buy concentrated feed and vaccinations to prevent illness, and to improve the farm facilities.

loans.name: Katwebumbe Youth Group

texts.en:
Prossy is a repeat client of UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd Mdi. She applied for a loan of 1,500,000 UGX. She is a married woman with children.

She is a businesswoman with a retail shop and sells soft drinks. In a bid to increase her working capital and expand her business, she has applied for a loan of 1,500,000 UGX. However she is faced with the challanges of competition and lack of enough capital.

She is very grateful for the support UGAFODE Microfinance and Kiva lenders offered to her since she is now able to fund her business.

loans.use: to boost her business.

loans.name: Bledian

texts.en: Bledian used his previous loan to make some repairs to the home, but he is not done. He requested another loan because his home is so run down that it needs a lot of work.

loans.use: to continue repairing the family home

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a resident of the town of Sierra Bullones, Bohol. She operates a general store, selling various commodities ranging from condiments, soft drinks, toiletries, assorted canned goods and medicines.

She is a 60-year-old married woman with one grown child.

Her general store is situated in front of the market place in her town, serving mostly locals and nearby residents. Due to the high demand for commodities and medicines, she needs adequate capital to support her financial needs.

Sarah has requested a loan to acquire additional capital to purchase supplies like groceries, medicines and other dry goods. These will surely improve her earnings and continue to roll out her capital. In that way, she would be able to monitor the inventory of her merchandise to prevent stock shortages.

She is hoping that someday, she will become productive to continue to help others who are in need.

loans.use: to acquire additional capital to purchase supplies like groceries, medicines and other dry goods

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the previous loan which she used to buy dairy feeds and also repaired the cow shed. This greatly improved her dairy farming production and she used the increased profit to boost her vegetables farming. 

She is borrowing a second Kiva loan to buy manure and animal feeds to further improve farming production. This will ensure that she has a steady income to support her family expenses. 

Jane is happy for Kiva and their lenders for the continued financial support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and manure to improve her farming production and have a steady income to support her family's expenses.

loans.name: Pensadores Group

texts.pt:
O grupo Pensadores se conheceu no próprio bairro onde moram eles são  clientes um dos outros. O grupo já solicitou onze empréstimos com o Banco do Povo (BPCS). João  vende churrasco, Odair  vende produtos de casas do norte ele e baiano e sempre trabalhou neste ramo e Jasmim tem um bazar vende material escolar, mochilas e produtos de limpeza.
Jonas é o líder do grupo e tem 70 anos. Ele é casado tem 1 filho mora com sua esposa  na comunidade de Maua em São Paulo. Ele e muito honesto, trabalhador e tem muito carinho com seu trabalho, se sente gratificante por trabalhar com pessoas.
 Jonas  vende embalagens em sua comunidade para se sustentar. Ele trabalha a mais de 11 anos com estes produtos e tem muita experiência. Começou trabalhar nesta área porque já havia trabalhado como vendedor e devido a falta de oportunidade no mercado de trabalho e sua idade avançada, decidiu abrir o seu próprio negocio. A atividade dele e especial porque o seu sustento depende do seu trabalho, e também por que sente satisfação com o que faz. 
Jonas  precisa de um empréstimo para a compra de matéria prima, plásticos, isopor e material descartável. A renda extra deste empréstimo permitirá que ele compre mais mercadorias e poupe uma parte. No futuro, ele planeja comprar um imóvel, por que no momento mora em casa de aluguel. 
O grupo gostaria de dizer aos investidores que se sentem agradecidos mesmo não os conhecendo e os parabenizam pela iniciativa em ajudar outras pessoas.
texts.en:
The Pensadores ("Thinkers") communal bank know each other from the neighborhood where they all live, and they're each other's customers. The group has taken 11 loans with Banco do Povo (BPCS). João sells barbecue. Odair, who is from the state of Bahia, sells home products that come from the north of the country, and has always been in this line of work. Jasmim owns a store where he sells school supplies, backpacks and cleaning products.
Jonas is the leader of the group and he's 70 years old. He's married and has a son. He lives with his wife in the town of Mauá in São Paulo. He's very honest and hardworking, and he cares a lot about his work. He feels that it's fulfilling to work with people.
Jonas sells packing material in his community so that he can support himself. He has worked with these products for over 11 years and has a lot of experience. He started this business because he had worked as a salesperson before and, due to a lack of job opportunities and his advanced age, he decided to start his own business. His work is special because it's his means of livelihood, and also because it's a source of satisfaction for him.
Jonas needs a loan in order to purchase supplies, plastic, polystyrene and disposable material. The extra revenue he'll get from this loan will allow him to buy more merchandise and save part of it. In the future he plans to buy a property, because he currently lives in a rented house.
The group would like to tell the lenders that they're thankful even though they haven't met them, and they applaud the lenders for their initiative to help other people.

loans.use: to purchase supplies, plastic, polystyrene, and disposable material.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a 26-year-old mother of five whose spouse provide additional income.

Lilian runs a tailoring shop at Kisumu, Kenya, a business she has run for the last two years and which has been profitable.

This is her second time borrowing from VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase additional cloth materials and prints to make clothes for her customers, especially during the forthcoming Christmas festive season. With the anticipated profits, she will be able to repay her loan.

Lilian hopes to be successful in business.

loans.use: to purchase additional cloth materials and prints to make clothes for her customers, especially during the forthcoming Christmas festive season.

loans.name: Sam's Group

texts.en: Sam’s group live in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Sam makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as factory laborer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these woman and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Phillipo

texts.en:
Phillipo is a 27-year-old hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He still carries out livestock as a main source of earning a living and with the profits, he has been able to develop himself. Apart from that, he also deals in produce where he grows and sells maize and groundnuts from which he earns more money to support his family. He has been in the business since 2009 and has a vision of expanding it into wholesale but his main challenge, like other business people, is inadequate capital to meet the high demand.

With the requested loan, Phillipo intends to buy more cows for fattening and later for sell.

loans.use: to buy more cows for fattening and later for selling.    .

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
Marisol, mujer cabeza de familia, soltera de 45 años de edad  que se dedica a la venta de helados. No tiene hijos solo unas inmensas ganas de progresar y salir adelante y cumplir un sueño que se propuso al iniciar con su negocio a principios del presente año que es comprar una casa. 
La cliente es una persona con grandes valores, es laboriosa, honesta, responsable, muy noble, trabaja 9 horas diarias, fines de semana trabaja hasta doce horas.
Actualmente Marisol se posicionando su negocio, ahora quiere solicitar un préstamo para aumentar su inventario, comprando más sabores, cochas, cucuruchos, conos, quiere ofrecer mayor variedad de preparaciones y hacer de su negocio el sitio de encuentro para disfrutar y rico y refrescante helado.
texts.en:
Marisol is a single, 45 year old woman, head of family who works selling ice-cream. She has no children just great desire to progress and get ahead. She wants to fulfill a dream she proposed starting her business at the beginning of this year, which is to buy a house.

The client is a person with great values. She is hard-working, honest, responsible and very noble. She works 9 hours per day and on weekends up to 12 hours.

Currently Marisol is repositioning her business and she now wants to request a loan to increase her inventory. She will buy more flavors, scoops, containers, cones as she wants to offer greater variety in styles of ice cream and make her business a place to enjoy a tasty and refreshing ice-cream.

loans.use: to increase her inventory buying more flavors, scoops, containers, cones as she wants to offer greater variety in styles of ice cream.

loans.name: Lebrando

texts.en:
Two months ago, Lebrando successfully started his poultry business. He was doing this to have additional income for his family. Thus, Lebrando is a married man and has three children; ages six, four and one-year-old. He is 34 years old and lives with his family in Tubigon, Bohol.

Lebrando’s goal in life is to improve his business for their sustainability. He also wants to give his family a better life. With this, he is asking for a loan to buy more chicks to raise and feed as well. He also needs a loan to buy materials for his chicken pens (chicken coops).

In this way, he will be able to raise more chicks to lay eggs and adults to sell. With this, it increases his sales and augments his profit.

loans.use: to buy more chicks to raise and feed, and materials for his chicken pens (chicken coops).

loans.name: Evelin

texts.es:
Evelin, de 34 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está acompañada y su pareja trabaja extrayendo arena de un rio y junto a él tiene cuatro hijos 3 están en la escuela.

Evelin, desde hace seis años se dedica a la venta de antojos típicos, la necesidad la hizo buscar una forma de ayudarle a su pareja para sacar adelante a su familia, es por eso que decidió vender papas fritas, pasteles de carne, enchiladas y otros antojos, en su casa y empieza a vender a las 2:00 de la tarde y termina a las 6:00 de la tarde.

Evelin, necesita el préstamo para comprar sacos de papas, harina, aceite, carne y otros insumos para preparar los alimentos que vender. 

Evelin, sueña con que sus hijos se conviertan en profesionales y además sueña con poder construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
Evelin is 34 years old and studied up to Grade 6. She is in a relationship and her partner works extracting sand from a river. Together with him she has four children, three of them attend school.

For six years Evelin has worked selling traditional snacks. Necessity forced her to look for a way to help her partner to get the family ahead and so she decided to sell french fries, meat pastries, enchiladas and other snacks from her house. She starts to sell at 2 in the afternoon and closes at 6 in the evening.

Evelin needs the loan to buy sacks of potatoes, flour, oil, meat and other supplies to prepare food for sale.

Evelin dreams of her children becoming professionals and also dreams of being able to construct her own house.

loans.use: to buy sacks of potatoes, flour, oil, meat and other supplies to prepare food for sale.

loans.name: Sabahate

texts.en:
Sabahate is a mother of four children between the ages of 11 and 24 years old. For the last four years, she has been operating a seamstress business, making clothing of all different styles for her clients.

While she has both men and women customers, she does a lot of dresses for weddings and other celebrations. Typically, her business is busiest in the summer when she has a lot of demand for custom-made clothing for the summer weddings and events.

Although her husband works in a factory, he has a low salary, and Sabahate is very proud to be able to contribute to her family's budget and lifestyle with her income. Her business has been successful, and she is able to sustain the rent for her shop and has now even begun her search to hire an employee to help her.

At this time, she is requesting a loan to purchase material she needs for her work. She will be able to purchase attractive and beautiful fabrics that clients will be excited to use for their new clothing. The loan will then help to increase her orders and attract more customers.

She plans to give her children a better education and works hard to be able to increase their income enough to do so.

loans.use: to purchase attractive and beautiful fabrics that clients will be excited to use for their new clothing

loans.name: Christian Jesús

texts.es:
Christian es un joven estudiante de SENATI, la carrera que eligió estudiar es Técnico en Ingeniería Electrónica, ya que es una carrera innovadora y está seguro que saldrán nuevas creaciones que aportan mucho a la humanidad. Cuando culmine la carrera piensa convalidar sus estudios con la universidad para especializarse como Ingeniero en Electrónica.

Esta carrera le permitirá forjarse como profesional exitoso, que ayudará en los cambios de su entorno tecnológicamente, y del bienestar económico en su familia. Aún le falta 2 años para que pueda culminar sus estudios.

El único obstáculo que ha encontrado durante todo su tiempo de estudios, es el económico, porque no puede cubrir con las mensualidades de su carrera. Debido a ello es que recurre a KIVA para que puedan apoyarlo y logré cumplir su meta de ser un excelente profesional. De no obtener el apoyo de KIVA, Christian tendría que trabajar lo suficiente para poder pagar sus estudios y eso le quitaría mucho tiempo en los estudios. 

Actualmente, viene desarrollando sus prácticas pre-profesionales en una empresa de ingeniería de componentes, que se encargan de todo lo relacionado con el diseño de circuitos. Las prácticas no son muy remuneradas, solo recibe propinas.

El crédito solicitado a KIVA lo utilizará para los pagos de la mensualidad de su carrera, ya que no correría el riesgo de perder sus estudios por falta de pago. El mayor sueño que tiene en la vida es de ser un diseñador en el ámbito de la electrónica, aportar en la innovación y hacer crecer a su país tecnológicamente.

Christian desea expresarles unas palabras a los integrantes de KIVA: "Estoy muy agradecido por recibir de esta ayuda, esto me enseña a ser una persona que ayuda al prójimo, que cree en los sueños de los demás y a ser bondadoso. Gracias por todo y por poner su confianza en mi."
texts.en:
Christian is a young student at SENATI. The course he chose to study is Technician in Electronic Engineering, since it is an innovative field and he is sure that new creations will come out that bring a great deal to humanity. When he finishes his course he plans to transfer his credits to the university in order to specialize as an Electronic Engineer.

This course will allow him to build himself into a successful professional, which will help with the changes in his environment technologically, and with the economic well-being of his family. He still has 2 years left to be able to finish his studies.

The only obstacle he has encountered during his entire time studying is economic, because he cannot pay the monthly fees for his course. Due to this he is coming to KIVA so they can support him and he will meet his goal of being an excellent professional. Without the support of KIVA, Christian would have to work enough to be able to pay for his studies, and that would take a lot of time away from him for studying.

Currently, he is doing his pre-professional internship at a component engineering business, where he is responsible for everything related to circuit design. The internships do not pay very well; he only receives tips.

He will use the loan requested from KIVA for the monthly payments for his course, since he will not run the risk of losing his studies due to lack of payment. The biggest dream he has in life is to be a designer in the electronics field, contribute to innovation, and make his country grow technologically.      

Christian wants to say a few words to the KIVA members: "I am very grateful to receive this support. This teaches me to be someone who helps the next person, who believes in the dreams of others, and to be kind-hearted. Thank you for everything and for placing your confidence in me."

loans.use: to pay the debt for his Technician in Electronic Engineering course and to be able to become an excellent professional

loans.name: Muong Phang 40 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nua, 25, is a Thai ethnic lady who is married and the mother of a 6-year-old girl. She lives with her in-laws, her husband and her daughter in a Thai ethnic traditional house in a small remote village. Mrs. Nua and her husband work very hard at agricultural production for a living with several activities such as growing rice, breeding pigs, chickens, ducks and buffalo.

She had to drop out of school early and she feels that as one of her disadvantage, so she wants her child to get the best education. For that reason, she has tried to increase production to improve earnings for her family and send her child to school. This is the second time that she has taken out a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program and she will use the loan to buy food for the pigs and chickens. She hopes that with the support of the agricultural workers of the Program, her production will go well and help her reap good profit.

Mrs. Nua dreams a more abundant life for her family and a bright future for her child. In the picture, she stands at the first from the right.

loans.use: to buy food for the pigs and chickens

loans.name: Roque

texts.en:
Roque has been a vegetable farmer for the past six years. He grows eggplant and sili (hot chilis) He lives in the rural town of Carmen, Bohol. He is a single man.

Roque faces challenges in earning his livelihood: the lack of capital and the high cost of farm maintenance. He would like to buy fertilizer, vegetable seedlings, and chemicals. These would help him boost and improve the yield of his farm. Thus, he could produce bountiful harvests and eventually get higher earnings.


He hopes that someday he will become successful and his business sustainable, going toward financial stability.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, vegetable seedlings, and chemicals.

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en: Merlina is a loving wife, and a mother of two grown children. Her husband is her partner in growing their business. Before, she manages a retailing business. With her desire to gain bigger income, Merlina decide to close her retailing business, but she start another business. Merlina is enjoying her present business which is buying and selling of used bottles, and scrap materials. Her earnings from the business, serve as her children allowances and fees in school when they are still sending to school. Now, Merlina’s children already employed. Merlina wants to sustain her business for continues source of income. With this, she is asking for a loan of P25,000 to buy used bottles, and scrap materials. She is doing her best to manage well her business, and look towards the growth of it.

loans.use: to buy used bottles, and scrap materials.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 48 years old and has three children. He is a contractor and hardware store proprietor in Kilifi, Kenya, which he has been doing for 11 years with the support of his spouse.

Julius requested his fourth loan from VisionFund Kenya, which he will use to purchase roofing nails, iron sheets, and timber for his hardware shop. With the anticipated profits, he will be able to repay his loan. He hopes to own a big hardware stall in future.

loans.use: to purchase roofing nails, iron sheets, and timber

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es:
Marleny es una mujer soltera de 48 años de edad, mujer cabeza de familia que siempre le ha gustado el trabajo independiente, inicio en el año 1999 un salón de belleza el cual le ha dado de comer por todo este tiempo, aumentando su calidad de vida y permitiéndole progresar en su vida.
Desde que inició con su actividad persigue un objetivo de comprar una vivienda, sigue firme en su propósito.
Actualmente hay mucho negocio de salón de belleza, barberías, la competencia es muy fuerte, a pesar de que tiene clientes fieles de años, quiere atraer clientela nueva pero su principal inconveniente es que estos se dejan llevar por un diseño y una fachada. Este el motivo que lleva a señora Marleny a solicitar un préstamo para completar el dinero necesario para adecuar visualmente su negocio, también comprará lava-cabezas, espejo y mesas nuevas.
texts.en:
Marleny is a 48 years old single woman. She is a woman, head of the family, who has always liked independent work. She started a beauty salon in 1999, which has allowed her to have an income during all this time, increasing her quality of life and allowing her to progress in life.

Since she started with this activity, she strives as an objective to buy a property, and she remains steadfast in her goal.

Nowadays there are many beauty saloon and hairdresser businesses, and the competition is very strong. Even though she has loyal customers for years, she wants to attract a new customer base, but her main disadvantage is that they are driven by design and the outside look. This is the reason that brings Marleny to request a loan to supplement the needed capital to adapt visually her business. She will also buy a hairdressing wash basin, a mirror and new tables.

loans.use: supplement the capital needed to visually adapt her business. She will also buy a hairdressing wash basin, a mirror and new tables.

loans.name: Viola

texts.en:
Viola is 27 years old, married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Viola has a fishing business in the Philippines. Viola requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Viola has been in this business for five years. In the future, Viola would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Rafaela Santos

texts.es:
Rafaela, de 59 años de edad, no pudo estudiar, porque desciende de una familia grande, en donde sus padres no podían darles a todos sus hijos la oportunidad de estudiar; ella es viuda, hace tres años su esposo falleció y desde ese día ella ha sido la responsable directa de su familia, tuvo 6 hijos pero 4 ya se casaron, en su casa solo vive con dos dos hijos y una nieta. 

Rafaela, hace tortillas, tamales y pan para vender, ella aprendió a hacer todos estos productos desde pequeña, pero desde que murió su esposo, los elabora para vender y generar ingresos para su familia, ella sale a vender casa por casa los tamales y los panes y solo las tortillas las vende en la casa. 

Rafaela, necesita el préstamo para comprar frijoles, maíz, especias y gallinas para la elaboración de los tamales. 

Su sueño es tener un negocio más grande y en un solo local para evitarse andar casa por casa en su comunidad y aprovechar ese tiempo para hacer algo más.
texts.en:
Rafaela, 59 years old, was not able to go to school because she is descended from a large family and her parents could not give all their children the opportunity to study. She is a widow; three years ago, her husband died, and since that day she has been directly responsible for her family. She had 6 children, but 4 are already married. In her house, she only lives with two children and one granddaughter.

Rafaela makes tortillas, tamales, and bread to sell. She learned to make all these products from the time she was young, but since her husband died, she makes them to sell and generate income for her family. She goes out to sell the tamales and the bread door to door, and she sells only the tortillas at home.

Rafaela needs the loan to buy beans, corn, spices, and chickens to make the tamales.

Her dream is to have a bigger business and just one location in order to avoid walking door to door in her community and to take advantage of that time to do something more.

loans.use: to buy beans, corn, spices, and chickens to make tamales

loans.name: Klodjan

texts.en: Klodjan lives in the house seen in the photograph with his elderly parents and married siblings. " Our house is in a very bad shape and we need to make some immediate repairs to it. The winter will be here soon and it will be difficult for us living under such circumstances," said Klodjan to the loan officer during the interview.

loans.use: to make some basic repairs to the home seen in the background of the photograph

loans.name: Kavule Devt Goup Bweyogerere Group

texts.en:
Ruth (in front on phone) is a repeat client in Ugafode microfinance, previously applied for a loan of 1500,000/=. She is a married woman with children. She is a business woman who operates a clothes shop and she is a hard working lady.

In a bid to increase on her working capital, she has applied for a loan of UGX2000.000/=. She is however faced with a challenge of competition and limited capital to boost her business by buying more clothes for selling, so that she will sell to meet the demands of her customers.

She is very grateful for the support Ugafode microfinance and Kiva lenders offered to her since she is now able to fund her business.
The gentleman extreme right behind is only saving with the group apparently. He will get the loan during the next cycle.

loans.use: to boost business by buying more clothes for selling.

loans.name: Tanimu

texts.en:
Tanimu is maize farmer from Dokan Tagwai village. As a member of Babban Gona, Tanimu is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Tanimu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Tanimu can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 
Tanimu is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Nadabo

texts.en:
Nadabo is a maize farmer from Galadima village. As a Babban Gona member, Nadabo is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tons of Maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Nadabo would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Nadabo can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Nadabo no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Nadabo hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Nuvia Maria

texts.es:
Ella es Nuvia, mujer emprendedora, luchadora, verraca, una campesina la cual tiene un cultivo pero que en los ratos libres se dedica a la cría de ganado porcino.
Aprendió de sus actividades empíricamente, realiza su actividad por gusto, por ego, pro satisfacer sus necesidades, deseos y mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, reparar su casa, tener terrenos, en pocas palabras, trabajar por progresar no solo pro subsistir.
Nuvia tiene sus cultivos en etapa de maduración, necesita un préstamo para abonarlos y aplicarle venenos para alejar plagas.
Dichos productos son vendidos en la plaza y representan la mayor parte de ingresos de la cliente.
texts.en:
She is Nuvia, an enterprising person, a woman determined to do everything possible to move forward in spite of difficulty. She is a rural person with crops who also in her free moments raises pigs.
She learned her work activity through her own experience. She works for taste and personal pride, to satisfy her needs and wants, to improve her dwelling conditions, repair her home, own a plot of land, in sum, she works to progress and not just to subsist.
Nuvia's crops are ripening and she needs a loan to fertilize them and apply pesticides to get rid of infestations.
Her products are sold in the plaza and represent the majority of her income.

loans.use: to fertilize and apply pesticides to her crops.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is responsible mother of 6 children and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 3 years. He is responsible to fulfill the needs of entire family. He needs to do maintenance of his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good it requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to make maintenance of his taxi. Therefore Kousar has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan Kousar's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily. And provide the better transport facilities to earn the profitable income. Kousar also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.
Kousar is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the cost of her husband repairing his taxi.

loans.name: Nergjivane

texts.en:
Nergjivane is a mother of two children and has recently started a new business with her husband, opening a Fitness Center. She is very happy with her new business and has been able to provide a needed and unique business in their area. Not only does her center have designated hours for women only from 08:00 until 16:00 (4 pm) and then for men from 16:00 until midnight, but it is also the only fitness center in her community. This guarantees that their business will be successful and well received.

Nergivane is now requesting a loan of 2000 Euros in order to purchase more equipment for clients to use. She is hoping that in the future they will be able to expand their business even more, making it larger and having more selections, options, and services.

loans.use: to purchase more equipment for her Fitness Center so as to attract more clients.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is 40 years old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan and the mother of 4 children and her husband is only responsible to fulfill the needs of entire family. Shabana has also been doing her business of clothes selling for past 3 years and contributes her income with her husband to manage the house hold.

Shabana needs to buy different types of clothes for reselling purpose but due to insufficient financial means she is not in the position to buy these clothes, therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she can purchase the clothes easily to fulfill her business needs, so that she can earn more profitable income to support her family and business.
On this financial assistance Shabana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her clothing business.

loans.name: Vivi

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Vivi, who is a 31-year-old married woman with one son. Vivi and her husband have been selling vegetables for seven years. 

She has asked for a loan of IDR 7.000,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build a water source at their home to improve access to clean water and sanitation for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources, but Vivi will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all lenders.

loans.use: to build a water source at their home to improve access to clean water and sanitation for their family.

loans.name: Naboth

texts.en:
Naboth is a hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda.  He used his previous loan to buy building materials which he thought would complete his latrine. He did good work but the money was not enough. He is physically powerful, active and works long hours throughout the week. He has been in bar and livestock businesses for the past 7 years to earn more income for his family. He also carries out farming on a small scale to make sure his family does not lack anything.His dream is to have diversified sources of income, expand his business but his main challenge is inadequate capital to achieve all his dreams and also unfavorable weather conditions.
Naboth is requesting for a loan to buy building materials like cement to finish up his house and toilet.

loans.use: to buy building materials like cement to finish up his house and toilet.

loans.name: Dina Luz

texts.es: Dina de 31 años es habitante de un barrio ubicado en el municipio de Barranquilla, ella vive en compañía de su familia en una humilde casa del sector, allí funciona su venta de comidas rápidas que diariamente atiende a partir de las 6 p.m. hasta las 10 p.m. y se extiende cuando tiene buenas ventas.  Esta actividad la inició en el año 2010 y su principal motivación fue el hecho de ayudar a su cónyuge con los gastos en el hogar al considerar que existía un gran potencial en su vivienda que está ubicada en una calle principal donde transitan vehículos y con ello muchas personas.  El principal desafío para alcanzar sus metas ha sido los trabajos poco remunerados que su pareja consigue, sin embargo con escasos recursos logró comprar la indumentaria necesaria para emprender su venta de comidas. En la actualidad realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para ampliar la oferta de productos, es por ello que invertirá en carnes frías, panes, vegetales, aderezos y demás. Dina sueña con tener su casa propia y ofrecer a sus dos hijos una educación de calidad que contribuya a un futuro promisorio para ellos.
texts.en:
Dina is 31 years old and a resident of a neighborhood located in the town of Barranquilla. She lives with her family in a humble house in the area. From there she runs her fast food business, which she tends to from 6:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m., hours that she extends when sales are good. She started this business in 2010. Her principal motivation was to help her partner with the household expenses, considering that there was great potential in her house as it is located on a major street that cars and many people pass through.

The principal challenge to meeting her goals has been that the jobs her partner gets are low paying. Nevertheless, with their limited resources they were able to buy the inventory necessary to start her sale of food. She currently seeks a loan, a Kiva loan, an opportunity to link herself to the world of financing through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, to expand the products she offers. Because of that, she will invest in cold cuts, breads, vegetables, dressings and other things. Dina dreams of having her own house and offering to her two children a quality eduction that will contribute to a promising future for them.

loans.use: invest in cold cuts, breads, vegetables, and dressings, among other things.

loans.name: Slavica

texts.en:
Slavica is very thankful to the lenders for the previous loan that she has used for her greenhouse. Now for the second time she is in need of a loanbut for a different business, making natural drinks from fresh fruits.
